Reviews.Title: “Not as great as I was expecting.”
Reviews.Author: Chesty1
Reviews.Content: Recently completed 6 nights at the Boardwalk Inn and reading some of the previous rooms I wonder if I had the same resort. Firstly the positives,the hotel is very stunning and the grounds immaculate. I liked the whole boardwalk effect,although I found the dining options quite limited. The Disney transport works quite well,although we often found it better to get off at the Swan and walk back as we always seemed to be the last stop. Enjoyed the extra magic hours access,although the parks were not too crowded so this was not an essential perk at this time. Beds were also fantastic. Now the negatives, from when we arrived, no one bothered to assist with our luggage or greet us in any way. The check in staff could not have been more disinterested. Hardly engaging or friendly at all and not a great start to our stay. I also found the rooms to be very noisy. The walls are paper thin to the point you can hear a normal conversation next door. Also the plumbing is very noisy. While its a nice hotel, I really found it lacking,considering what they charge. Is it value for money? No. Would I recommend? No

Reviews.Title: “WOW....WOW...WOW”
Reviews.Author: clamchowda
Reviews.Content: We had the best experience at Disney's Boardwalk Inn last week and probably rank this resort up there with our top 5 favorites. We've stayed at many of the Disney resorts and over the years have come to expect "just mediocre." Well, Disney has won us back with this last trip. Everything was just perfect; rooms were spotless clean, service was tremendous and the food was delicious. We actually had to remind ourselves a couple times that we were, in fact, still at a Disney resort. Great job Disney, I really think you are back! And - we'll be back too, sooner than later!! As a matter of fact, we re-booked while there for a trip before Christmas! :)

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: jo m
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the boardwalk for 2 nights last weekend. it was a great experience. we were able to walk to epcot (3 minute walk) and walk to hollywood studios (6 minute walk). the bus ride to the magic kingdom was a little long, mostly because of the stops at the swan and dolphin. i would recommend walking over to the dolphin (4 minute walk) and catching the bus there. we ate at the flying fish (on the boardwalk) one night for dinner and at il mulino (at the swan) the 2nd night. the food and service at both restaurants was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Always Good”
Reviews.Author: 2Here4Fun
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Disney Boardwalk on business. There is a certain level of consistency Disney delivers and the Boardwalk was on target again. Clean well kept room really good service and delightful to inter act with the Disney "Cast and Crew". Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “A value if good at time management, expensive if not”
Reviews.Author: JMH_10
Reviews.Content: If Disney's Grand Floridian is a 5-star resort, Boardwalk is a 4-star. The lobby décor / ambience / atmosphere is out of a fairy tale and the boardwalk itself is a great replica of the East Coast shore. Our trip was during spring break and with two kids (ages nine and eight). During this trip we stayed at a Universal Studios property (Loews Royal Pacific) and the Disney experience is far superior: absolutely will return to Disney and not likely to return to Universal/Loews. Positives: Location is ideal with a short walk to Epcot, boat to Hollywood Studios and prompt bus service to rest of WDW (buses seem to be more frequent than those at less expensive Disney resorts). It is easy to be at any of the parks at opening, return to the pool without wasting time on a bus or in a car, clean up before dinner, and quickly get to some of the nicer restaurants in the area (Flying Fish is by far one of the best fish restaurants in WDW). Service standards are always the among highest in the hospitality industry. At arrival, a cast member greeted the children by name and escorted us to a seating area in the lobby (**use on-line check-in**). While seated on a couch (no line/no waiting), the cast member gave us a folder with room keys, assorted maps and other information about the boardwalk area. The cast member entertained our kids while a concierge assisted us with ticket concerns. Since the ticket concerns took several minutes to resolve, the concierge gave us a pass to skip to the front of the line at any ride and apologized repeatedly for the inconvenience. Always communicate concerns/problems. Amusements for younger kids include a good pool (small water slide the kids love) and entertainers on the boardwalk (juggling, card tricks, etc) provide a great alternative to the parks after running hard all day. Extra Magic Hours. Disney hotel guests are admitted to the parks an hour before the general public. During the busy seasons, it's the difference between accomplishing everything you want in a park during one day or having to return a second day because most of your time is spent waiting in lines. Negatives: No kid's club (Beach Club resort is across the lake, just a nice, and has a kids club). Rooms showing signs of age. Rooms are not as spacious as a 5-star hotel but lay out is functional, bed/couch is comfortable, and very clean (even in bathroom corners and grout). That being said, the volume of guests is taking its toll on woodwork/doors and will need more than just fresh paint in the near future. In short, Disney has calculated the cost of happiness and it is expensive (I would not spend $500/night to go to WDW at any resort). If you do your homework, plan everything in advance, and make the most of every minute, it will be worth it. Having averaged a week at a Disney resort every other year for the past ten years, our experience has been consistently favorable with any issues (inevitable at a 500-room hotel) dealt with quickly and favorably.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: headnerd
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Boardwalk as a Disney Vacation Club (DVC) member on points. We have stayed at this resort on a couple other occasions and had problems on one occasion with a smelly carpet in the room. We requested a room change and had to schlep our own luggage to the new room. There was no offer to come get it for us or to bring the keys - we had to return to the front desk. This time was worse. After an electrical problem in the bathroom was not fixed for over 5 hours we were switched to another room but again had to move ourselves with no help from the staff, no compensation for our inconvenience other than a late checkout (2 hours - it was our last night). My wife even had to go to the front desk to talk to the managers. They would not come to our room, and this is a LARGE hotel, so it was quite a walk to the lobby. They said that all they could do for us was the late checkout because we were staying on DVC points. I guess if we had been regular hotel guest they could have done something for us, but I can't imagine why that would make a difference. In fact, one would think that the DVC members would be treated better because of their repeat visits. No "Disney Magic" here. The Boardwalk needs to get its act together. We will avoid this facility in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay at The Boardwalk Inn”
Reviews.Author: need2travel2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boardwalk Inn April 6-12, 2012 & really had a great time. The hotel itself is lovely w/ all the victorian touches, the pastel colors & overstuffed furniture made it a great place to come "home" to after a long day at the parks. We were there for Easter Week and were very surprised at how quiet the hotel was. We had a standard view room overlooking a very pretty courtyard w/ lots of pretty flowers blooming. The room was very clean & quite a good size (we were just 2 people-my husband & myself). We enjoyed the BelleVue lounge most evenings as well too, it's a great place to kick back & have a drink either before or after dinner. In addition to the lounge the BelleVue also has a nice balcony that you can sit out on-we did that several nights & even caught a glimpse of fireworks one night-Wishes at the Magic Kingdom maybe? This was our second stay at the Boardwalk & the transportation options cannot be beat-it's a 5 minute stroll into the International Gateway at Epcot & a 10 minute walk along the river to Hollywood Studios-there is a boat to both parks as well but we chose to walk instead. We even walked thru Epcot & took the monorail to the Magic Kingdom, the Polynesian & Grand Floridian as well. The restaurants on the Boardwalk are great as well, The Flying Fish is our favorite restaurant anywhere & the boardwalk atmosphere is really fun. The only downside (& it's a minor one!) is that The Boardwalk Inn doesn't have a counter service restaurant. That's fine for lunch & dinner but sometimes you want something more for breakfast than the fare at the Bakery & we find the breakfast at Kouzzina's (sit down restaurant) leaves a bit to be desired-how can you mess up scrambled eggs??) So. long story short-the Boardwalk Inn is a terrific place to stay & we will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Experience”
Reviews.Author: MrCottage
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience with staying onsite at a Disney property. We were not disappointed and very impressed with the service, room accomodations and location of the Boardwalk. First, we stayed at a "cottage suite" which has 2 levels. The downstairs is the living area with a pull out (large) couch, which was comfortable. The second level had a large king size bed and comfortable furniture. It worked for us. We also had access (for a fee) to the club level and it was worth the expense. The food was delicious (small portions as it is not a restaurant) and the staff couldn't have been better. The Boardwalk is a great location and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly amazing... once again”
Reviews.Author: jenniferjenk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boardwalk in again this year. We have 3 children so our accomodation choices are limited at Disney. We stayed once again in the Deluxe Club Level room and once agian it was awesome. First, the Club Level is the only way to go with 3 or more kids. the breakfast selection this year was even better than last year. The Deluxe room is massive with 2 televisions so one can watch toddler shows and another can watch bigger kid shows. The Lounge is usually playing news in the am and the Disney channel in the pm, so if one of the kids just needs a break form their siblings it is a great place to relax. The pool is by far one of the reasons we will probalby never book at another Disney hotel. Last winter the slide was closed for refurbishment, but this winter my kids were on the slide non-stop from the moment we got to the pool until the moment we left. Even my husband and I enjoyed it a few times. The Boardwalk is definitely the place to be in the evening. Our kids love to just walk around and watch the acts, even if they have seen them before, they are all really entertaining. They love to play the carnival games, you pretty much always win a prize which adds to the magic. There is agreat big lawn in front of the balcony and my son ran around with several other boys one night just kicking the ball he'd just won. The proximity to Epcot and HS is also a huge plus. You can be at HS in 10 minutes on the boat (we usually get there first thing to do Jedi Training so a quick trip inthe morning is nice.) And we walk to and from Epcot, it is a beautiful walk. It is nice for my husband and I to walk back in the evening for a date night as well. We've eaten at the Bakery, Seaside Sweets, and The Flying Fish many times, all fabulous. This year the service at The Flying Fish was a little off, it took a really long time to get the kids fed. But usually we have a head waiter and an assistant and this year there was just the waiter, so he was a little overwhelmed. We highly recommend The Boardwalk, and highly recommend the club level if you have a lot of mouths to feed. There is food there ALL DAY LONG. You can have a quick breakfast and head out, then have a cold beer or soda and snacks waiting when you return. My only tip would be that this is the second time we have done the dining plan (the one quick serve plus one sit down one) and this is the second time that we had a TON of food left over at the end of the trip. We drive from NY so we use the extra meals and snacks to take home, but we had a lot of them. When you go Club Level there is so much food and drink in the lounge I'm not sure the dining plan is a necessity. Next time we will try without it and then I'll put a review about how it went. I am rating the Value as a 4 below because even though this is an expensive resort, you get soooooooo much for the money, especially when you do the club Level.

Reviews.Title: “Almost right”
Reviews.Author: Keith F
Reviews.Content: This hotel benefits from an ideal location right out the back door (International Gateway) of Epcot. The one and only drawback we found was that there is an absolute absence of a food court, either in or on Boardwalk, or at a nearby hotel (YC, BC or the Swolfin). That means no easy coffee and bagel access. The BC has a mini-food court but, for the BW, it's either a small bar (Belle Vue Room) or the Boardwalk Bakery - both of which are woefully inadequate. We were fortunate enough to have a 5th floor room overlooking the rear of the France pavilion. Watching the Illuminations show every night from your private balcony with a glass of wine in your hand is a huge plus.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location. Good Wheelchair Room. Great Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Bookman54
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice in 2011, as a change from Animal Kingdom Lodge. First time we had a wheelchair room on the 3rd floor. Shower has lip that interferes with shower wheelchair, but can be managed. Second time was on the 2nd floor - no lip - flush entrance into shower, plus no elevator since you are on lobby level. Advantages: * Easy stroll/roll into the back end of Epcot * Reasonable stroll/roll to Hollywood Studios - or leisurely boat ride * Plenty of eating choices on the Boardwalk * No sense of crowd in hotel FIVE STAR PLUS: New Year's Eve on Boardwalk gives you THREE, count them: Epcot, Movie Studios and Magic Kingdom - 3 fireworks extravaganzas!!! Plus party on lawn of the resort. Disadvantages: * No in-hotel restaurant except bar serves limited breakfast. Answer: You're on the Boardwalk - get outside for lots of options. * No terry robes. Work-around: We asked, Disney delivered from another resort. * Housekeeping was not 100% on top of it - some days were not perfect. Quick call handled any missing items. Next day usually cleaned the missed area. * Mattress had seen better days. Did request and receive a bed board which helped. * Only one small elevator from lobby level to Boardwalk, by bar. A few times there was a short wait with strollers / power chairs / wheelchairs backed up. * Not inexpensive, but amenities were a bit stripped down (see terry robes above). Conclusion: It's worth the trade-offs to us. We're booked for another visit. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good experience but expected an excellent one”
Reviews.Author: thebestbeach
Reviews.Content: I've been to Disney World many times and lived in the Disney developed town of Celebration for a couple of years, so I know Disney World well. My favorite location to stay is the Epcot Resorts area because I usually end up at Epcot at night and I like the fact that I can walk out of Epcot and be right near my hotel. This was my first stay at Boardwalk Inn, although I've stayed at The Beach Club many times in the past. What I liked about Boardwalk Inn was: It's location. The very comfortable mattress. The large room size. The pools. What I didn't like about Boardwalk Inn was: On my second day the room was only partially cleaned. Dirty towels remained in the room and pillows weren't put back on the bed. No robes in the room. Disney advertised its own special gel pillow for sale, but when I asked for one to test during my stay I was told that none were available at this hotel. Admittedly the problems were relatively minor, but I thought Boardwalk Inn was considered one of Disney's top of the line hotels, so I expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding resort”
Reviews.Author: citrob
Reviews.Content: No doubt, Disney can be an expensive vacation, and the Boardwalk is no exception. But the Boardwalk exceeded my expectations in every way. And while it was already a special occasion for us to stay at a deluxe resort, we splurged for the club level and found the experience well worth the extra expense. Check in couldn't have been easier with folks greeting us by name, helping with bags, and whisking us up to our room in a matter of a few minutes. The process was fast, but I never felt rushed. And everyone we met had a smile and cheerful greeting. We had a king room overlooking the boardwalk. And thank you, thank you, thank you...they had a full-size crib waiting for my two-year old (he won't sleep in a pack-n-play). When making reservations, I had people give me different info: some said only pack-n-plays were available and others said cribs might be available. I was glad to see that they actually had cribs and that one was available for my son. Our room was very comfortable and quiet. The bed was very nice and easy to fall into after a day at the Parks. I never heard the activities from the boardwalk unless I opened the door to the balacony. Everything was very clean and elegant with just the right amount of Disney touches. Access to the lounge was a highlight. The staff were always a delight, giving us helpful suggestions and making my son laugh for a few minutes with peek-a-boo game across the room. It sounds a bit oxymoronic, but they manage to pull off a very elegant room while still making it a fun environment for a (pretty well-behaved) toddler. Some reviewers weren't wild about the food, but I found breakfast, evening, and late evening offerings to be quite good. The mid-day offering was pretty sparse, but I still found great value in coming in to cool off with beverages and some light snacks. And sure, they didn't have bacon and eggs at breakfast, but the oatmeal was really good...the fruit was really fresh...the pastries were really tasty...and so on. They didn't put out a huge spread, but the stuff they offered was good. We even cancelled our dinner reservations in Epcot after filling up on the evening food and beer/wine. So you get good food, and really, the expense of club level almost pays for itself when you avoid buying meals. Of course, the food is part of the attraction in Epcot, but my point is I never had to buy food because I needed it....I got food in the park because I couldn't resist crepes or the fish'n'chips. Access to the parks was easy. Walking to Epcot was great; just keep in mind that you come in behind England and that the World Showcase doesn't usualy open right away (you can't turn right into France, you go left toward Future World). Not a huge deal, but if your goal is to be first in line at major attractions, visitors at the front gate will likely beat you to the rides up front. The bus ride to and from Magic Kingdom was about 12 minutes (direct from MK to Boardwalk) and 20 minutes (from Boardwalk to MK with stops at Swan/Dolphin). I liked having all the different ways to get around: we could walk, boat, bus, or catch the monorail after walking through Epcot. I highly recommend the Boardwalk, particularly if you like Epcot. It was a great place to stay and made our visit to the parks with a toddler much easier. Admittedly it's pricey, but I never found myself thinking about the cost because I felt I received even more than what I paid for in return.

Reviews.Title: “Great ambiance and theming”
Reviews.Author: karl_d_rss
Reviews.Content: Normally we stay at Beach Club Resort when we want to be close to Epcot, but decided to try out Boardwalk Inn on a quick 2 day trip to Epcot over Spring Break. The walk is minimally longer to the International Gateway from Boardwalk compared to Beach Club. The ambiance through the afternoon and into evening/night on the Boardwalk is great and a lot of fun. Normally the resorts are pretty lifeless after 9pm, in my experience, but the Boardwalk had a lot of action. We had a room overlooking the water and the Boardwalk itself, looking at Beach Club, and noise was never an issue. The view was great. We could even see the Magic Kingdom fireworks from the balcony, although it was pretty far away. The room was very comfortable, top notch typical Disney Deluxe Resort class... quality linens, adequate space. The Boardwalk pool is nice, with a great clown-face twisty slide, but not as good as Beach Club. I'd recommend Boardwalk Inn and Villas to anyone wanting to stay close to Epcot.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to paradise”
Reviews.Author: Trip T
Reviews.Content: This resort is the closest way to get to the north atlantic boardwalks back when they were in there in there glory days. We stayed in the boardwalk vacation club villas and as usual, counters, furniture and everything was spotless. All of the Disney resorts in my opinion always live up to the five star standards. The biggest thing I can suggest is that you save up the money because the hotel is in disneys deluxe resort catagory. From the excellent nightlife to the astonishing pool,which has a slide themed to a roller coaster, this is a place that will definitely not disappoint you.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: karajeboo
Reviews.Content: This may be my favorite of all WDW resorts - I've stayed here 3 times, once for my honeymoon, once on a girls weekend, and most recently in December for a family celebration of my parents' 50th anniversary. First of all, I love Epcot, so this is the PERFECT location for wandering over to Epcot through the International Gateway, for dinner in the evening, or just to grab a drink in World Showcase. You can walk to either Epcot or Hollywood Studios, or take the boat to either. And there is so much to do on the Boardwalk itself. There are jugglers and comedians for children, stop in Flying Fish, Big River Grill or ESPN club for a drink, or wander over to the the beach at the Beach Club. Inside you can grab a drink in the Bellevue Room. The rooms at Boardwalk are large for WDW resorts, clean, tastefully decorated, and very quiet. We have had views of the boardwalk (not at all noisy like you might think!), and views of Epcot twice so we could watch Illuminations from our room. The only drawback is that there is no food court for morning coffee so you have to walk outside to the Boardwalk Bakery. Such a beautiful, whimsical resort, really takes you back to the turn of the century boardwalk feel.....

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Boardwalk Inn”
Reviews.Author: ZenSwan77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to WDW with my parents...staying in two concierge rooms at the Boardwalk Inn. We are repeat guests at the Boardwalk and find this hotel the ideal location to visit our favorite parks...Epcot/Hollywood Studios. The hotel is easy walking distance to Epcot/Hollywood Studios and it is nice to have the boat shuttles back to the hotel after a long day of touring these parks. We have stayed both concierge Boardwalk view/concierge Boardwalk garden view and find that both room locations have been quiet for sleeping. The concierge staff has always been very warm and welcoming...it is pleasure to interact with them. The only less than positive change has been that the concierge lounge food selections have declined with regard to food quality/variety. I do not think this change is Boardwalk specific but is an across the board cost cutting in all Disney hotel concierge level lounges. As far as dining, there are no quick service dining options located in the hotel but there are numerous places to grab a snack on the Boardwalk outside the hotel and at theYacht/Beach Club/Epoct. For more formal dining we love the Flying Fish Restaurant located at the Boardwalk Inn. We find that the bus service to the other WDW parks/hotels is adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Disney Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week long vacation at Disney's Boardwalk Inn with our 3 children. This is our 5th Walt Disney World vacation in 7 years. We have stayed at 3 other deluxe Disney properties and this one was definitely on par with them (Beach Club, Wilderness Lodge and Animal Kingdom Lodge). Our check-in was flawless--I did the Online Check-in before we arrived and we were greeted in the lobby with our keys and package information--we never even went to the front desk. Our room was very clean and large. There was a couch that pulled out for an extra bed and we had a huge balcony overlooking the boardwalk. Our children loved the pool and the big slide. All of the staff was attentive and friendly. We loved the proximity to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. We had Park Hopper tickets and ate dinner in Epcot most of the nights we were there. We all loved all of the activity on the boardwalk at night--lots of performers & lots of activity. The transportation to the Magic Kingdom and Animal Kingdom was easy, breezy. We never waited more than a few minutes for a bus. The Boardwalk Inn is our new family favorite at Walt Disney World!

Reviews.Title: “Very conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: kathie859
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here 3 times--each time club level. The beds are comfortable and the staff excellent and you can walk to EPCOT and Disney Hollywood Studios. Club level allows access to a lounge with a light breakfast, snacks and drinks during the day, appetizers and drinks in the early evening and desserts and cordials at night. The only negative is that for the money, I've stayed in much nicer rooms that called themselves "deluxe".

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Time!”
Reviews.Author: 944carlie
Reviews.Content: I would love to share a big thank you from us,i went with 2 children and 3 adults we really felt the disney 'magic'!The rooms were all clean,also the space is great.I would go again

Reviews.Title: “Very beautiful, but you do not feel the Disney magic”
Reviews.Author: mdoria_rlk
Reviews.Content: I had problems already in the arrival: the check in was confused, I had asked a disable twin beds room with tube. It seemed they could not find my reservation made two months before. The employees not friendly at all. I was obliged to pay in advance because I wanted to pay with money at the chck-out. I could hardly believe I was at a Disney Hotel. When I arrived from the park at night, I had to move three times from a bedroom to another, untill they put me in a proper one. The hotel is very beautiful and confortable, but they do not seem to care too much about the guest. It values for the views and environment, besides you can go on foot to Epcot. The Boarwalk is not like it used to be anymore: there are no more shows and the party vibration it used to have.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: cjfry
Reviews.Content: As with many Disney resorts, I must say I love this one! The rooms a spacious and clean. The boardwalk area has restaurants, stores and nighttime entertainment! The pool area is gorgeous and all the services here are great. For dinner, try Cat Cora's restaurant here (ask for Dale, he's great) or you could try Flying Fish (ask for Abu, also great). For a beer and GREAT snack food, try Big River Brewery! The beers are great, I recommend the beer sampler and nachos! For nighttime entertainment I recommend Jellyrolls... they have the best dueling piano bar I've even been too (though the cover charge felt steep). In any event it is an absolute blast! The very BEST part of the boardwalk... you can walk to Hollywood studios, Walk to Epcot and with a park hopper pass, you can walk through Epcot and board the monorail to Magic Kingdom, its just wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant disney experience!”
Reviews.Author: amsmithsan
Reviews.Content: This was our first Disney experience where we stayed onsite. While I was a little apprehensive about booking a spring break family trip to Disney World, our hotel experience completely erased all apprehension I had! We stayed club level with two small children (under 8). We were greeted as we exited the bus and taken right up to our room. There was breakfast, snacks, wine and beer, dessert and a view of Epcot fireworks from the lounge. There was always plenty of food and beverages for all. Seating sometimes was a little crowded but within a few minutes we could find someplace to sit or we could take the food/beverages back to our room. The pool was perfect for our kids and each afternoon there were kid activities right there at the pool. Our daughter especially enjoyed a hula hoop contest and the slide. It seemed as there was a nice mix of convention and families when we were there. Considering the number of families there the room we were in was very quiet. Our room looked out over the boardwalk and we didn't really notice any additional noise that was bothersome. We were an easy walk to Epcot and Hollywood studios (often walked to Dolphin and then took boat from there). The bus to Magic Kingdom was short but the one to Animal Kingdom was a bit longer and the ride home seemed quite a bit longer because of the stop at the water park. This was an ideal location for us, close to dining and a couple of parks and lots of boardwalk entertainment. Our kids would run from one entertainer to another along the boardwalk begging for just a few more minutes! The room was clean and very nice. The beds were comfortable and without request the housekeeper made up the daybed our first night. Our kids were in heaven - there own bed AND salt water taffy each night! Having the separate toilet/shower area and two sinks really sped up the getting ready. Also, we had a coffee maker and a mini fridge in the room, but we rarely used them because we just went down to the club lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Inn-Keepers Club (aka concierge level) was fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: hturner21
Reviews.Content: We weren't sure if the extra money would be worth it IT WAS! As soon as we walked INTO the lobby were greeted by name, taken up to the Inn-Keepers Club, and a private check-in was waiting. Our room was nice, clean, quiet, close to the concierge lounge, and perfect! A nice breakfast is included each morning, snacks & beverages throughout the day, wine or beer & great food for happy hour (you could almost eat dinner from the hummus & pita, vegetable, rice salad, lamb kabobs, empanadas, ahi tuna, etc!), and lastly decadent desserts & cordials late night. Pete, Anita, & Mary were three of our favorite staff members--very friendly & went out of their way to be kind & welcoming. Otherwise, the Boardwalk area is nice--a short walk to Epcot, shops & restaurants below, and other activities we didn't have time to take advantage of.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: lisa p
Reviews.Content: It was a magical experience. The staff was very friendly and made us feel at home. They were very accommodating. The room was very nice. I liked how the toilet and shower were separate from the vanity sink and mirror. It made it nice when we were all trying to get ready. The room was comfortable as were the beds. The pool was very nice and was heated on cooler days. We ate at the ESPN cafe and the Bg River Grill. Both restaurants were excellent. There was plenty of entertainment on the boardwalk that was entertaining for kids. Epcot and Hollywood Studios were a short walk/boat ride away. It was very convenient. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps the Disney People Are Listening....”
Reviews.Author: KevMoFo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1-bedroom villa for the second time in 3 years and we have not been disappointed. I know a lot of reviews have stated that the condition of the rooms are lacking. With the exception of the pullout couch (which probably needs replacing - but linens and mattress were fine) the room was near perfect. Disney must be listening to the complaints because it was clear that our room was freshly painted and all of the appliances and ceiling fans were newly replaced. Each day the room was thoroughly cleaned and the Disney quality control people came by to inspect the housekeeping performance and to be sure that things are being done right. In fact they even came in and cleaned the carpets in the main living area half way through our stay and it wasnt even needed. We found the staff very friendly and accommodating even though it was clear the they were slammed with check-ins and departures. They happily accommodated our request to be moved to a higher floor when we were checking in. Assuming that the Disney folks are following through on improving all the rooms at this resort, I would not hesitate to recommend others to stay here. It's in a good location near epcot and hollywood studios and the dining options right out on the boardwalk are fairly decent. All of which are pretty good to have after 4-5 days of riding buses back and forth to the other parks. The pools here are nice, big and well kept. The staff here have constant activities and games to keep the kids busy. There a couple of "quite pools" away from they main pool which are actually quite.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot Express How Great It Is”
Reviews.Author: ka p
Reviews.Content: Ok to start off, this is by far the best hotel that I have ever stayed at in my entire life. We are a family of four (kids ages 11 and 7) and usually spend a lot of time at MGM and EPCOT so this location is amazing. We stay at Beach Club sometimes too and love it but thats another story. :). We usually go two to three times a year. We love that we can come and go to two parks at ease and not spend the whole day there. One thing that we noticed that some people may call a problem but I don't think really counts as a problem, is the hallways smell like smoke and tend to be very hot. The maids and room service was amazing as well as concierge. Love this hotel!!!! Defently recommend and will return for the about 20th time this summer!!!!!! <3

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME service and weekend!”
Reviews.Author: FunHaHa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because the in-laws paid for the room. They've stayed in the past and enjoyed it. It was my husband's, mine, and 2 older children's (11 and 16) first time. We stayed on the club level. When we arrived to our 2 Queen room, we found we were in an adjoining room, and that is the only request my MIL had. And with what you pay- you would think it'd be granted. Unfortunately, there were no more rooms available. A very nice lady by the name of TIFFANY (awesome girl) made magic happen that weekend. We were given a 2 BEDROOM, 2 1/2 BATHROOM suite (yes, you read that right), that just happened to not be rented out, and didn't get charged anymore. She really was so happy to have been able to do that for us. She was lovely. The food was great on club level- the only thing I could say would be to widen the hot beverage area so it doesn't get congested. And, the only negative would be that the pool was freezing. Did NOT feel heated at all. Otherwise than that, we had a magical weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Couple Get Away”
Reviews.Author: Betty613
Reviews.Content: We just came back from staying at the Boardwalk Inn. Our time there was from February 26th to late afternoon on March 1st. This was our first stay at the Boardwalk Inn and it was a lovely stay. Our room was spacious, very nice furnishings, all in excellent condition and a large veranda overlooking the lake. Convenient to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. We picked up breakfast each morning at the Bakery on the Boardwalk, and had dinner at ESPN and at the Flying Fish. Loved both. The resort amenities were exceptional, great pools, and close to other restaurants, shopping and nighttime entertainment. The staff was exceptional also! Even though we did not have our kids with us, there were plenty of families staying at the Inn. They have an awesome pool for the kids and a quiet pool for the adults if they so choose. I would definitely stay at the Boardwalk Inn on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Norma R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boardwalk Inn August 13 to the 26 2011 for a family vacation to Disneyworld.What a pleasant surprise! We upgraded to water view and it was well worth it. Our room was on the third floor and overlooked the waterway connecting Epcot on one side and Hollywood studios on the other.Both were just a short walk or boat ride away.The view was amazing..it was great sitting on the balcony in the evening watching all the activity on the boardwalk.If you wanted to go to sleep early,once you closed the balcony door,it was never noisy.Also when you enter the parks from this location ,there is very little wait time to get into the park....far less people. There are several great restaurants and fast food places at this resort. Also, there is a shop where you can purchase food,wine confections,toys,clothes etc. There is a large sports bar ,a night club,dueling piano bar,ice cream and candy shop.....plus. There is entertainment on the boardwalk in the afternoon and evening...great for our grand children. When it rained,they brought the entertainment inside...the children loved the magic show. The pool and play area was great for our grand children.....never too busy. To sum it up..location couldn't have been better,our room was large for Disney standards.The only problem we had was with our fridge...it didn't work and we had to wait awhile to try and have it fixed.In the end they replaced it with a fridge that didn't fit and it stuck out in the walking area...not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Average rooms.”
Reviews.Author: gbruiz1
Reviews.Content: It's location a boat ride away from Epcot or Disney Studios can't be beaten. Also the Boardwalk atmosphere in the night is great. Expected more from the rooms given that it is a Deluxe hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mrzip
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the Boardwalk Inn January 2012 for four nights. This was our first time staying here. We booked a standard view club level room. I requested a boardwalk view (I understood that they have a few of this particular view for their standard rooms). We were on the fourth floor and we were given the view I requested. The gentleman checking us in indicated that the hotel was not full, therefore we would get this view. The room was clean and comfortable. The view from our room was spectular and it really felt like an upgrade. Although the balcony was small with two chairs and a small table, I spent a lot of time there watching the people on the boardwalk, the boats coming and going and just enjoying the lagoon views with the Yacht and Beach club in the distance. Housekeeping did a good job keeping the room clean. Our room did have a connecting door to another room and every morning, I could clearly hear the other people laughing and talking. Fortunately, this only lasted a short time each morning, but if you had loud neighbors, this could potentially be a problem. I've stayed at many Disney resorts including the values, moderates and deluxes and I think that the Boardwalk was among our favorites. The location to Epcot was great. It only took 5 - 10 minutes walk depending on how fast you walk or you could take the boat. The boat ramp was literally off the lobby. The Hollywood Studios was also a boat ride away. There were many great restaurant choices within walking distance to the Boardwalk Inn, including the Beach & Yacht Clubs Resorts, Epcot and all of the Boardwalk restaurants. I always felt that there was something going on in this area due to the restaurants, other resorts, shops and overall location. The Boardwalk Inn was my fourth resort trying the club level and was by far the best experience. I probably would not stay club level at the other resorts again,(unless I received an upgrade or fantastic discount) but I would definitely stay club level at the Boardwalk. The food presentations were very good as far as quality and presentation. Also, the employees working on the club level were among the friendliest I have found. They always seemed eager to answer questions or help with the food/beverages. We did not use the main pool although it looked like fun but we did use the quiet pool which was more private and very pretty. My son used the hotel's gym and enjoyed it. The lobby was beautiful but on the small side. I would imagine during busy times, it could be a bit crowded. All employees we encountered during our stay were helpful and professional. I would recommend this hotel to others and I am looking forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Seniors read”
Reviews.Author: flnana65
Reviews.Content: In May my son and his family was planning a vacation to Disney World. My daughter-in-law has a time share, so the place they stay is Boardwalk. This review is mostly for seniors. My husband could not go so I picked up my sister (and her walker) along the way and we made the trip together to meet my family. Overall I would say that the Boardwalk is very nice with nice people at the reception desk, etc. Clean, clean, clean. They have a cute pool with a slide coming from an elephant's mouth. So, if you are a senior and near the pool, be prepared for the noise of happy kids continuously. Don't think by staying in the room one day it will be quiet, causde some people stay by the pool with their kids all day. Also try and make sure that your room is not all the way out like ours was. My sister had to stop several times until she reached the entrance (and we were on the 1st floor). So locatiion of your room is the main thing. The Boardwalk part is nice. There are benches to sit. Stores to see, and entertainment at night. You can also get a ferry from the Boardwalk to take you to Epcot and Downtown Disney. The room was alittle small for two, but acceptable. Had a little microwave and some dishes. A sink besides the bathroom one and a frige - which was important for my sister's medicine. So enjoy yourself at Disney - just ask beforehand where your room is located.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Disney Hotel - Long hallways”
Reviews.Author: RSR-01
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Boardwalk, which is one of the nicer Disney hotels. There are a few things to be aware of when you stay here: The hotel is very long so request to stay somewhere in the middle of the hotel. There is no food at the pool, just a bar (it has bags of chips), so plan for that. If you want to eat on the Boardwalk plan in advance and make reservations at the restaurants. This is a great location for getting to Epcot or Hollywood Studios, you can walk to both of them, there is also a boat which will take you there. No kids - there is a "quiet pool" also so you can get away from the kid friendly pool if you desire. Other thing to note, there is a great gym on the ground floor by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Boardwalk Inn”
Reviews.Author: sl91370
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a nice place to stay - the hotel is very clean and has nice features. The Pros: Walking distance to Epcot, the Boardwalk, several restaruants and shops, very clean, nice staff. The cons: Rooms can be a very long distance away from lobby and there is no access to the boardwalk without walking all the way back to the lobby. My biggest complaint was that a garbage truck spent over 30 minutes outside my room at 4 in the morning running its motors. I walked all the way to the front desk and back to complain. Front desk was really nice and said they would take care of it but the truck continued for another 10 minutes after i returned to my room. The place is pricey, but if you have the money i would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Location, Club Lounge a Must!”
Reviews.Author: rynruss
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over New Years with a group of 32 people. The service of the staff is impeccable and on par with Disney standards. The location of the hotel is great, surrounded by plenty of restaurants, bars, and shops. In addition, the hotel is located within walking distance of Epcot, by far the best Disney park. If you are staying on the Walt Disney Resort stay at the Boardwalk, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Moomduck1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and loved it. The decor was beautiful. Room was beautiful. It was a short walk to Epcot. We also walked to the Yacht and Beach Club for some ice cream. The pool here was a lot of fun. It was not too crowded when we were there, which was nice. You could take a bus to the other parks or a boat to Disney Studios. We had no problems with transportation. The food was very good here. There was an orange cream cupcake at the bakery that was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Disney World Vacation”
Reviews.Author: VittlesKitten
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Disney Boardwalk Inn for a few days between a Disney Cruise we went on (Disney Dream was fantastic BTW). We stayed in the Inn Keepers Cottages which were part of the concierge level suite. The rooms were nice enough, a loft bedroom open up to a living room with a wetbar area (mini fridge and microwave) and living room (with couch bed) and bathroom down below. The first room (the night before the cruise) we stayed in was clean and nice enough. The second room we were almost put in (we stayed for 2 days after the cruise) was mildewy smelling. We asked to change rooms which was a big hassle. The staff that we encountered seemed friendly enough. Being in a concierge level room allowed us access to the lounge which was a hike from the cottages (and from the main part of the hotel). There always seemed to be limited food when we went up there and the staff seemed to pretty loud and social with each other. Overall it was not the luxury of a concierge suite/club experience one would get from a Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect room, location, service”
Reviews.Author: VacaAllie
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights on the concierge level at the boardwalk. Had a corner room with a balcony overlooking the boardwalk. The location could not have been better. A 10 minute walk to epcot and 20 minute walk to MGM. There are also boats to both resorts leaving from the boardwalk. We took the bus to downtown disney easy and convenient The service was great. The staff could not do enough. Mary, Linda and Scott were great and helped with reservations and anything else we asked for. We took the Disney Express. (highly recommended). Our baggage arrived in our room as we did and we didn't have to think about it since we checked in at our home airport. Our room was very clean and the beds were quite comfortable. Concierge level offers a nice continental breakfast with coffee, juice, cereal, pastries, bagels, yogurt and fruit. Between 5 and 7 they offer wine and cheese which is quite nice. The gym is very clean with great equipment. Internet is slow. We had a wonderful time and would definitely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Charm, Peace”
Reviews.Author: Asnabalia
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights at the Boardwalk Inn and every moment was a total pleasure. We were given a quiet, third floor room, facing the garden and quiet pool, with a view of the fireworks at Epcot from the balcony. The room was immaculate, with plenty of drawer and closet space, a great bed and a really good tub and shower. The lounge was open for a continental breakfast which could be eaten inside or out on the adjacent balcony, and had a bar open until mid-night. The Inn is steps from the Flying Fish restaurant where we had a superb meal. Breakfast is also available on the Board Walk at the Bakery and from a stand with the same food. For a full breakfast the Kouzzina restaurant is just a couple of doors away. The location of the Board Walk resort is excellent for those wishing to go to Epcot or Hollywood Studios theme parks. There is a boat launch directly in front of the Inn with boats departing every 15 minutes for both locations. It is also a very short walk to Epcot and a bit longer to Hollywood Studios, but we did both in about ten minutes. There are also three other resorts on the lake, all of which have a variety of restaurants open to any visitors. Bus transportation to all of the theme parks from the front of the hotel was very convenient. The service at the Board Walk was laudable, from the concierge staff to the house keepers. Because of its layout, with separate family centered pool and play areas, and quieter areas for those looking to "get away from it all," and it's proximity to brew pub, sports bars, dance clubs, and nightly entertainment on the board walk, this place truly has something for everyone to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: Max02215
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the Concierge Floor (4th) for 2 nights. My family loved it. Great room, yummy desserts and Cordials. Hotel is centrally located to Epcot and HollyWood Studios. Great nightlife on the Boardwalk. We would Definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Version of the Jersey Shore but so much better...”
Reviews.Author: Dem920
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 great nights on the concierge level in a deluxe room at Disney's Boardwalk Inn in January. We too this trip with my almost 4-year old nephew, and my 18 and 20 year old kids and their 23 year old cousin. I was a bit worried about 5 adults and a child in one room but the deluxe concierge room was very spacious. The room had 2 queen sized beds and a pull-out couch that was also queen size. The room was over size and had a great balcony overlooking the Boarwalk. We happened to be there during the Disney marathon so we got to see the marathon right from our front balcony. Check-in was a breeze. We had two separate reservations becasue the free dining plan did not start until our second day at the park, but the hotel was able to get us our park tickets that were part of of package that started day 2. Our room was not ready, but they held our bags and gave us our tickets and we were on our way to Epcot which is a quick walk away. The hotel sent me a text message when our rom was ready and we were immediately able to use the club room for snacks and drinks. The benefits of the concierge floor aside from them making us dinner reservations, was that they had a decent breakfast in the morning for us to grab before we went to the parks and they had snacks during the days and wine and snacks at night. They even had after-dinner drinks and desserts from 8:00 - 10:00 every night. The other great thing was that they had a balcony that we could see the fireworks from Epcot. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The cast members were very nice and helpful. It could be that we paid $800 a night for the room, but the price included a free meal plan for 6 of us and the concierge level amenities. We love the location and the pool is really nice. You can walk to Epcot and Disney Studios and there is bus to Magic Kingdom and Animal Kingdom. The hotel even let us use a wheelchair for my daughter who tore her meniscus before we left for the trip. It was convenient that they let us use the wheelchair from the hotel to go to the parks. We will definiately go back to the Boardwalk Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: PMcOuntry77
Reviews.Content: I took my mother on a Disney/Universal vacation and since we were only visiting Epcot, we chose the Boardwalk Inn. We really enjoyed the ambience of the Boardwalk, as well as the location. The room was much bigger than any I've stayed in on Disney property and we had a nice balcony (although small) that overlooked both the boardwalk and the water. The hotel was clean, the rooms clean, and service excellent. We really liked the fact that the double sink was separate from the toilet/shower. There was also a very nice vanity mirror. The beds/pillows were comfortable and plenty of places to plug in electronics to recharge those batteries/devices. The boardwalk itself (not the inn) was a bit disappointing. I enjoyed the Wyland Gallery, but the bakery which claims to be excellent, was not. We ordered several pastries, and maybe I'm picky because my mother was a pastry chef, but every pastry was made out of the same thing. The danish's were mostly pastry with a small quarter size of cheese and/or apple in the middle. We did not eat at any of the restaurants on the boardwalk or get to visit the general store. We also didn't partake in any nightlight, so I can't comment on those things. I don't recommend room service for food. We decided to get room service for breakfast one day to save time. While the portions were fine, the food wasn't at all very good and we ate maybe half of what they brought us. My mother had the omelet which she said she could make better at home and I had to agree on that sentiment with my buttermilk pancakes. The food was lukewarm. I've had the same results with room service at another Disney hotel, so I was really too surprised. They claimed there would be lots of boardwalk entertainment. I saw 3 entertainers from my balcony the entire 4 nights we were there. They were short acts, nice enough, but not the fire eating, flame throwing, acts they show on the Disney site. Just basic juggling/magic acts. This could be because we went on the off-season though. The location for getting to Epcot and catching the bus was great. The bus goes directly from Boardwalk to Downtown Disney, which is nice, but that means Boardwalks is the very last stop on the way back. If you are extremely tired, you might want to take a nap on the bus as it stops at 3 or 4 other hotels first. The only problem we had with the hotel was the fact that we received several stained towels (looked like blood) and several had holes in them. I think if a towel has a hole or stain, they need to be thrown out. I'm staying at a deluxe resort, I expect to have nice, clean looking towels. And of course, the room service food! I would put this on the lower scale of the deluxe resorts, but I did love the large, spacious, rooms and the overall ambience. Also, we were not bothered by any noise(s) from the boardwalk, and our room was right on top of it. The only thing we heard was the horn from the boats which was easily tuned out.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Disney resort”
Reviews.Author: sunshinedaydream1
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Boardwalk and has quickly become a favorite of mine! We got a large room close to the elevator with a view of Epcot. The room was very clean as was the rest of the resort. While there may be a lot going on on the Boardwalk, the room was always quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Resort”
Reviews.Author: IsaacBeloHorizonte
Reviews.Content: I loved thIs resort. It´s very beautiful with many facilities and a very nice pool area. If you intend to go to EPC or HStudios that´s the best place to stay. As I was already prepared for the room level, once at any Disney´s properties (even Grand Floridian where I´ve stayed as well) you will not find an impecable room, actually they are a little dirty (a Hilton´s room is so far much better) you won´t be disappointed at. I´d stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Get the most out of your Disney Trip”
Reviews.Author: RossMacPherson
Reviews.Content: Disney's Boardwalk Inn has a great location for getting the most out of your Disney experience.  It is positioned right next to Epcot and within reasonable walking distance to Hollywood studios, boat service is also available to Hollywood Studios. For those guests with the park hopper option (highly recommended!), Epcot is a great night spot to hit after a day at Magic Kingdom or Animal Kingdom and it's right outside your door. Come back to your room, relax and grab some food then head out for a few hours to Epcot. I have found its really the best way to get the most from your time at Disney.  An excellent atmosphere/decor and friendly staff throughout. For pin traders, there is a large pin book at guest services and the staff may look out back for pins if you make friends with the right people.  As one of Disney's luxury hotels it is hard to find fault with the property or the staff but there are a few notes that will make your stay there more enjoyable.  First, there are really two parts to the hotel; the Inn and the Villa separated by the main lobby.  The difference is that the villas are used for the Disney vacation club and are a little more sparse, while the Inn is more of a traditional hotel. For example, a studio on the Villa side has a queen bed and pull out sofa and a standard room in the Inn has 2 queens beds and a pull out for the same price.  Second, ask for a room near the lobby if possible.  Noise is not an issue and there are rooms that are an actual 5 minute walk from the lobby; while it may not seem like a hike now, try it after a day of walking the parks.  Third, if you are interested using the main pool area it is located on the Villa side of the property. This combined with distant room on the Inn side could mean a long walk in your suit and a towel. While this hotel is not on the monorail, there is a monorail station at Epcot. I would highly recommend renting a vehicle as it makes getting between the parks shorter and easier than the shuttles or monorail. Also getting back and forth from the airport is quicker with a car. Let's face it, for the amount of money we pay in park tickets and accommodations we should get every minute we can.

Reviews.Title: “Very Close to EPCOT; family oriented hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rupen M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Walt Disney World resort for a romantic getaway. We stayed at the Boardwalk Inn. It was a nice hotel, very spacious rooms. The free Disney Magic Express transfer from airport to the resort was convenient, though we had to wait in line at the airport for over an hour before getting on a shuttle. Our flight landed at 3PM, however between waiting for the shuttle, transport time, checking in to our hotel, we did not get to EPCOT until after 6pm. Luckily, with the extra magic hours for Disney resort guests, we stayed at EPCOT until midnight and experienced most of the park. I don't see the advantage of a Disney resort beyond the free airport transfers and the extra magic hours at the parks. For a young couple without children, staying at Disney's Beach Club would have made more sense. On another note, I found it interesting that the Disney World Resort shuttles from the parks to hotel would get confused when we told them we wanted to go to the Boardwalk Inn. Some drivers refer to the hotel as Disney's Boardwalk and some as the Boardwalk Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room. Awful bathroom”
Reviews.Author: beguna
Reviews.Content: Everyone was friendly starting with the gentleman at the gate to the automobile entrance. He was expecting us. Room was much bigger than expected and overall pretty clean but no one had dusted under the phone hand-piece for months. When I lifted it to call the desk it was filthy underneath. Also the bathrooms need a complete redo. I realize the hotel is supposed to simulate something from the 50's but the bathroom really looked like it was built in the 50's. It was terrible. It took all my might to turn off the bathtub water completely and I had to turn it on each day for my wife. The tile, sink, caulk, tub, all needed to be replaced. We stayed at the Dolphin 20 years ago (which is a short walk from the Boardwalk) and stopped by the Dolphin to see what it looked like. Next time we will probably return to the Dolphin again.... it looked nicer than the Boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “I cant believe this is a Disney resort.”
Reviews.Author: soyouwillknow
Reviews.Content: January 2012, My husband and I spent 2 nights at the Boardwalk Inn last week. The first clue to an unwelcome adventure was when my husband went to the lobby restroom while waiting for our room to be cleaned. He said one toilet was stopped up and a bell man was leaving the other stall leaving it so soiled that my husband just left. Then in our room there was a dirty towel on a hanger in our closet , the coffee maker was unplugged with no way to reach the outlet. We left a note which was ignored the next day. The coffee packets were tossed on the tray and out coffee trash from the day before was still there. The garbage can was not emptied and the towels looked like they were tossed on the shelf. Some one needs to take charge with a new training program for the staff. We have stayed at the Beach and Yacht club and it was wonderful in ever way. Both places are rated deluxe but the Board Walk if not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little get-away”
Reviews.Author: Bookworm426
Reviews.Content: I was invited to attend a conference being held at Disney's Boardwalk Inn and gladly accepted the invitation. (Heading to FL in January is rarely a bad idea.) I've been to Disney several times, but had never heard of the Boardwalk so wasn't quite sure what to expect. Here are my observations based on 3 days - The Boardwalk has everything you'd expect from Disney.... friendly/helpful employees, clean and bright large rooms, spotless grounds, and lots of nearby activities. The Boardwalk also seems to be better suited to adults, or those traveling with older children. Although there were certainly things that would interest little ones, the surrounding area has a Dance Hall, a dueling piano bar, an ESPN Zone and other places that appeal to an older set. It's also "walkable" to Epcot. At night, you'll find magicians and other street performers to keep you entertained. The conference center was nice - the temperature was comfortable in the rooms, they served water in pitchers rather than water bottles (yay!), and the chairs in each conference room were padded (yay, again!). All-in-all, a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: MEANY1972
Reviews.Content: What a gem in Walt Disney's Resort area. This Deluxe hotel is located within walking distance of two of Walt Disney World theme parks, Epcot and Hollywood Studios. The hotel itself is a wonderful place to relax and stroll the boardwalk area. The boardwalk area comes to life at night with magicians, jugglers, etc. the boardwalk shops and restaurants are all great. The Boardwalk Bakery is a great stop for breakfast or a dessert snack. There are two Friendship boats that go back and forth between Epcot and Hollywood Studios incase you are not in the mood for a walk. The rooms at this resort classical boardwalk themed with the taste of disney also. I would highly recommend this resort due to location and entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: CallMeGomez
Reviews.Content: If you want to immerse yourself in the Disney action, then Boardwalk is definitely the right choice. Mom 32, Dad 35, Boy 5 We stayed from January 6th thru the 13th. We opted for a nicer resort at 25% off, over the free food which generally went to waste last time. The grounds aren't very spread out so navigating the resort is easy. We stayed in 1339 - a quick cut across the courtyard and we were at the lobby. One thing we read was the "long hallways, etc" but you can always cut through buildings and enjoy the *outside* of the resort which is perfect Disney. The Boardwalk itself was entertaining. We found ourselves eating breakfast out there every morning (Boardwalk Joes for coffee, juice, 2 muffins and a cereal, approx $12.00 total). We also found ourselves out there every night on our way back from Epcot (more on that). Funnel cakes, $6, corn dogs $4, etc, all from the snack kiosk. For my money, the best value was a slice of pretty good pizza for $4 on our way out the door in the afternoon after swimming. Perfect snack before taking on the parks. Didn't try ESPN Zone, Cat Cora's, or Flying Fish - my 5 year old wouldn't have appreciated it. BIG Disney store on the boardwalk. All your typical Disney merch plus food items like Lunchables $3 and beer - 6-pack of Miller Lite $15. Pool was awesome. The slide is a trip! Leaping Horse Libations had plenty of options ranging from soda $2.50, tap beer $5.50+, frozen cocktails $7+, Sangria $8. The food is prepackaged and didn't look very appealing. Limited items too. We brought microwave popcorn down to the pool in our bag. There was a "pool party" every afternoon at 2pm for the kids. Good music and good vibe down there. The service was unbelievable. We didn't wait in line at check-in, someone came out and met us with our folder. We got a stroller delivered by Orlando Strollers and that too was ready for us immediately. The room was cleaned early everyday with something "cute" done to my son's toys. Everyone at every stop was literally beyond nice and fun. NOW for the best part - the location. Our day generally ended up at Epcot because you can literally walk there in 5-10 minutes depending on your pace. You enter through the International Gateway near England or Canada. Picture this: We hit one of the parks during the day, then went swimming, ate some food, then strolled into Epcot, our son would fall asleep in his stroller and Mom and Dad got some parent time in the Lands of Epcot. It felt like two separate trips! To put the location in perspective, on our last night my son lost his favorite toy he bought from the shop by Spaceship Earth. I decided to quickly run and get him a new one...it took me 32 minutes to walk from the room, to the "Ball" and back with this toy - that is how close you are! Bus ride to Magic Kingdom and Animal Kingdom weren't bad - maybe 20 minutes tops. And you can boat it to Hollywood Studios or walk there as well - walk is 10-15 minutes, boat about the same. Tip: We would end up at Epcot after Magic Kingdom via Monorail so we could grab up some fast-passes for that night. Then we'd walk home! Too easy. Then we'd walk back into Epcot and ride Soaring and Test Track at night. Overall, we narrowed our choices to Animal Kingdom Lodge, Wilderness Lodge and Boardwalk and simply based on it's proximity to Epcot we know we made the correct choice. It was so refreshing not having to rely on buses to get somewhere. Honestly, it probably saved us HOURS of fun on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient, friendly concierge staff”
Reviews.Author: skeeziks
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay, concierge level, at the Boardwalk. We have stayed at many of the Disney Deluxe resorts and usually 'treat' our family to concierge level. The Polynesian Resort is our favorite...so I'll focus here on why we sometimes chose Boardwalk instead. As with all the Epcot resorts, the Boardwalk location is very convenient. You can walk or take a boat to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. Downtown Disney and Typhoon Lagoon are just down the street. The main reason we chose Boardwalk over the other Epcot area resorts is room size. The Boardwalk Conceirge has Deluxe rooms that are larger than standard rooms...with two queen beds, a pullout sofa bed, and two flat screen TVs. This allows our two teenage sons to each have their own bed and TV...each having their own bed is a must...each having their own TV a benefit. If the Yacht Club had similar Deluxe size rooms, we would chose it over the Boardwalk for access to Stormalong Bay. Both hotels have very friendly concierge staffs. If the Polynesian had those Deluxe size rooms, we would probaly chose it over the Ecpot area resorts most of the time. The two story concierge area with views of the castle and lake beat the others hands down (although for friendliness, the Polynesian concierge staff unfortunately comes in last...snobby and too busy talking among themselves about how wonderful they are). We also are partial to the Poly's theming, beach, and just overall feel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not much better than a Disney moderate”
Reviews.Author: krhst25
Reviews.Content: We went to a conference that was located at the Boardwalk Inn fom Jan. 1 to 5th. We received an upgrade and were located on the fourth floor with a water view. We could see the fireworks at Epcot over the lake on our large patio. The room had two queen-sized beds, a couch, large dresser with a flat screen tv, and a desk. We noticed when we were using the desk that there were bugs on it. We thought it was a fluke, but then noticed the same bugs by the sink (which was on the other side of the room). It was very warm that day so we thought they came in through the doors. We also noticed a musty smell in the room. It got colder during the week and condensation built up on the inside of the room, which convinced us that there was a lot of moisture in the room. My clothes had that musty scent when I returned home. We had to turn the fan on at night in order for the smell to dissipate. The location was fantastic! The conference was a two minute walk from the room. Transportation to Animal Kingdom and Magic Kingdom was also a two minute walk. We were the first stop on and off so we always got a seat. We walked over to Hollywood Studios (15minutes)and Epcot (10minutes). We also liked that restaurants and other services were a stones throw away. We did not use the pool because it was VERY cold when we were there. We were treated very well. Pete the concierge for club level chatted with us in the hall. We were not club, but he was so courteous to us. We were very impressed with his hospitality. Candy from bell services answered several of our questions as well. We ( a colleague and I shared a room) liked our room, but we both agreed we would not pay the extra money to stay there. The moderates that we have stayed( Between us we have stayed at all four) are just as nice ( if not better) rooms. You are truly paying for the location.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful capture”
Reviews.Author: Farimah4
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 days at this property and the hospitality was great. The room was very comfortable, Staff was over the top helpful. problems were that all the eateries were outdoors and it was cool, so sitting out wasn't comfortable. eating off hours was difficult and choices were limited. Great place for kids. Other issue was isolation. I'd keep a car even though there's expense involved, because otherwise you're trapped in Disney only locales. Since this was a business trip, I needed to get off property. Having a car was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: evetssenim
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Disney Boardwalk Inn. The hotel is very clean and accomodating to its guest. Just minutes from EPCOT and Hollywood Studios via walking or boat. Approx. 10-15 minutes to all the other them parks. We were able to watch the fireworks at EPCOT from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Why isn't it classified as a 5 Star?”
Reviews.Author: frugalhotelguest
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at the Boardwalk Inn. I have stayed here once before, and the staff has outdone itself. They bend over backwards, and basically roll through cartwheels to get the guest what they requested. I stayed in a Deluxe Room at the Innkeepers Club, and the room was amazing. Besides the unbelievable room, which was like a junior suite, the complimentary access to the Club Level lounge for breakfast, afternoon snacks, and evening deserts was an added convenience. The convenient bus and boat transportation, and pathway to Hollywood Studios and Epcot was an added benefit of this wonderful resort. The only complaint I have was the lumpy mattress in the sleeper sofa of the Deluxe Room. It was unbelievably thin, and creeked throughout the night when I turned. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Our October 2011 Visit”
Reviews.Author: lulabell1972
Reviews.Content: Disney's Boardwalk Inn .... Our new favorite resort! We loved it so much we booked another stay for August 2012. We stayed Club Level in the Garden Suite and couldn't ask for a better experience. We wanted for nothing!!! Rooms were spacious and very clean and mouse keeping left us sweet treats everyday. Thanks to all the Club Staff, you are truly an outstanding group of people!! We will be back in August with New York bagels for everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Deluxe Disney resort? Not by any stretch of the imagination.”
Reviews.Author: people2people
Reviews.Content: The location is great as well as one of the front end managers, Michael. Thank you Michael, we truly appreciated all you did to try and rectify all our negative experiences. It is obvious that the upper management lacks severely in training their staff. We were club level guests & horribly disappointed in the service. We have stayed at the Grand Floridian many times (club level) and there is no comparison - not only in the service, but also in the beauty of the common areas. Mind you, these hotels are both "deluxe" w/ price points to match. Disney's Boardwalk Inn is not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location room was just okay. Detalied Review.”
Reviews.Author: bigheyes
Reviews.Content: We just checked out of this hotel today. We visit Disney the week before Christmas every year and we wanted to try out a Deluxe Resort. The location is excellent. We were able to walk or take a boat easily to both Epcot and Hollywood Studios. We had a great meal at The ESPN Club. The Boardwalk has quick service food from small kiosks and a delicous bakery. The pizza was not good and VERY overpriced. I'd skip that. The fresh Egg Crossaint Sandwiches were delicous from the bakery for Breakfast. I was disappointed in the size of the lobby. However, it is beauiful and well kept. All the traffic flows through the lobby making it crowded especially this time of the year. The staff was friendly and helpful. We were traveling with our 6 and a half month old baby girl and a housekeeper flagged us down in the hallway to tell us Minnie and Mickey were taking pictures in the lobby which was very nice. Now onto our main gripes which all has to do with The Room. We had a Standard room with a Garden View. We did have a balcony. It was a short walk from the Lobby which was nice. The problem was it was small and not very impressive. The bathroom was tiny for thr price of the room I was insulted. I found both the bed and the pillows to be uncomfortable. There are two quiet pools on the property and one main pool. I opted for a quiet pool and was disappointed to find out that it didn't have a hot tub. The only hot tub I saw was at the main pool and it was crowded during the day. One final note *even though it was nice to take the boat to the park it does take some travel time. You share the boat with three other resorts. You get picked up first, but dropped of last. So it is faster to walk.

Reviews.Title: “A little pricey, but the experience...”
Reviews.Author: suzers B
Reviews.Content: It's a little pricey, even with a conference discount... but man, was it worth it. We stayed in a small hotel room (yes, it is very, very small, barely any room to walk around after 2 full sized beds, a couch, a dresser, and a small table!). It was a hike from the entrance (take elevator up, and just twist and turn through the hallways till you get to your room). But we walked out the door and there was... food... entertainment... epcot.... other hotels... We had stayed on a moderate resort prior to this on disney property, as well as the hilton by downtown disney. We thought we could go middle of the road but still get a good experience. Well, let me tell you-- this is the way disney SHOULD be done. On property, either next to magic kingdom or epcot. We just bought a resale DVC timeshare for Boardwalk, and we don't regret it. It's a yearly commitment of over 1k, but next time we go, we'll be in at least a 1 bed. Worth it? For us, yes! PS-- if you're out later (8pm+). there are circus act jugglers all night. Plus you can see fireworks from the property while you eat funnel cake. You're in disney right? well, since you're spending $$ anyway, and lots of it, just add on an extra $500-1k and really experience disney to its fullest. Also, the pool is tres fun!!

Reviews.Title: “disney boardwalk great location”
Reviews.Author: Ballymacscanlon
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Sept 2011 kept meaning to write a note on this the rooms were just the ticket and the staff so friendly and helpful, I could live there permanenly! Restaurants are very busy best to get in early.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: mclh
Reviews.Content: 12th visit to Disney - loved every minute! We usually stay at the Poly or the GF because we like to be on the monorail - but for this Thanksgiving visit we stayed at the Boardwalk. It is on par with the GF. We really enjoyed our stay - the staff was fantastic! It was wonderful to walk to Epcot (where we ate every night) and the direct bus service to MK made it easy to enjoy that park in the daytime. It was a short walk to Hollywood Studios (ate at the Brown Derby - yum!) - boat ride back was longer than the walk! This was my first visit to WDW for the holidays - really wonderful decorations. The boardwalk itself is great - set up to "feel" like a real boardwalk for those of you from the NJ/NY area (but the games are pretty pricey!) We stayed in a concierge room and really thought it was a fantastic experience and well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: NYCTraveler1113
Reviews.Content: Disney's Boardwalk was the perfect place to stay for my long weekend in December 2011. The room was beautiful. We were on the courtyard side and the view was very peaceful. The view overlooking the boardwalk is a little more active. The hotel was decorated beautifully for the Christmas holiday. Everyone was friendly and knowledgeable. The transportation to and from Orlando airport was handled without any issues. My baggage was checked in Albany and it appeared magically in my room. A fantastic weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Nice conference venue”
Reviews.Author: traveltode
Reviews.Content: Our conference got so large that we spilled into the Boardwalk this year. I had never entered the property before and was pleasantly pleased with the ornate decor throughout. The conference rooms had a cozy, antiquarian feel rather than a business veneer, which made for a nice change. I will plan to stay here soon, the room pictures look great, thanks to everyone who posts pictures!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Boardwalk Villas!”
Reviews.Author: Aya2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Boardwalk Villas at the beginning of November, 2011. I was not expecting to love it; we typically stay at the Wilderness Lodge. I was very pleasantly surprised. The room was fine, a typical Disney "deluxe" resort. The common areas were beautiful. The access to the boardwalk was wonderful; you didn't feel so trapped in Disneyworld! It was great to go out at night and walk on the Boardwalk. My son loved the clowns and magicians that were entertaining. Taking the boat to Epcot and the Studios was very convenient. We loved the pool; my son tried to encourage me to move there so he could swim in the pool every day. He also loved the marshmallow roasting every night. The location really makes this hotel awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: SteveH5863
