Reviews.Content: As with everything Disney, the attention to detail in this property is remarkable. The property is themed as 1940 Atlantic City and everything, from the furnishings to the Boardwalk shops to the staff uniforms to the background music fit the theme. Rooms are well appointed and comfortable. If I had to criticize the room I would have to comment that the HDTV (mounted in a cabinet that looked like it came from the 40's) was not visible from a seating area other than the bet. Finding your way around the maze of corridors can be a bit confusing. I was there for a business meeting in early November but this is still Disney. There will be kids, whatever the time of year. Meeting facilities were good, food was excellent, serivce is precise and friendly. As with most Disney enterprises, everything runs extremely efficiently, from airport transportation to check in and out. Generally an excellent experience, although not inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: scottb8888
Reviews.Content: As a Disney Vacation Club member I have to say that we can not find anything to be critical about here. We are here currently staying for 6 Nights. Service is top notch1111

Reviews.Title: “Would not be my first choice of a Disney hotel”
Reviews.Author: DougM123
Reviews.Content: I would sum up this hotel as overpriced (then again what Disney property isn't?). The walls are THIN and the doors are THINNER. You will hear your neighbor as well as everyone out in the hall. The rooms are pretty small and you are NOT getting a water view unless you are a Disney Vacation Owner. Getting from one side of the hotel to the other requires an elevator trip, a long walk across the registration/front area, then another elevator ride. Staff doesn't seem to want to go out of their way (they are certainly not rude, just not interested in doing what isn't their job). Case in point when I asked the bell staff what time I could expect my laundry back, I was told that I should call housekeeping. Bright notes include the bartender (forgot his name) who was incredibly friendly and fast, a great workout area, the fact that you can easily walk to Epcot, and a fun atmosphere on the boardwalk (just takes forever to get there!).

Reviews.Title: “a "Magical" place!”
Reviews.Author: janelor
Reviews.Content: this is our 5th time staying at The Boardwalk - so when we are greeted so warmly with the Disney "Welcome Home" - we feel like we are a part of making this hotel so special and warm and inviting. Every employee goes out of their way to be pleasant and helpful.....one evening when we were dragging ourselves across the lobby after a full day of walking and experiencing the wonders of the "Epcot Wine & Food Festival" my eye caught the motion of one of the concierges .....she was smiling and waving at me.....engaging me to look at her and see her happy smile.....this is the attitude of every employee! we had a garden view room which looked out towards the boat dock and was conveniently located for access to the boardwalk....this was very lucky for us since some of the hallways tend to be a long walk to your room .... but once there, the room is spacious, comfortable and providing everything you will need. Disney's boat transportation from the Boardwalk to Epcot and Hollywood Studios is very convenient and so much more pleasant than a bus....which is the mode of transportation you will need to take to go to the Magic Kingdom or Animal Kingdom. Disney is great at moving people efficiently and the location of the Boardwalk provides quick access .... especially to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. The Screendoor, a shop on the Boardwalk is so well stocked with whatever you may need....it is a great way to get a quick snack or souvenier. boardwalk area offers a diverse selection of eating options from a slice of pizza or bakery product to upscale dining at Koussina....we had breakfast at Koussina and loved the food and atmosphere. you won't be disappointed with whatever options you choose at the Boardwalk....highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Location , Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: DisneyNut4
Reviews.Content: Beautiful area, very quick walk to Epcot and a short walk to Hollywood Studios. Rooms are much smaller than some of the other resorts but location makes up for that. We had a 2 bedroom villa - the kitchen was very small but fully funtional, the bathrooms were hugh ( total waste of space. Beds were very comfortable and the pull out couch was easy to use and ready with sheets and pillows ( not a traditional style - pull it out just to see how everything is all set for bed)

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Caribcharmed
Reviews.Content: This deluxe "Inn" s nestled in a turn of the century New Jersey boardwalk town on Disney property, walking distance to EPCOT and Hollywood Studios. The recently updated rooms are charmingly decorated and sufficient, but the reason to stay here is the ambience of nightly walks along the lake, morning coffee runs along the boardwalk, entertainment provided by musicians, magicians, and various booths and food items just steps outside your door. Two pools, one themed for children, the other a quieter pool for adults are beneficial. Everytime we go a lovely experience and castmembers are always eager to help. We have never had a bad experience here, and one of the best restaurants on property, Flying Fish, is right next door. The deuling piano bar nearby is also not to be missed. You will enjoy this hotel beautifully themed and so close to two of the Disney parks. And the Christmas decorations are a not-to-be-missed season at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Club level/concierge over-rated and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: FL_songbird
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for four nights in a two bedroom suite on the club level. We had a large group attending the Food and Wine Festival events. First of all, it is Disney and I expect a 'magical experience' but this hotel's concierge service was so inconsistent, I was disappointed and rather outraged. It was not magical at all! We paid handsomely for this priviledge and I will never do it again. Concierge staff was either super nice or rude and paranoid. Room service only serviced two days. Concierge could not get any better reservations for restaurants and events than if I called Disney's central reservations. Granted it is wihin walking distance of Epcot but half of my party left the hotel and stayed elsewhere. Do yourself a favor and save the money. Don't waste it on club level services at Disney. I've been to "concierge levels" at Yacht Club, Grand Floridian and now Boardwalk. Boardwalk by far was my least favorite. Concierge manager said they would be happy to speak to me at 7 AM on our day of departure. When I sought her out - she was already gone. Thanks but no thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Another Trip, Another Rip”
Reviews.Author: TTTravelers1
Reviews.Content: Of all the WDW deluxe resorts I would have to say this is the most disappointing as of late. The amenities don't measure up at all. Sadly we were there for a split stay and the time we were there 3 out of 5 days consisted of rain storms 24/7. We thought it might be a nice time to really enjoy the hotel. We went to the lounge, The Bellvue Room and the atmosphere I know is lovely because we have stopped in before. The tables were filthy, covered with old cocktails, candy bags & garbage. We decided to have a bite and the only thing available is the room service menu which is very overpriced and not delicious. There was no floor staff at all to take orders or clean up and the bartender who did the best job he could with a packed lounge. The room itself is the least detailed then other deluxe Disney resorts. It has a very sad,old feeling. This would be a resort I would say don't buy the refillable cups. You have to go outside in the rain, they hand you a disposable cup (not very green) and you pour the contents into the cup. There is no self serve on property and it is a far walk from the pool and just not worth it. The main pool is cluttered, loud and has all kinds of elephants, large trees, etc so if your with a few people it is very difficult to find enough seating in a little nook and you cannot see your kids if your traveling as a family.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Club Level Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jeannette O
Reviews.Content: If you are able to afford staying club level at this resort, I would highly recommend it. The number one thing that keeps us coming back 3x a year is the staff who work in the Innkeepers Lounge. They have become family to us as we to them. The check in is quick and easy. The food offerings are plentiful. It is not recommended to use the food offerings from 5-7 pm as your main dinner. They recently added some items to the food offerings. The staff is top notch. They will make your stay as magical as possible. When staying at the Boardwalk, you have the option of walking or boating to two different theme parks. The boardwalk at night comes to life with entertainers, music, games. The Beach Club resort is a quick walk around the lagoon where you can find Beaches and Cream. We look forward to our next trip in January 2012

Reviews.Title: “Disney boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: cgd_10
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel, but the first room we had was musty smelling and We had to get another. The second room was very far from the lobby. We had a meal plan, but the front desk handed us everything without explanation. Someone on the boardwalk explained it to us The front desk was not what I expect from a Disney Hotel. Not helpful at all

Reviews.Title: “I want to live here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lakoria
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the Boardwalk. It's beautiful with so many activities just at the hotel that we had to be mindful to go to the parks. Epcot is close so we walked there in about 10-15 minutes. Hollywood studios is a 15-20 minute walk but make sure you don't cross over the bridge to the dolphin. Boardwalk entertainment is lots of fun and there are 3 pools to choose from. I love the decor.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT Place - but you will pay top $$$ for it.”
Reviews.Author: rowan1857
Reviews.Content: Location – An EPCOT resort, Disney’s Boardwalk Resort (DBR) is VERY close to Hollywood Studios and is walking distance to EPCOT, or by Boat; a 5 minute ride. The dock is very convenient and boats run often. Staff / Service – Disney has put the best of the best in DBR. Always on the spot, helpful and cheery, the staff comes through as you might expect in a Disney Deluxe Resort. Layout / Decor – In the classic style of the early 20th century Atlantic City Boardwalk in it’s hey day, DBR has a fantastic feel and great facilities in every area from games to hair braiding to coffee. Cleanliness – Spotless. Room – Classic 1900s décor with olde-timey flair. Even the lampshades are lined with brocade. Shower/Bath/Bathroom – Some of the fixtures were a bit worn, but still very presentable and ornate. Noise – Some noise from the Boardwalk carnival acts and the enthusiastic crowd made it upstairs, but that’s the price you pay for an AMAZING view. (We had room 3235). Parking – Valet or self, both were easy and available. Linens – Great softness and layering. A VERY comfortable bed. Furniture – A VERY cool TV hutch for the flat screen with nice drawer space (albeit a bit smallish). The desk was adequate with 3 power outlets, a lamp and Ethernet slots. Room Extras – Coffee maker and porta crib. Closet Space - Average double closet that you might find at a Hampton Inn or any other similar space. Plenty of space for a 1 week stay for four people. Lighting – Desk lamp, floor lamp, two bulbs over each headboard, two spotlights in the entrance hall. More than enough light. View – AMAZING view of the lake and the entire Boardwalk. Really wonderful. Elevators – FAR, FAR away from our room. It felt like 6 miles. They were fast enough once you got to them. Ice / Vending – Abundant and relatively close to all rooms. Check In – Super fast, as always at Disney. Extended Checkout – Did not ask.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nikflower
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this October to go to the Epcot Food&Wine Festival. This was the 3rd time we've stayed here and it is always a great place to stay. The staff is friendly and helpful, as expected on Disney property. The online check-in option was nice, by estimating a time of arrival online, our room was ready immediately and it only took a couple minutes to provide our room key cards and other information. There are a variety of places to eat. Kouzzina, the restaurant by Cat Cora has an excellent breakfast (although the service is a little bit slow as compared to some of the other places to eat). This is a great place to stay if you are planning a trip during Epcot's Food & Wine festival because it is a quick walk to Epcot. You can also easily walk to Hollywood Studios, or take the boat to either park.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property -- certainly maintains Disney quality”
Reviews.Author: ButchKin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business meeting which was held in the adjacent Boardwalk Conference Center. Couple of observations: 1) It's a long walk from the parking lot and there no luggage carts available (not that I needed one), although the are plenty of bellmen around. Drop your luggage off and then park. 2) If you're going for business, there doesn't seem to be a way to get from the building to the conference center without going around the outside. 3) Ask for a room close to the lobby -- otherwise you're in for a long hike -- good for your heart-rate, but hard on your already-tired feet. On the plus side, the hotel's interior was spotless. My room was ready when I checked in at noon. The room had an incredibly fresh smell to it. The linens, furnishings, amenities, etc were all Disney quality. This hotel is in the Epcot resort area, so it's a short trip to Epcot. I think it's much further to Magic Kingdom and/or Animal Kingdom. Disney's Hollywood Studios appeared to be close by. There are a good number of restaurants at a variety of price points within a short walk and a few shops in the Boardwalk area. All-in-all: very nice. If you want to focus your trip on Epcot/Hollywood, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Blah”
Reviews.Author: Jess D
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a vacation club room Oct. 15-21, 2011. Upon entering I noticed I could write my name in the dust on the dresser and the room smelled like mildew. The baseboards were also covered in dust and hair. My husband has asthma and was bothered by the dust by the first night. There were greasy smeared hand prints all over the plaster walls and on the patio door my daughter actually thought Tinkerbell had been in the room. The room was missing a piece of baseboard molding with exposed sheet rock, which my toddler was pulling off. The best part of this hotel was the location, would not stay here again, apparently from other reviews the "club" rooms are much nicer. Guess we got an older room that has not been maintained.

Reviews.Title: “It's Disney; it's clean, efficient and sterile”
Reviews.Author: Prince_of_Peas
Reviews.Content: If you're visiting Epcot, this Disney property is close and has very conveniently located restaurants on the boardwalk property. Everything is controlled by Disney and it is a nice, safe environment. This is one of the better adult Disney hotels; there is less for kids to do here and as a result, less kids. There is an ESPN restaurant/bar on the boardwalk and the "celebrity" chef Cat Cora's restaurant (still can't figure out why a "celebrity chef" has to advertise herself as a "celebrity chef" but, oh well ...). There's a decent bar in the hotel. It's a good thing that you can find restaurants on site because parking your car may involve a long trek back to the hotel. There is valet parking but it is a bit slow. I believe that they just initiated free wi-fi, but check first. The rooms all still have a rate card, but it was free when I visited. Overall a pleasant stay. The conference facility is neat and comfortable. If you need to be at Disney and are an adult, this is a good spot. If you have little ones with you this is not a bad spot, but you can find more entertaining choices at other Disney properties.

Reviews.Title: “A Trip Down Memory Lane”
Reviews.Author: Disney-Joy
Reviews.Content: Last December (2010), my mom and I decided to treat ourselves to a Disney vacation. We had been there many times before, but had never stayed within a Disney resort. So, this was a fabulous eye opening experience for us both. We chose Disney's Boardwalk Inn because we both love the "Atlantic City" feel. DBI is decorated beautifully and the grounds are kept beautifully manicured. The rooms are spacious and welcoming. The beds are very soft and comfortable. We had a balcony overlooking a lovely garden. It was very cold in Orlando during our trip, so we did not go swimming. However, we did explore the grounds and the pool is a fun place to spend time. The boardwalk is exciting and offers many restaurants to chose from. Another perk for staying at this resort is you have the convenience of taking advantage of Disney's Transportation Service. We took some buses to the parks, but also took advantage of the ferry system. It's a scenic way to get to some parks and just adds to the Disney charm. In addition, we decided to try the Disney Dining Plan. That was a great decision! The selection of food is great and not having to worry about handling money each time you're going to dine is very convenient, as well. There are other resort options as well, as Disney's Boardwalk Inn can be pricey. However, if you have the money to splurge, do it! It's a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location - and a great hotel too!”
Reviews.Author: Livs4Vaca
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boardwalk Inn for four nights in early October 2011. I'll start off by saying we love the location of this hotel, especially for a trip during Epcot's Food and Wine Festival. It's really nice to be able to walk to Epcot and Hollywood Studios is also a short walk away. The atmosphere in the lobby is very nice - they've kept to the theme very well. The rooms are spacious and have been updated a couple of years ago. I don't find the staff to be over-the-top friendly as they are at some other Disney resorts (Beach Club and Poly come to mind) but they are efficient. One thing I don't like about Boardwalk Inn (and in fact all the Epcot area resorts) is the lack of counter service restaurant options. The Boardwalk Bakery is an option for breakfast but it is tiny and the lines can be long. On the other hand, if you're looking for fine dining, you're in a good spot - there are many great restaurant options on the Boardwalk and across the water at the Beach and Yacht Club. Plus you're so convenient to all the restaurant offerings at Epcot's World Showcase. If you're booked in a standard view room, ask for a room facing Epcot - you may have a view of Illumininations if you're on a high enough floor!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location & Best Service”
Reviews.Author: MCMcBrockton_MA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Boardwalk Hotel at the end of September with some friends and it was a terrific hotel to stay at. The hotel itself is lovely. From the moment we got there we were greeted by a welcome home by staff members. Their goal is to make your stay as enjoyable as possible. The rooms are well designed and the beds very comfortable. We also had a fridge in our room which was very helpful. We had a balcony which faced the Epcot fireworks which were thrilling to watch. Of course the best part of this hotel is the location. It is an easy walk or boat ride to Epcot and a short boat ride to Hollywood Studios. The buses provide transportation to the other parks. There are many great restaurants in the area also and you are so close to Epcot where there are even more restaurants to try. We especially like the Yachtsmans Steak House across the lake iin the Yacht Club Hotel for an elegant meal and for more casual dining France (ground level), and the new pizzeria restaurant in Italy. I would definitely come back to the Boardwalk. For 5 days it did feel like home!

Reviews.Title: “completely pampered”
Reviews.Author: momlikestotravel
Reviews.Content: We just recently stayed at the Disney Boardwalk Inn and were completely pampered. Disney upgraded us to the Club Level and it was wonderful! We were met at the front door and taken directly to a private check-in! There was a continental breakfast every morning with cereals, yogurt, pastries and fruit. They offered a midday snack, but we were never at the hotel to take advantage of this. An evening wine/beer/beverage and snacks was perfect after a full day in the parks and before heading out for the evening. They also had a dessert buffet every night as well and could see part of the fireworks from Epcot. We received great help in booking reservations for meals and activities. The parks were surprisingly busy for it being off season and was hard to get into dining venues for sit down meals, but the concierge helped us get into the restaurants we really wanted to eat at. Staff was always very friendly. Housekeeping was great and we really appreciated the bed turn down service! We love the location as it is easy to walk or take the boat to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. We also found it easy to walk through Epcot to the Monorail and take that to the Magic Kingdom. The only time we took a bus was for Animal Kingdom or Downtown Disney. Our room had a refrigerator so we were able to keep snacks and water cool. We enjoyed our little lanai and found the room to fit the 3 of us perfectly! Loved Boardwalk!

Reviews.Title: “no self service coffee”
Reviews.Author: bmurr_3600
Reviews.Content: The Boardwalk was a great 8 day stay for us this pass week. Our two rooms were perfect. The location perfect to get to Epcot & Disney Studios. The hotel bar is in a very small space and operates on limited hours. If you purchase the drink mugs its not easy to get access to coffee and soft drinks at this hotel. The line in the morning at this bar to get a cup of coffee was very long. I over heard people in line complaining about the line to just get coffee. Any way after a 10 min wait I got two cups of coffee and there no room to pour the coffee into the plastic mugs. I was told for health reason they were not allowed to fill the mug directly. So why sell the mugs? A tip, if you wait a little later in the AM the candy store on the boardwalk has a coffee and no wait at all.

Reviews.Title: “Close proximity to Epcot and Hollywood Studios”
Reviews.Author: amyeof
Reviews.Content: Very few hotels can match the quality of service provided by Disney. We stayed at the Boardwalk Inn from Oct. 2-5, 2011. We were greeted at the front door by a staff member, and because I had checked-in on-line prior to leaving home, we just had to sit down in the lobby and everything was brought to us. We previously stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge (club level) several years ago, but we really appreciated the close proximity of the Boardwalk to Epcot and the Disney Hollywood Studios. Both parks are within walking distance, but we enjoyed the water taxi service to both parks. Only one person was not quite as "Disney" friendly, but everyone has off days. Thank you to the staff at the Boardwalk Inn for a magical stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Our new "Home" at WDW!”
Reviews.Author: HandGsDad
Reviews.Content: This resort blew us away. We've now stayed at Wilderness Lodge, Bay Lake Tower, Animal Kingdom Lodge (Club Level), Swan, Dolphin, and Grand Floridian (Club Level). The Boardwalk Inn more than met our expectations and left the other resorts in the dust. We stayed Club Level and were given an immaculate room that smelled like heaven on he fifth floor overlooking the Boardwalk and Crescent Lake. I don't think I've ever had a better view at a hotel. The room was elegant without being pretentious, spacious, and he beds were very comfortable. The staff at the Club Lounge ( called The Inkeeper's Club) were lovely, but Jackie and Scott were our favorites. The whole inn is immaculate, full of interesting things to look at and I'm crazy about the Big Band soundtrack playing in the background. Restaurant choices were aplenty, the pool was huge, refreshing (in August) and he quiet pool was a heavenly oasis at night. You also can't beat the 5 minute walk to Epcot and the 10-15 minute walk to Holkywood Studios. Bus transportation was just fine. We never felt that we had to wait long for a bus, and when leaving parks, Boardwalk OR Beach and Yacht Club buses were easy to come by. If there was no bus available heading back to Boardwalk, we'd simply hop one to the Beach or Yacht club, which are also a 5 minute walk from Boardwalk. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Disney Does It Again”
Reviews.Author: Jbeaud
Reviews.Content: My family of five just returned from a six day at Boardwalk Inn. It was so close to Epcot, just a 5 minute walk. Our room was spacious and very clean. The staff was very friendly, Im not sure if "NO" is ever used at Disney. We will stay here again and would recommend it to everyone. Thank you Disney for yet again helping us make magical dreams come true:)

Reviews.Title: “Everything we hoped for!”
Reviews.Author: SMLTC18
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week long stay at the Boardwalk Inn! I had stayed at other Disney resorts before and never had a bad experience but this one tops them all!!! First class service all the way! Check in was a breeze, no wait at all. However we did get a room with one King Size bed and we had requested pne of the double Queen rooms. I went back to check in and i was in a new room within 5 minutes, no question asked, even had a better view! The room was perfect. Lots of room....beds were comfortable....furnishings in great shape and classy old school decor. The double vanity can in very handy. The bathroom itself was small but great shower pressure (a huge must for me)!! The maid service was great. We hardly ever saw them and always had enough towels and supplies. The staff itself was outstanding. There was one staff member...i do not remember her name but she was the one that checked us in....that gave my son baloons and stickers everytime she saw him and made his day by just remembering him and calling him by name each day. As for the resort itself....there was nothing bad I could say. The pool was awesome. The Boardwalk itself is incredible. What a great way to spend a night. We spent the $15 on refillable mugs and made great use of them. Even when we went to the different places for just refills everyone was so accomadating. The ESPN Club had great wings. The ice cream shop was a great treat every night and the Pizza Window was awesome...i think my son ate a slice everyday we were there! Being able to walk to EPCOT was outstanding and the boat to Hollywood Studios was a breeze too! If i had any complaints or issues....there would only be 2 minor ones. 1) while the bus transportation is a major perk, i was pretty annoying to have to sit through 3 or 4 different stops everytime we used to buses. They weren't always very crowded but in the few times they were it was an issue since we had a stroller and a 3 year old we had to try to stand with on the buses. DIdn't think this was very safe at all. I would think a Deluxe resort would get it's own bus stop or at least only have to share with one other hotel. Not 4 different ones. 2) As I said....service was outstanding....check in was awesome...check out was easy enough....except for the awful attitude of the parking and loading attendant. Evidently you are only allowed to park in the loading zone in front of the door if you are using a bell hop. Considering we were in a rush to leave since we were driving back to VA that morning and the next available bell hop would be a 30 minute wait....i decided to pull my car up and load it myself. I was met very rudely by this employee and told I could only park there for about 5 minutes and my car would be moved so the bell hops could load up cars. I informed him that I believe I had just as much right to load my car myself as anyone else given the amount of money I had already spent on property over my week long stay. He didn't like that too much and muttered some words under his breath as he walked away. Just a minor blip...but did leave me a little ticked off after such a great stay. Overall.....great hotel...great staff...great location. I would reccommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Closest to EPCOT, Well-rounded offerings for all ages”
Reviews.Author: mwollering
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Boardwalk Inn & Villas (part of the Disney Vacation Club plan if you're looking into being part of that) for a 3 night stay prior to a 5 day Disney Cruise on the Disney Dream in September. First of all, September is the month to go with very few people visiting the resorts and parks. We never waited for rides or entrance to anything the entire trip! It was incredible! As for the Boardwalk, it is on a beautiful lake shared by the Beach Eub Resort and the Yacht Club Resort and is adjacent to the Swan and Dolphin Disney/Sheraton shared properties. The Boardwalk is sort of "Dumbo's Circus" or Carnival themed and is very fun for kids yet elegant for adults. There was easy access to eating at the cafes and restaurants just outside the back on the lake. ESPN Club is right there for great eating and sports watching. The dance club was great for our group of 12 thirty-somethings, who wanted to have a few drinks and dance after dinner but only walk 3 minutes from the Boardwalk. Kids can enjoy the amazing pool and waterslide, games in the Community room and much, much more. Really, this location had something for everyone! The largest benefit was its proximity to EPCOT. You walk 5-7 minutes and you can enter via the World Showcase, at France. It was superb. I would stay here for this reason alone again. Also, this resort is one of the more reasonable if you are hoping to stay at a beautiful resort, just not the most expensive of the Disney offerings. Book it knowing you're getting amazing value and quality for your money!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: AnneMart33
Reviews.Content: Our family LOVED Boardwalk for many reasons... but it all added up to great options. First, the room had a great view of Epcot and the fireworks if we wanted to sit on our balcony and watch. Rather be at Epcot? No problem it is only a 5 minute walk and no crowd exiting at the end of the day! Prefer mini-golf? That's a 10 minute walk away! Just stroll down to the boardwalk and there are restaurants, magicians and entertainers. The "noisy" pool has a great slide, but we preferred one of the "quiet" pools which we often had to ourselves... and this is in July! My husband's ONLY critique is that there is no self-serve if you buy the bottomless mugs - you need to hand them to a server/bartender to get a refill.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service!”
Reviews.Author: Cadillac5549
Reviews.Content: Perfect 5 minute walk to epcot! Great customer service! Nice rooms...great overall! Would stay here again....no wireless Internet in the rooms:(, but in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge spoiled me”
Reviews.Author: ticky v
Reviews.Content: This has been my favorite Disney hotel to date. We stayed in a deluxe room concierge. Our huge room overlooked the boardwalk (we were above the sweetshop). Even with all the people on the boardwalk, it was very quiet. The location was great. We walked to EPCOT and Disney Studios. The busing was excellent to AK and MK and surprisingly not very crowded. The bus stop was also super close to lobby. Concierge check in was a breeze. Everyone I encountered was fabulous. I also enjoyed the daily phone calls to let me know what the weather was going to be and what parks had the extra hours. The Inn Keepers club was excellent. Plenty of choice for breakfast, snack time, pre-dinner and desserts. I loved the fact that I could chocolate covered strawberries every night before bed, if I chose. I enjoyed to the lounge before dinner and having a beer and some veggies and dip. My kids loved the hot offerings they had - very tasty. Turn down service was great and you got salt-water taffies on your pillow instead of chocolates. The pool was very nice and the kids liked the water slide. I also liked the shops on the Boardwalk. We also got to see the Steeplechase Suite - WOW. I have told many friends and I will definitely stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “First class resort!”
Reviews.Author: Ioannavacation
Reviews.Content: We have been to wdw many times and always stay at a deluxe resort, but this is by far our favourite. The staff was very friendly and ready to assist with every need. They were always reaching in their pockets Ti hand out stickers to the kids. The room was a very comfortable size with enough room for us to park two strollers (one being a double) without having to collapse them. (very helpful at the end of exciting day and a late night when kids have fallen asleep in them). The walk in closet allowed for suitcases to be opened in there without having to mess up the room. Location was the biggest draw for us with easy access to so much dining, a quick boat ride to Disney studios and pleasant walk to epcot. Live the boardwalk atmosphere and taking a walk to the beach club and yatch club resorts. The pool was lots of fun with games and activities run by Disney staff. Definitely would return to this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Boardwalk Inn- AGAIN!!”
Reviews.Author: Jenny G
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a family trip to Disney and chose to stay at the Boardwalk for the 3rd time! We stayed on the concierge level, and were greeted by name as soon as we received our luggage from the Magical Express driver. They immediately took us inside and took care of our luggage.(our room wasn't ready-it was only 11:30 am when we arrived). We were then led upstairs to the concierge desk to check in. They had an offer for us, so the manager took the 6 kids to the Innkeepers Lounge for snacks while we discussed the offer. We were offered a single room (two bedroom suite) at the Beach Club, but chose to stay with our two connecting rooms at the Boardwalk. If that doesn't tell you anything about our past experience with the Boardwalk, I don't know what will. Because we were staying at the Boardwalk they placed a rush on our rooms, and while we were discussing the park info. we got word that one of our rooms was now ready. We finished our discussion and went to the Innkeepers Lounge to gather the kids and head to our room. Jackie in concierge arranged for our luggage to be brought up to our room instead of us having to go back down to bell services and request it ourselves. We were in our room no more than 2-3 minutes and bell services called to make sure that we were there to accept our luggage(we had a card stating how many pieces of luggage we had checked that they needed to verify). Our luggage was then delivered to our room within minutes! Then we were off to the parks! We received a text message before 2:00 that our other room was ready. Our experiences with Jackie, Anita, and Lorenzo in the Innkeepers Lounge was outstanding! They even nicknamed the kids "the six pack". They always went our of their way to help us any way they could. Whether it was juice boxes, water, or extra snacks-they always went out of their way for us. One day, Lorenzo saw us come in for breakfast and pulled enough chairs over to a table so that we could all sit together! Talk about service-WOW! Anita and Lorenzo even remembered us from last year and were commenting on how much the kids have grown, and what their favorite snacks were. My daughter had a friend along this year, and she commented how great they were and how funny they were. They were always telling us jokes and laughing along with us. The rooms themselves are clean, and large enough for our family. We had four people in each room, and didn't feel cramped for space. We even had a jogging stroller in each room! We had an issue with a tv in one of the rooms on the first day. I mentioned it to housekeeping, and it was fixed before we returned to our room that night. I've read on some reviews that people wish the resorts had free wifi- my feelings are if you're on vacation- go on vacation and leave work at home! If you're at the resorts for work, come on- if work is already paying for a deluxe hotel-why wouldn't they also pay for the internet connection? One of the great things about the Boardwalk is its location. We went to all four parks, and always felt like our hotel was in the middle. We walked to Epcot and Hollywood Studios, and took the bus to Animal Kingdom(the only transportation available) We only had to wait a few minutes for the bus in both directions which was great. We had hopper passes, so we would walk to Epcot and walk over to the monorail and take that to the Magic Kingdom. This is personal choice, but I've noticed that a lot of people don't consider this to be an option.(the only time it doesn't work is during extra magic hours and Epcot isn't open) However, those with strollers might find it helpful because you don't have to fold up the stroller to get on the bus. Two of the kids were sleeping in strollers when we left the Magic Kingdom, but Epcot was closed so we had to take the bus. It would be have sooo much nicer to let them sleep and take the monorail to Epcot and walk back to the Boardwalk. Overall, the Boardwalk Inn is the only place my family will stay while visiting Disney.(my daughter's friend also said she wouldn't want to stay anywhere else). While all trips are not perfect, our recent stay at the Boardwalk will be hard to top.

Reviews.Title: “Boardwalk "Club Level" service”
Reviews.Author: hgleim
Reviews.Content: We stayded at the BW Inn with our kids 15, 7, and 4, and payed extra for "Club Level" service. We had a beautiful room overllooking Crescent Lake with a view of the entire Boardwalk. Club Level guests stay only on the fourth floor. The resort is decorated in a lovely early twenties(?) style; very fancy. The service was great, and the club level came with a special lounge ony for CL guests; you need a key to get in. In the AM from 7-10 (6:30 for coffee) there is a large continental breakfast spread with pastries, bagels, cereal, friut and hot oatmeal. From 3-5 there are snacks (pretzles, chips, and drinks such as soda and lemonade), from 5-7 Pm there are wonderful hors douevers (cheeses, crackers, hummus, pitas, olive salad, friuts, potstickers, stuffed grape leaves...) and wine, beer and soda. There are two hot choices each night. Then from 8-10 they offer fancy desserts and cordials. We took advantage of the free dining plan, and with that breakfast is not included, so the breakfast was a great perk! There are many stores and restaurants on the Boardwalk, and it is all lit up at night. They have magicians and different acts each night along the BW. The pool is good sized and has a restaurant there which accepts the dining plan. We walked to Epcot from there, 10-15 minute walk, and you can also walk to Hollywood Studios, which is about 20 minutes. If you wait for the Disney transportation to take you anywhere, plan on 45 mins. The busses come every 20 minutes, then you probably have to stop at other resorts to get guests. The transportation service is great. My advice is to get to the parks BEFORE THEY OPEN! I think the key to make Disney a stress free trip is to educate youreself, have your dining reservations made well in advance, to allot an hour to get to/from park/resort, and to get up early to arrive at the parks when they open. We returned to the resort after lunch to swim and nap before our dinner at the reserved restaurant. REMEMBER: unless you get Hopper passes, if you make a dining reservation within a park, you HAVE to go to THAT park that day. For example: If you want to eat at MK, you need to have a MK ticket that day. You cant go to MK for the day and have dinner at Epcot that night unless you buy a separate ticket for Epcot or you have a Hopper pass. We did not have Hopper passes....we just had all our ducks in a row and decided in advance which park we were going to that day, then made our dining reservations. Make them ASAP!! Dont forget: if you stay on Disney property you get to take advantage of the Magic Hours at the parks. Look at these hours before you make your dining reservations and plan accordingly!! I feel like I am a Disney expert at this point after all the research I have done, especailly regarding the Dining Plan. If you have any questions about Disney, the Boardwalk Inn or the Dining Plan, please ask!

Reviews.Title: “I love this resort”
Reviews.Author: Heidy C
Reviews.Content: The staff was very polite. I came back from my trip to Disney about a week ago. I just opened my mail box today, and I found my check book from the lost and found dept at the Board Walk. I didn't even noticed that I had left my check book at this resort. Great customer service..

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, clean, first rate all the way”
Reviews.Author: STEAMBOATWILLY1
Reviews.Content: I shopped and got best rate through expedia, disney vacations was around 900 for two nights got it for543.00. I am season pass holder so did not need tickets. The hotel is first rate, clean, comfortable. Check in went without a flaw.Couldnt ask for a nicer time. Access to all restaurants on boardwalk was great, entertainment, etc. Save up your money and do disney the right way, walk to or boat to epcot walking took 8 minutes booat was 4 minutes. Hotel is right there!!! just shop rate expedia blew away disneys rate!!!!! Booked dolphin for thanksgiving and rate cheaper through statrwood website, disney vacation was more! Atmosphere is like 1950s america.....sit and relax on boardwalk and have a pizza and take in sights we diod and loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Best Trip Ever”
Reviews.Author: doug e
Reviews.Content: Have been to Disney many times before but this was the best trip yet and the Boardwalk was a big part of it being so great. We took our 4 year old daughter and she loved it. They had daily games for the kids by the pool with prizes, roasted marshmellows at night and even set up a movie theatre. Not to mention the water slide which is like a water slide at a theme park but it was free and trust me she went down that thing at least 50 times. You did it again Disney A++++++++

Reviews.Title: “would of been nicer with warm weather”
Reviews.Author: amylee87
Reviews.Content: Went in December for work and it was very windy and in the 40s!! yikes. I didnt get to go in the pool that looked so awesome! The rooms are kind of older..bed isnt that comfy. Great area and nice place to walk around. Minute to Epcot!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: cipollavin
Reviews.Content: My sister gave me her DVC points so I could stay here. Though I would never pay the ridiculous amount of money to stay here, it was a great treat. The hotel staff was extremely friendly. The location was excellent for Epcot, 10 minute walk. Rooms very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Goldwebco
Reviews.Content: Had a great experience at the Boardwalk Inn. Staff was as friendly and helpful as you could ask. Location couldn't be beat... 10 minute walk to Epcot, 20 minute walk to Hollywood Studios and right on the boardwalk for a quick bite to eat. Hotel has 3 pools so there's something for everyone. Only complaint is the noise. We may have just had bad luck with noisy neighbors or the walls were real thin. Or both. When I went to change rooms, I was told our neighbors had checked out. So I stayed in my room. Big improvement, but there was still other noises that could be heard all over the place. Expensive, but that's Disney. I'll definitely stay in this area again, and probably at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Business Conference -- Nice Facility -- Good Service”
Reviews.Author: debvarner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Disney's Boardwalk Inn for a business conference -- it was quite nice. The Staff was great! The Facility was convenient, nice, worked very well for us.

Reviews.Title: “Sheer Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel0914
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at the Boardwalk. We were there for my son's birthday. The staff especially Pete as well as everyone we came in contact with went above and beyond the call of duty. We were treated like royalty and I adored every second of all the surprises they did for my child. It will always be a dream vacation to remember. There is not ONE thing negative I could say about the Boardwalk. I WILL GO BACK OVER AND OVER

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, great service, LOVED Garden Suite...will go again!”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingCarters
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in one of the amazing Concierge Garden Suite for 5 nights of our 11 night Disney Trip in September 2010. This suite is HUGE! It reminds me of a townhome. It is tow stories, the downstairs is a large living room space with a table, desk and mini refrigerator and microwave. Plus a half bath. Then upstairs in the fabulous bedroom and bathroom! The bathroom has a double vanity, huge garden tub that looks into the bedroom, and a separate large walk in glass shower - heaven in a bathroom! The king size bed was so comfortable, we didn't want to get up in the mornings! And the a nice large balcony in the bedroom that overlooks the quiet pool and garden. So we LOVED our room. The Concierge lounge was a nice amenity to have. We went in there several times a day to check out the snack options and just hang out. The concierge staff was so friendly and helpful. When you stay in a concierge room, they actually check you in one on one in your suite and explain all your amenities, services and tickets you have. The resort itself is our favorite of all the ones we have stayed at (we have stayed at Wilderness Lodge, Fort Wilderness, Contemporary, Grand Floridian and Animal Kingdom). We love being right on the boardwalk because we can walk to Epcot- our favorite park! Plus the atmosphere on the boardwalk at night is so nice. The staff at the hotel are very helpful and kind. We used the exercise facility every morning and did laundry once while working out because the 24 hour laundry room is right next to the gym. Both are nice to have when on along vacation. The restaurants on site that we tried were wonderful: Kouzinna for breakfast was our favorite meal. Not your standard breakfast fare and very healthy! Big River Grill is a great "bar food" type eatery to me. We had some yummy spinach dip, lunch sandwiches and adult beverages in here! You can walk easily to the Swan/Dolphin for some good sushi at BlueZoo and the to the Yacht Club for a great steak. The main pool was fun at the Boardwalk; great little carousel bar right by the pool! The quiet pool was tight near our room and such a quiet little area to getaway from the crown and noise. Plus the hot tubs were wonderful at the end of the long days. The only thing that I do not like about this hotel is that the parking is so far away from the front entrance and valet is just not something I want to spend spare money on. But all Disney hotels have the same parking issue to me. I think if you decide to stay here you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: honeycutt33
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and great staff! Really enjoy staying there! Monika Honeycutt

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Hotel needs some updating”
Reviews.Author: roxi06
Reviews.Content: The best part of staying at Disney's Boardwalk is the location and the convenience. You can walk to the world showcase section of Epcot in a few minutes, and a little longer of a walk will take you to Hollywood Studios. There are also boats to take you to the two parks. Having a small child with us, it was also great to have the boardwalk because we were able to push the stroller around the water front and had the ESPN Club, Kouzzina (great food), Big River Grille, and Flying Fish restaurants all right outside the hotel. There is also a pizza window, and a few food carts. The pool also serves sandwiches and light snacks. The desserts at the bakery were addicting and outstanding and I am not a sweets person. The best part is if you are on the Disney Dining Plan you can use your snack allotments at the bakery. As for the cons, the pool is entirely too small. While the Disney parks were relatively quiet, the pool was crowded the entire stay and it was very difficult to find a spot when coming back from the parks in the middle of the day. One day in particular the kids pool was full of adults because there was nowhere left to go. There is a quiet pool right behind it, which was rarely crowded, but it was even smaller. The hotel is also in need of a facelift. We had a two bedroom that consisted of a one bedroom without a studio lockout. Both rooms were a little dated. The furniture was beaten up, missing buttons, deep scratches on the wood and table and the rug outside the bathroom in the main bedroom was thread bare and worn out. Don't try sleeping on the pullout, thankfully nobody had to God Bless anyone who does. A marble slab may have been more comfortable. The two rooms had three balconies that were not connected and all were tiny. Some cool things that I noticed: nightly campfire and movie by the pool, kids activities, crafts, movie rentals, and toys to play with at the community hall, interactive games for kids by the pool, and a nice weight room Some not so cool things I noticed: no pool hopping on the weekends, checking room cards and handing out wrist bands. The pool at beach club pool was off limits. The pool bar/grill shuts down at 7:30 while the pool stays open till 11. I will sum it up this way, as far as hotel standards go this is an outstanding place. For Disney standards it's just pretty good. Having been to a few other Disney Resorts before I would say this was my least favorite, but having said that I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location.”
Reviews.Author: LUCKYDAD5
Reviews.Content: First time at this Disney property. We have stayed at many others. We only had enough time to do 2 parks during our stay and our dughter wanted to do EPCOT. Figured we should try this location since it was so close. We were able to take the short walks to both EPCOT and the movie studio. Room was the largest we stayed at so far. The theme was great and keep true to the overall theme of the property. Pool and slide was enjoyed every day by all. Many things to do at night on the boardwalk made it nice that we did not have to drive somewhere to do something different each night. It was a little weird that we had to take 2 different elevators to get from our room to the boardwalk. I would still stay here again though. I have read many reviews from people at Disney properties and I am getting tired of them complaining that they do not get free internet. Either, have a vacation and forget the computer for a couple of days, join the vaction club wre it is free, or pay the 10.00 a day and quite complaining.

Reviews.Title: “Everything and More”
Reviews.Author: BaconGal
Reviews.Content: Had the most amazing visit to Disney World with my family – and I attribute a great deal of this to where we stayed. We stayed on the concierge level which was incredible. Snacks and treats throughout the day, comfy rooms with beautiful views, clean-clean-clean, super safe and staff that knew all of us by name. Thank you Lorenzo, Anita and Janice! And when our children, a relatively well-behaved but excited bunch acted like – well children – the staff would smile as we panicked and assure us that while the hotel is beautiful, it is made for families and it was not the first time juice was spilled or chocolaty fingers touched the drapes. The places was impeccable and the trip a joy. The other reason we had such a wonderful, truly magical experience was - Christine the Machine. If you can swing it and are lucky enough to snag her as a private park guide, you will not regret it. My children still look at photos from our trip and point her out with glee. She is GOLD!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: jrbdad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here post cruise -- decided last minute, ended up in the concierge level with an annual passholder rate. Had a Boardwalk View. Loved it. Would do it again. Not our favorite, but wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - would consider staying here again”
Reviews.Author: Memis25
Reviews.Content: We were greeted outside the hotel when the Disney Magical Express arrived & were taken right to the check-in desk. Our room was ready (at 11am) so we didnt need to worry about storing luggage when we went to the parks. Tip: we pre-registered on line which made for a very quick check in. We chose the Boardwalk for its close proximity to Epcot & Hollywood Studios, two parks that we wouldnt have to wait for the Disney bus transportation. The bus transportation is fairly prompt but they stop at 3 other resorts which makes the commute lenghty & crowded, something I didnt realize when booking this hotel. The hotel has a fairly big main pool but on the afternoons that we went there we could not find 3 chairs so we ended up each day at the quiet pool. I think every resort needs a quiet pool. It was very nice & relaxing. The hotel was very nice, rooms were spacious. However, the layout of the hotel is confusing & there is no way to get from the large pool to the quiet pool without going through the hotel which was inconvenient. When I called guest services to make sure of this I was told I could get from one to the other I just needed to walk around & figure it out. I'm not sure he knew because you couldnt. As far as comfort & convenience this hotel was fine but with all the choices Disney has to offer I'm not sure I would select this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this area and hotel”
Reviews.Author: beans0418
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at Disney's Boardwalk Inn and Villas. They didn't disappoint! We traveled with 4 adults, needing an extra bed for our guest, our room had a sofa that quickly turned into a day bed! What a savings there. We had a garden view room overlooking the Inn's center court and steps from one of the quiet pools. There is a themed pool at the opposite end with a water slide in the shape of a wooden roller coaster, but, wishing to be in a quieter area we chose to use the quiet pool near our room. The staff could not have been more friendly. Asking for extra towels was delivered within 15 minutes to our room despite late hours. This hotel sits amid Crescent Lake at Disney World with an old fashioned boardwalk and entertainment at night. The down side was that for those under 21 they can't enter the entertainment clubs to watch the dual pianos or the dance hall to listen to the music. That seemed to be an issue at late night what they would do. But, would recommend this area as you are steps from Epcot and a boat ride to the Studios. We are looking forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fun time on our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: hellmann610
Reviews.Content: We thought the Boardwalk was a beautiful hotel. We loved the location and walked to Epcot almost everyday. We were greeted in the lobby. We did the online check in so our keys and package were ready for us. The check in was quick. The told us the room had been upgraded and we were excited. We received the concierge level hotel. This allowed to have a free breakfast, coffee, soda, tea, cordials, wine, desserts, among other things. The room wasn't available when we arrived (11 am) so we checked our luggage and got a massage at the Saratoga Springs Resort. We returned to the room after 3 and it was large and more than we expected. It was a 1 bedroom loft with a sectional couch and fridge and more. There were 1.5 bathrooms. The master bath came with a jacuzzi tub and walk in shower. My only complaint was the lighting. I never thought that it would matter much, but it was kind of dark when we were getting ready. The shower was especially dark. Also, we never used the tub because it was so large. Overall, we loved the location because it was so close to other beautiful hotels. Epcot and Hollywood Studios were very close. We were able to watch the fireworks from the concierge level room. It was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel -- will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: PMath5516
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we stayed in something other than a Disney "value resort". Now I'm spoiled and will never go back to that. The Boardwalk had a very welcoming atmosphere. The rooms are comfortable and have private balconies. I only wish they had a microwave so I could have tea while getting ready in the morning. The pool has a great slide for the kids. There are quiet areas outside to just sit and relax. It is very close the Hollywood Studios, and a 7 minute walk into EPCOT. The trip to Magic Kingdom is a bit long because the bus stops at 2 other resorts. Great resort!

Reviews.Title: “Best of all the Disney properties, including the Grand Floridian”
Reviews.Author: starofaffinity
Reviews.Content: The Boardwalk was beautiful, clean and super convenient. We were an extended family of 7 and booked two rooms. Unfortunately, they did not accommodate my request to have the rooms side by side. The best they could do was offer us rooms down the hall from each other. The frustrating part of this was that I made special phone calls to Disney early on so that our reservations would be joined. The Disney reservation system is a huge gripe of mine, but here is neither the time or place. . . I found the Boardwalk Inn layout mildly frustrating. Since we were on the first floor, we had to go up stairs only to go back down other stairs. Being that one of the individuals in our party had a wheel chair, made it worse than it was. Aside from all that, the rooms were clean and very spacious. The Boardwalk itself was wonderful. There were things for the kids to do and the performers entertained them for chunks of time. The Boardwalk made it so much more then a hotel, it was a place to go, eat, relax, have fun, watch the Epcot fireworks, etc. Other Disney resorts that I have stayed at don't have that ability. Even the beautiful Grand Floridian didn't have as much to do. And if you get board you can walk to the other hotels - The Yacht and Beach Club are right around the lake. The Restaurant Cape May at the Beach Club was also excellent and convenient since you can walk back to your hotel. You also have choices in park transportation. The Boat Launch to Hollywood Studios, Buses to AK and MK but the best is that you can walk straight into the International side of Epcot (or take a boat). One night I even did a run around the countries picking up dinner and bringing it back to the hotel! The BEST BEST BEST part is that it is within walking distance of a Hess Gas Station, where you can buy reasonably priced drinks and snacks. We didn't have a car, and you have to cross a pretty major road, but at night there was no problem with any of it. My husband and I would walk to get REAL coffee and pick up drinks for the next day.

Reviews.Title: “The only place we stay at the Mouse!!”
Reviews.Author: 859michaell
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Boardwalk a few times and absolutely love it. First, the hotel has some of the LARGEST rooms on the property. Second, you can't beat the access to the variety of restaurants and entertainment on the boardwalk. You never feel 'isolated' like at the other resorts. Last, but certainly not least, you can walk to the back entrance of Epcot or take a short boat cruise to Hollywood Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for 100's of reasons!”
Reviews.Author: travelmom36
Reviews.Content: There are lots and lots of reasons we enjoyed our stay. The hotel was everything we read and even better. From the time we walked in (about 11 at night) every single member of the staff was helpful. Check-in was a breeze, room service was prompt, our room was always spotless when we returned. We returned one afternoon to find a platter of chocolate, compliments of the front desk. The rooms are not huge, but certainly adequate. The only downside was that we could hear the Epcot fireworks each evening. They didn't last long, but were pretty loud. The upside is the location. We were a short walk to Epcot and nice quick boat ride to Hollywood Studios. We would have no problem staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “The concierge service was phenomenal”
Reviews.Author: happy_go_lucky_guy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the "Innkeeper's Suites," also known as the concierge/club portion of this property. This is basically a hotel within the hotel. As other reviews have focused more on the general hotel, I'm going to focus primarily upon our experience in this part. However, the general hotel has a great swimming pool that the kids thought were great (the slide takes a full 15 seconds from the top to the bottom of the slide . . . pretty good for a hotel pool.) The pool had a DJ for the kids and they were doing kids activities at the pool when we were there. I was also impressed with the staffed gym. The machines were new, and clean. The staff member was pleasant. The temperature was kept on the cooler side, which I was happy for. Our room itself was the Sonora Suite. We were told that this is the only room that Rita Moreno will stay at, and that she is a frequent guest at Disney. This suite had three rooms. The main room had a Bose surround sound, couch, an 8 person dining room table, with two double french doors leading out to a deceptively narrow balcony. The balcony had typical balcony furniture. There was a pantry/kitchen area that had a Keureg coffee maker with about 20 different varieties of coffees and teas. Evian water in the fridge. A microwave, wine bottle opener, and can opener were all there as well. There was a half bath in the entry way. The master bedroom had another french door leading onto the balcony, and the bed was incredibly comfortable. The master bath had his and his sinks, with a TV in the middle. There was a wonderful shower, with a deep tub. I availed myself of the jetted tub and found that it was great, but was a bit mystified to not have any sort of bath salts. Again, a minor quibble, but a bit unusual in its absence. There was a desk, but sadly disney does not provide free internet. Quite the shocker, that was not a pleasant surprise. We used my phone as a wi-fi hotspot and saved a ton of money that way. The kids bedroom had two queen beds, and they had a door onto the balcony, with a separate entrance onto the hallway. Maid service was incredible. We got all the usual towels and such folded into interesting patterns, but one of the things that was made was a teddy bear out of towels. We hadn't seen that one before, and everyone was delighted. Everything was kept well stocked, and sparkling clean, in the entire hotel, not just our room. We used the laundry service and were tickled. It's expensive, but when you need it, it's there and they do good work. The concierges, Melana, Jackie, and Scott blew our expectations out of the water. I needed some personal items not available there, and Jackie went, on her day off, and did some shopping for me in Orlando. THAT is service of the highest order. Melana and Scott just bent over backwards to make us feel like a part of the family. If we even mentioned something, they were all over themselves to make it happen. They made our stay truly wonderful and even more magical. The actual concierge room, almost always had snacks. The continental breakfast was a wee bit lackluster. Most hotels offer eggs and sausage and bacon. They had fruit and oatmeal and pastries. Heavy on the carbs, almost no protein except for some yogurt, that really wasn't very good. That was a bit of a disappointment. However, the staff there (of which, there were ALWAYS 3 staff members on duty when we were there, making sure that everything met your expectations) were great. The desserts good, and I enjoyed the wine as well as the cordials later on. The staff had no problems (in fact they encouraged it) with you taking bottles of evian back to your suite. This was an incredibly fantastic stay. If we ever decide to go back to WDW, we will definitely stay here. Strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, best hotel on property”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel2424
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Boardwalk makes visiting the parks a breeze It is a short walk to Epcot and just about 10 minute walk to MGM. We walked through Epcot to jump on the tram to the Magic Kingdom. There are several excellent resturants along the boardwalk. The hotel is very clean and well maintained, the staff courteous, rooms are large and comfortable. The ambeince makes it a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: acdhuber
Reviews.Content: The location is really the best part about the hotel. Located between Epcot and Hollywood Studios, the hotel is perfectly situated. It's a quick and easy walk to either of the parks, and it was great for a morning run. The food choices on property are also quite broad. Although the food is expensive and of an average quality, the convenience cannot be beat. I hadn't visited Disney in 30 years, and I was pleasantly surprised upon my return. The room was average in quality and size, but probably would have been fine had I been traveling with a family. However, the lack of wireless access in this day and age is not acceptable. They had to bring me an Ethernet cord in order to connect. Again, that probably makes sense when traveling with family, but it was extremely challenging as a business traveler. Also, the canned "welcome home" phrase issued by the staff became very annoying in short order.

Reviews.Title: “Way Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: LyndaWilkes
Reviews.Content: So, for $500 a night one, one would expect the Ritz. Disney's Boardwalk Inn is an over-priced, no-frills disappointment! The rooms lack the charm and amenities that should be offered in a property with this price tag. Nearby (reasonbly priced) food is impossible to find. The boardwalk itself is a huge let down . . . nothing there to keep your interest at all. Disney dropped the ball on this one big time. If you want a higher-end Disney experience, stay at the Grand Floridian. Otherwise, reserve a room at the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed location perfect for Epcot & Hollywood Studios”
Reviews.Author: Lewy8
Reviews.Content: I was here for a business conference for 5 days in May. My room was on the Concierge's Level and I enjoyed the morning lattes and evening wines very much! The rooms were a good size for 1 or 2, but would be tight for a family of 4. But they have garden suites on the ground level, they offer more privacy and a split level loft. They were not huge, but larger. I preferred the convenience of the resort rooms to the suites, but I was a single person... Walking around the boardwalk in the morning before many guests were up was very nice. It was about a 12 minute (brisk, not strolling) walk. There are 2 pools, a large pool on the villas side, good for families, kids of all ages, and there was a quiet pool, smaller, better for couples, or quiet adults looking to read, just hang out by the pool. the quiet pool had a jacuzzi too. This was in the gardens area near the suites. The area surrounding it was beautiful too, saw two receptions going on during the week that they were setting up for...that would have been very nice too experience. The conference area of the Boardwalk Resort was nice too. Dining, etc. would have been expensive, if my company wasn't paying, but the selection was nice. Not a lot of shopping here, just a little bit. Go to Downtown Disney for more of that, or there are modern outlets off property, and you get there via taxi. Downtown Disney was about a 5 minute bus ride to get to and about 15 minute bus ride back to the resort. Plus buses ran late into the night, I think until 2 am. Disney's Boardwalk Resort would be my choice for couples, older guests, business groups, and some families with small children; older children might be bored more easily than the younger ones.

Reviews.Title: “Umm... Nice but with a caveat”
Reviews.Author: Andyh07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here during a week long business trip to which we added a few days for fun. On the plus side, the hotel was in a fabulous location with superb transportation to all the parks- Magic Kingdom, Epcot, etc... Plus the Bakery on the Boardwalk had the best pastries I've ever eaten and I was there every night!! On the negative side, the self parking is quite a distance away from the lobby- so carrying luggage in ninety degree heat is a bit of a chore. The walls are PAPER THIN! We had a very amorous couple in the room next to us, so we had to hear their private moment(s) at two in the morning which was not fun. And there seemed to be a party going on outside our balcony too for FOUR hours, again not fun. However- and this is a plus, we went to the front desk the next morning and requested a room change which we had received without a problem and the room was stellar! Much bigger, with a view of Epcot fireworks and completely quiet. Also a little tip- if you like to unwind by watching TV, bring down some DVD's. The all Disney programming gets a bit much by day 2. The cast members were very friendly and very helpful with dinner reservations and tickets to the parks. I would stay here again if I could have that room again!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it......sorta”
Reviews.Author: LamarN
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my first trip to Disney in four years and our first stay at the Boardwalk. It was an anniversary celebration with lots of fine dining. Our room was great. Not too far down the hallway and VERY clean. One of the nicest rooms I've ever stayed in. Everything was in order and it was very quiet where we were. I read in another review where someone complained about the Boardwalk noise. If you book a room over the ESPN club, you're going to have a long walk and a noisy stay. Remember, the Boardwalk hotel is a long, narrow building. You might want to check on the location of the room when you book your room. ALSO, I didn't realize when I booked over the phone that your Disney vacation MUST BE PAID IN FULL WITHIN ABOUT 30 DAYS OR THEY CANCEL YOUR RESERVATION. We were almost canceled . Thankfully, I called and checked. Here's what I didn't like: Unless you want to go to Epcot every day, the transportation to the other parks leaves something to be desired. I'm not a big fan of Disney's bus service, especially late in the evening. If you stay late the Magic Kingdom is the ONLY place you can catch a bus back to the hotel. Be prepared for a fairly long wait if the park is closing. Not much breakfast and lunch options but Epcot is right there. Less than a five minute walk. Definitely do the quick service and snack dining plan. It's worth it. Our best evening meals? California Grill, Narcoosees and Yachtsman Steakhouse! Plan on $160 per night per couple. We had a great time and hope to be back soon but will definitely stay on the monorail line next time. It really spoils you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Epcot and Hollywood Studios”
Reviews.Author: robrackn
Reviews.Content: This is a deluxe resort at Disney World. We could have stayed anywhere but chose this location and we didn't regret it. In fact, we'll never stay at any other hotel while at Disney. You land at the airport, take the Disney Magical Express for about 45 minutes and you're dropped off at the door of this marvelous place. Head out to the parks or to eat and while you're away your luggage will be delivered to your room for you. First of all, don't sweat getting a room with a fancy view. The only time you are in the room is when you collapse from 14 hours of Disney stuff. You won't care what is on TV. You won't care what is going on outside or what it looks like outside. :) The hotel lobby is beautiful inside. The staff eagerly looks to assist you and makes check-in a breeze. The rooms were great. I think I read where Disney updates a certain percentage of rooms in each hotel each year -- I think we lucked out and got one of those newly refurbished rooms; mattress felt like they were brand new. The Boardwalk is a destination in itself. We talked to people who visited Downtown Disney. Somehow, they found out about Boardwalk and they went to Boardwalk the next night instead. We ate at Cat Cora's place one night and it was literally steps away. There is a great little bakery that's essentially next to the hotel. They're open late and I miss that place more than anything. You can hop down to the bakery for a sandwich or for pastries. There are little tables out front by the water to eat breakfast. It's just a great place. Boardwalk is directly across the water from Beach Club, and the Swan and Dolphin are visible. The boat ferry service to Hollywood and Epcot is right out front of the hotel. Boat service also takes you to the back of Epcot. Repeat --- you can only get to the front entrance of Epcot via buses. Boats and walking take you in at the back of Epcot (which was not a problem at all for us). During the night, ESPN has a big crowd with lots of stuff to do. There's also bike rentals where you can slowly cruise around the boardwalk. They're expensive. Hollywood Studios is a short 10 minute walk along the water. You can take the boat if you like but it's quicker to walk. Epcot is a 5 minute walk. Note that you come in the back entrance near England. All the rides ... and the monorail ... are at the front of Epcot. If you intend to do Late Magic Hours at Magic Kingdom, be advised that after 11pm the ONLY way back to the hotel is via the buses. Don't take the monorail and thing you can get to Epcot. At that late hour, the monorail won't go there. And I suggest finishing out the fireworks show very near the exit of Magic Kingdom. The only downside is there is no monorail service but all the upsides make that irrelevant. I don't see ever staying at a different hotel while at Disney World. This one is the best because it is closest to what WE like. Your mileage may vary. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location..loved the charm”
Reviews.Author: agbbrown
Reviews.Content: MY wife and I did a fair bit of research on the web and we were very happy with our choice of the Boardwalk Inn. Room was clean, good size and had attractive furnishings and a refrigerator. It overlooked a quiet green space. We were very happy with the look and feel of this hotel. Staff was very friendly and location was excellent. It was nice to take a walk on the boardwalk and there was plenty of activity in the evenings. A fun place to be. Walk to EPCOT in 10 minutes. My two young children loved the pool, especially the waterslide. Nice porch off the lobby with comfortable Rattan chairs to sit and watch the boardwalk and the lake. Great looking hotel and the location are the what made this place a winner for us. I don't really have anything negative to say about our experience at the Boardwalk Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the service?”
Reviews.Author: Elenitop
Reviews.Content: I arrived on the Disney shuttle to the hotel. I was in a walking boot after foot surgery -- kind of obvious that I wasn't totally fit for the moment. Nobody greeted me. No one offered to help this senior citizen struggling with two bags and an off-balance gait. Lugged it all in to front desk and checked in. When I asked if someone could help me with my bags, I was told to take them over to the Bell Station. -- which was, by the way, 10 yards from the elevators. No mini bar in room, no ice machines in sight, no soda machines, and room service prices up there. I was met by my son later in the day and when we tried to get a wheelchair so I could visit the park (way too much walking for a "gimp"), they told they didn't have any -- no suggestion either on what we could do otherwise unless we wanted to pay $30 to rent a motorized scooter. Was going to bring my grandchildren to Disney World -- think I'll take them to a cabin in the woods instead. At least there, this kind of service wouldn't be unexpected and the prices would be far more reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! What great treatment!”
Reviews.Author: trans4med
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 4 nights at Disney's Boardwalk Inn. They really took care of us, they put us up in a garden suite, and treated us to a wonderfull time. It was much more that we expected, and if we get the chance to return to Disney World we will be sure to stay there again. The location is great, and easy to get to all parks.

Reviews.Title: “So much to do at this Charming Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly60974
Reviews.Content: I struggled on whether to stay on the Disney property or another property still on the Disney property for about 1/3 the price (especially since we went during High season). We were taking my parents who were so excited to experience Disney for the 1st time with their grandchildren, so I decided to splurge so everyone could experience every magical moment possible. We absolutely made the right decision! I chose the Boardwalk for all of the shops, restaurants, and entertainment right there and it was even better than I imagined. We loved grabbing breakfast at the Bakery and enjoying it at a table by the water before heading to the parks. The Boardwalk is a beautiful hotel with lots of charm and wonderful cast members. The only negative was that I wish the main pool area was a a little larger for the size of the resort. Of course, it didn't stop my kids from having fun cooling down there each day during our mid-day break from the parks. And, it would be nice if the hotel had designated buses to Magic Kingdom, rather than sharing with the Swan & Dolphin. Other than that, the Boardwalk exceeded all of our expectations and we hope to go visit again very soon.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING RESORT!!”
Reviews.Author: Centerfire40
Reviews.Content: This is our first time that we've stayed at the Boardwalk Inn, and I just want to say that it is the BEST resort that we have stayed at in Disney World!! We visit there yearly and pick a different resort every year. That will not be the case anymore! I would recommend this resort to everyone! We loved how you could walk to Epcot and Hollywood Studios! The resort itself is just stunning! And everything that goes on at night on the Boardwalk is fantastic! It is just beautiful to sit on the Boardwalk in the evening and watch the fireworks from Epcot and the performers! The Mousekeeping was fantastic -- everything was fantastic! I cannot say anything negative about this resort! It is Disney Magic!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: disneygirl41
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at 6 of Disney's hotels within the park. This by far is definitely one of the best. I have two children 15 and 7 and there's plenty to do. Epcot & MGM are 10 min walk. We got the Disney deluxe dining plan. So much food! Well worth it. There are no restaurants within the hotel. The lounge does a continental breakfast in the morning.
