We ate at Kouzzina which was really good for breakfast. There's also a bakery which you can get bagels & sandwiches. This hotel has a fantastic workout facility too. Not that you'll need to exercise with all the walking you are going to do. I highly recommend the Whispering Canyon Cafe in the Wilderness Lodge! Pool is great. Both kids enjoyed the slide. Area is a little small but it was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great new rooms”
Reviews.Author: Alicnwondrln
Reviews.Content: I had to go down to FL for some business and stayed 2 nights at the Boardwalk Inn. I contacted Kelly and Channing at Travel with the Magic for a free quote. They were able to secure me a great deal on the room and book me some dining reservations in Epcot. The resort has recently remodeled it's rooms and they look great. I love that you can walk to Epcot and Hollywood Studios from this location. The one negative was the Internet service, it was slow and kept going in and out. The club level staff of Jackie, Pete, and Lorenzo were amazing.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel stays we have ever had - thanks in no small part to Pete (Concierge)!”
Reviews.Author: Koho26
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff was very nice, but not all that competent. After that everything about this hotel was top rate. Roome were large and very comfortable. Layout of hotel gives a feeling of a busy place with easy access to many things, but alos a quiet serence atmosphere. All staff were very friendly, but Pete (4th floor Concierge) was just exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “A Disney Gem”
Reviews.Author: cincytraveler123
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Disney's BoardWalk Resort several times -- all for business. It's a small, quaint hotel located within walking distance of Epcot and Hollywood Studios. It's located on Disney's BoardWalk area, which provides a beautiful boardwalk (imagine that) on a lake that has an Atlantic City feel to it. The hotel is very elegant and offers well appointed rooms and great service. Disney went all out with the decor -- it's unlike any other hotel I've stayed at. If you're in Orlando make a point to stop by the BoardWalk area and check out the hotel. And don't miss the Jellyrolls dueling piano bar at night!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with superb location, but you'll pay Disney prices”
Reviews.Author: Sailaways
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in January for a good friend's Disney wedding. I shared a quad room with a few of my friends. It was slightly cramped but a lot of fun. The room itself was nice, and on the larger side. It's decorated with a nod to the Boardwalk theme, with the linens in softer hues and wood furniture. There was a small desk, a decently sized mini-fridge, a safe, an iron/ironing board, and a big flatscreen TV. The bathroom was the split style, with toilet and shower/tub combo in one (tiny!) room and double sinks and vanity outside. Very convenient if you have a larger party and are all trying to get ready in the morning. Our room had a large balcony overlooking Epcot and the courtyard and villas. The balcony was fantastic for watching Illuminations at night - a nice reminder that you really are a stone's throw away from Epcot. It was nice to relax out there during downtime and enjoy the quiet space. The hotel itself is HUGE. Don't be fooled by its humble facade when you first enter the driveway. It's gigantic, and there are multiple wings, including one for DVC members only. You could probably get lost in this place if you didn't have a decent sense of direction. The Boardwalk's lobby is very pretty, with a very distinctive early 1900s Boardwalk theme throughout. Lots of wood, cozy, overstuffed sofas and armchairs, and a fireplace, all of which give you a feel of being in someone's opulent living room. The real centerpieces of the lobby area are two huge, detailed models of a rollercoaster and a carousel. Press a button and they come to life - very cool. The porch immediately outside the lobby has some nice wicker furniture and a view overlooking the grounds, another nice touch. Near the lobby is a small restaurant, only open for breakfast as far as I saw. The rest of the day it functions as a small lounge with some books and board games. Since we were there in January, it was too cold to use the pools, but they were large and looked nice. It was actually kind of sad to see the lifeguards stuck outside, dressed in windbreakers, watching the empty pools and dancing to the pool music on the speakers. One pool is a quiet, adult pool near the villas. The other is a huge kids' fantasy pool in the Boardwalk carnival theme, decorated with lots of bright colors, circus animals, and a carousel. It even has a towering waterslide where you exit via a frightening clown's oversized mouth. There was also a small jacuzzi adjacent. Around the hotel: Since you're kind of stuck on Disney property, be prepared to pay Disney prices if you want to eat. As I mentioned earlier, the hotel has a small restaurant/lounge. The Boardwalk area in the backyard of the hotel has more places to eat, including a Brewery, Cat Cora's Kouzzina restaurant, the Boardwalk Bakery, the ESPN cafe, and a general store. It sounds like a lot of choices, but the options do get tiring after awhile. The Boardwalk area comes alive in the early evening/at night, with bike rides, carnival games, food vendors, and street performers like magicians. There's also Jellyrolls, a piano bar, and the main attraction, the Atlantic dance hall. My friend's wedding reception was held here and it was beautifully decorated and run. The next night, we returned to see the club in action. It was a Saturday night with no cover, and surprisingly busy for being a Disney club. The bar was very busy and it was difficult to get a drink at times. Music was so-so, ranging from dated to fairly recent. They project music videos on a large screen above the dancefloor, so you'll always be entertained. I also liked the fact there were lots of small tables around for hanging out and escaping the club part for awhile. During the day the Boardwalk is a pleasant place to go for a walk and enjoy the scenery as the Disney water taxis (the "FriendShips") pass by constantly. Walk around the lake and you'll end up at the Yacht club and Beach club resorts, or at the back door of Epcot, as a friend and I unwittingly discovered on our first day. If you continue further past the Boardwalk resort (or take the "FriendShip"), you'll hit the Swan and Dolphin resorts, and Disney's Hollywood studios. This is a nice, clean, comfortable hotel with an imaginative theme and decor. Is it worth the exorbitant rate you'll pay ($300+/night) to stay on Disney property? Definitely not. Unfortunately, it loses a star for price. But, if you're a Disney nut and looking for a unique hotel with a great location on Disney property, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel at Walt Disney World”
Reviews.Author: 2Euro-Travellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in May 2010 and I have to say that the Boardwalk is the best choice for me. The rooms are very large and sleep up to 5 people. What I liked most was the location as the hotel is situated between Epcot and Disney's Hollywood Studios, which means that you can easily enjoy the pool in the afternoon and hop back to the parks afterwards (I always bothers me at Walt Disney World, that you cannot walk from your hotel to the parks). It takes 5 minutes to walk to Epcot and 15 to Disney's Hollywood Studios. I also loved the pool which features a great toboggan run. + newly refurbished and beautiful rooms with iPhone charger, in walking distance to Epcot and Disney's Hollywood Studios, 1 great family pool with huge toboggan run and 2 quite pools - no free wireless internet access (10,-$ for wired 24 hours access), no real restaurant in the hotel as they are all located on the Boardwalk

Reviews.Title: “Perfect... except for one detail.”
Reviews.Author: EyeMD
Reviews.Content: Most of the gushing you have read in other reviews are right. It is very hard to beat the location of this hotel. We splurged for Club Level and thoroughly enjoyed it, although the perk of merchandise being delivered directly to your room backfired on us. The concierge said for two days, "We never got it, but we'll try to locate it," when in fact the item had been in its rightful spot downstairs waiting for the concierge to pick it up for me. But that wasn't the detail I'm referring to. We had a stupendous terrace and view. If you look at the Flying Fish restaurant sign, we were the balcony right at the top right corner - huge space overlooking all of Crescent Lake. We watched the Boardwalk entertainers from our room. However, we had to suffer the blaring of the boat horns incessantly starting at 7:45 AM every day. Friday night - extra magic hours for Epcot - we suffered with it until midnight. While the concierge in the lobby was quite apologetic and helpful (sent us up some earplugs), the Club Level concierge got snooty and obnoxious and tried to convince us that this was a lovely sound and that, "Some guests request it." I would surely stay here again, but I would have no problem giving up the view in order to have peace & quiet in a non-lake view.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but not perfection”
Reviews.Author: CSturgeo
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Boardwalk Inn in 1997 with family and liked it a lot. I especially liked the location and as we were a couple of "oldies" our aim was to avoid noisy kiddie crowds and this hotel seemed the best choice. It is closest to the parks we wanted to visit. We had no wait at all checking in about 1PM on a Monday afternoon and were upgaded to a villa/cottage. I'm really not sure what they called it but it was nice and quiet and right by the pool and way more room than we needed. Since we were out all day we made little use of the lower level. But the fridge was handy. Our biggest complaint was the price of getting a breakfast reasonably. My husband really like a good fiber cereal and it cost us one snack point or over $3 for a dinky box of Raisin Bran and milk. I still love the this hotel but really think free wi-fi for in rooms is not too much to ask. I opted for 1 24 period during our 3 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge level room was worth it”
Reviews.Author: cressydoodles
Reviews.Content: With the price of breakfast, snacks and drinks in Disney World, this splurge was worth it for our family - mother, father, 21 yr old and 19 yr old. Continental breakfast and unlimited drinks and snacks really hit the spot. Sometimes we even skipped dinner! Location was the best I expereinced, compared to other Disney hotels we stayed in past, even better than Grand Floridian. Here you can walk to Epcot (5-10 min) and Hollywood Studios (15 -20 min). Or take the boat shuttle (many times took longer than walk). Our room had a small balcony with view of Epcot's Eiffel Tower. You can see some of the Epcot fireworks from the "food" lounge. Swimming pool looked neat but it was too cold to go in in January.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is in a great location and overall nice.”
Reviews.Author: amatmason
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the garden suite of the boardwalk inn. The only real negative was the very musty smell in the room. We had an upstairs/downstairs room. The odor was overwhelming when we arrived and they have a dehumidifier in the room. Over time, that helped but never really eliminated the odor. It was a bit bothersome and if you have allergies it would be a real deal breaker. Otherwise the Innkeepers suite was a nice luxury for morning breakfast and snacks. the location is very convenient for Epcot and MGM studios. Overall we had a wonderful time but i would not stay in this suite again due to the odor issue.

Reviews.Title: “Is Disney getting old?”
Reviews.Author: george9
Reviews.Content: Boardwalk rooms very old. You can hear all the noise coming from the other rooms also. Service at some of the restaurants very slow in preparing food. Front desk staff clueless

Reviews.Title: “First stay, and will be back”
Reviews.Author: ramoness
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Boardwalk. We stayed at Port Orleans for 2 nights in order to take advantage of boat transportation to Downtown Disney, and then transferred to Boardwalk to be near Epcot. (Also saved $ by splitting time between mid- and deluxe-priced resorts). Had no issues with our luggage being moved from one resort to the other - very efficiently handled while we were at the parks. Boardwalk is a large resort, with conference center. My kids were disappointed by no free WiFi, but liked the room layout and location. Our room on the 3rd floor overlooked the front entrance and Magical Express pickup location, but I'm actually glad we didn't pay more to overlook the boardwalk and water, because I think those rooms would pick up a lot of the noise below. Walking back from Epcot one night at 11 pm, there were groups of teenagers throwing a football on the lawn area between the hotel and boardwalk itself, and I'd imagine the sound just amplified, up to the higher floors. Pastries/breakfast beverages were sold in the small lounge area on the 2nd floor, and I think the pastries were from the Boardwalk Bakery. In the morning, long lines formed outside the Bakery on the boardwalk outside, but there was a little cart/vendor right across from the Bakery selling the same items, with no line! We saved a lot of time by buying them at the cart, and eating while walking to Epcot. Main draw to this resort for us was the walkability to Epcot. The entrance to Epcot is between the France and England pavilions, and it's great to not have to deal with the long lines at the main entrance to the park. Takes about 5-10 minutes, depending how fast you walk. My only gripe is with the "bag inspection" - is anything actually found in a bag that is ever an issue? It really holds up the line when you get behind a family who brings 3 large stuffed backpacks with 18 different compartments in each pack! (What the heck do they pack in those, anyway?) The pool's waterslide was closed for repairs when we were there, and the first day the pool was closed when spraypaint got in the water. Disappointing, but what can you do? Pool was open the next day, and seemed very clean. Bar near the pool serves drinks and snacks. We ate at ESPN Club 2 nights - very easy to get seats in restaurant part, because most people want to be in the area where they broadcast (on the left as you walk in). Kids loved the Club - "Mom, there are 8 TVs in the restrooms!" and staff will change a channel for you, so you can watch what you want while you eat. Walked to marina on the opposite side of the lake, and rented Jet Skis (can't remember Disney's name for them). Kids 12 and older can drive by themselves, and this was a nice break from the theme parks on a hot day. Charge was around $32 for 1/2 hour and $45 for 60 minutes. 2 can fit in each Jet Ski. Room and hotel was very clean, and beds comfortable. Magical Express worked great.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BMR2723
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge, Port Orleans, Caribbean Beach. It was a strong desire to stay at the Boardwalk, so when my husband's company arranged a conference there I HAD to tag along :) I LOVED how close the property was to EPCOT and Hollywood Studios. It not only was within walking distance, but if you started walking before the boat left the dock at the resort, you could beat the boat to the gate to both parks. With a park hopper it was definitely worth staying at Boardwalk. The rooms were pretty consistent with the other rooms that I have stayed in at the other resorts. Double sinks came in handy. The water pressure did not seem great. Loved the balcony that looked out onto the Boardwalk. I liked how close of a walk it was to get to our room from anywhere in the property (unlike AKL). Only issue with the sound in the room was that you could hear the boats coming in and some captains liked to honk excessively compared to others. The service was good, check-in took very little time (which was good because it was close to 1am when we checked in). However the staff member did not seem like the friendliest person working..but it could have also been the late time we were checking in. The Boardwalk was a great place to hang out as well...we went to Kouzzina for dinner our first night and it was really good (make reservations in advance though). The Sangria was awesome as well and you can get it at the pizza window! The Bakery was really good (I loved the tomato and mozzarella sandwich). We also went to Jellyrolls, which even though there is a cover charge to get in, it was well worth the money and we had a blast it was so entertaining. The pool area was cool, like the big kid that I am I had to try the waterslide which was alot of fun. But the following day, I opted for the "quiet pool" which was very nice and the temperature of the water was nice and warm as well. The Magic Express was not that convenient, at the airport we were told that at 12pm, we would have to wait 45 minutes...so we opted for a taxi. On the way back to the airport they left a note under the door for a pick-up 4 hours before my flight. I took a taxi 2 hours before my flight and had no issues. In short based on our travel preferences this would be the best option for us to stay, because of the proximity to the parks, the nightlife options and the food options.

Reviews.Title: “Boardwalks just average”
Reviews.Author: kicker147
Reviews.Content: I arrived at Disney's Boardwalk Inn at mid afternoon. The line to check in was only two people deep and went very quickly. Our room was on level one, when you enter the hotel you are actually on the 2nd level where the lobby is located. The room was very standard. Bed fairly comforable, desk with wired high speed internet, NO WIFI HUGE BUMMER, couch, flat screen tv, coffee maker, small fridge "empty", and standard bathroom. Most all the rooms feature a balcony even the ones that dont face the lake. Being on the first floor we had french doors that lead to a sitting area with two chairs and a table that overlooked the courtyard. The hotel commands a premimum price, but I dont feel you are getting a premimum hotel. You are mainly paying for the location, not the service or ameminties. There is a bar on the second level, and a sitting area with rocking chairs and benches that overlook the boardwalk and the lake. The hotel is very close to Epcot, the boat is right outside, or you can walk there in less then 5 mins. I did make use of the general store/disney shop that is located on the boardwalk as you walk out of the hotel. It is stocked with snacks, beer, small selection of liquor, cigars, ie the stuff i look for when im on vacation, and of course disney merchandise. Overall If I returned to disney I would probably stay at a different hotel, the location is nice, but disney has transportation down pat so overall if you are staying at any disney property you will get to where you want to go with no issue.

Reviews.Title: “Business Traveler's Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: greg1968
Reviews.Content: Don't plan on getting any work done at this hotel. The internet service is a nightmare. You will be more productive at a Motel 6 or some other fleabag hotel. Whoever devised/designed this hotel's internet services must have been on drugs. Let me count the ways that Boardwalk Inn's internet service is the worst by far I have ever experience in my years of business travel. (No one comes even remotely close) 1) No wi-fi in rooms. 2) Boardwalk charges for purportedly "high speed" etherrnet access via in-room cable. I might be able to overlook the fact that they charge for in-room internet, except for the speed is so slow as to be practically unusable. It is NOT high-speed. 3) If you are attending a conference at this hotel, you will need to pay an additional fee (on top of your in-room fee) to access wi-fi in the convention center. Only problem is, the wi-fi only works in the convention center lobby. There is no wi-fi coverage in the actual conference rooms, so if you attending a meeting or conference you have to leave the conference room if you want wi-fi coverage. 4) They have wi-fi in the hotel lobby, but if you want to use it, you must pay extra for that too (separate charge from in-room internet, and separate from convention center lobby). But there are only two bars of wi-fi signal strength, so download speeds are slow. And that is if you can even get connected in the first place. I tried three credit cards and none of them worked. I had to ask the manager to help get me connected, which meant waiting 15 minutes while she called customer service for Disney's wi-fi provider. After getting me connected the service suddenly terminated 5 minutes later, and I had to get the manager to once again get things working again. In summary, it is a separate charge to access the internet via ethernet cable in your room, yet another separate charge to access wi-fi in the conference room lobby (no access in the conference rooms), and yet another separate charge to access wi-fi in the hotel lobby. All of the above are either slow, buggy, or have limited range, or a combination of the above. As an aside, the rooms in the carpets are nasty-sticky.

Reviews.Title: “Sooo disappointed”
Reviews.Author: DTherapy
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th stay at the Boardwalk, and have been very pleased in the past (the location is stellar). We choose this hotel again because we were at WDW for Marathon Weekend, and the proximity to the race start was a plus. Like others reviewers, we completed the on-line check-in, only to find that there is no expedited, separate station at the Boardwalk. As a result, I waited in the same long line as everyone else. I did receive a view upgrade (without asking), which was wonderful until I see the rusted windows and obvious leaking and wallpaper destruction underneath. (This did take away from the view of the courtyard just a bit...) HOWEVER, the most disappointing and unacceptable part of this stay was the fact that THERE WAS NO HOT WATER IN OUR ROOM. Imagine running at 5:30 am, at 45 temperatures, coming back for a nice hot shower, and finding less than lukewarm water. I initially received no response from management, and called back after waiting for 3 hours for maintenance- time not spent at the parks. After 6 additional calls, someone did come up, and the engineer did admit to me that "one of their boilers was down". It wasn't until the following morning that we had hot, hot water, and not a single manager called back to check if our problem was resolved. Upon check-out, I mentioned our difficulties very politely to the staff, and got nothing more than a casual "sorry". The water wasn't, but I am boiling.....

Reviews.Title: “Wow -- I expected better than this...”
Reviews.Author: HighExpectations60
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Orlando on December 11. We purchased a Disney Package and were told since we had checked in online, we would expedite receiving our tour package and room keys. On the bus, the video confirmed that there is a special desk at the resorts for online checked guests. Nope, not at the Boardwalk. The desk clerk advised me that the printers weren’t working and he would have to complete our information manually. He was moderately pleasant. I asked a few questions about the return trip and referred me to the Concierge, who referred me to the Bell Captains desk, who gave me inaccurate information (we had an early flight home on December 16 and wanted to be sure we did things right.) Our room was a bit worn but serviceable. Some toast remnants on the kitchenette counter and the back splash needed a little cleaning, but OK. The room is pretty much standard Marriott Courtyard, except for the price. The towel hanger on the back of the door is a round knob which will not hold a towel when you close the door. The fold out sofa bed has a thin foam mattress…to be expected I guess, but coupled with a raised metal rail, requires gymnastics to get in and out of the bed without banging your knee. It is not possible to sit on the bed and hang your legs over without the rail digging in to the back of your knees or thighs. We had the Disney Dining plan, but I was surprised when we obtained two muffins, a banana, and an orange in the hotel at breakfast and it cost us two meals and two snacks. Really? No complimentary continental breakfast at a deluxe resort?? Over the length of our stay, we found the staff to be like the desk clerk… not rude but not really helpful, either, and certainly not what you see in the Disney advertising. This is our second stay at a Disney “Luxury” resort. Three years ago we stayed across the waterway at the Beach Club Villas. Each day, we returned to a clean room and a little array of “towel origami” around our son’s bath toys. This is apparently not the way it is done at the Boardwalk. We found the gift shop/sundries store surprisingly well stocked and the shopkeepers very friendly and helpful…obviously a separate vendor from the hotel management. We received a note under the door Monday advising us they would be upgrading the hotel’s computer system from Tuesday at 5:30 until sometime Wednesday afternoon. We returned to our room on our last night (Wednesday) and discovered our room had not been serviced. When we asked for fresh towels (remember we can't reuse them because there are no hooks) housekeeping told us they missed our cleaning because the computers were down until around 3 pm that day. I'm amazed they didn't manually track which rooms required cleaning. I think they did that before computers... Oddly, the elevators were set to close very quickly after opening…you had to run and block the door to get in. Maybe a dozen people commented on that in our presence. One 65-ish woman walking with a cane missed the elevator and hit the door with her can in frustration. My family ran into two room maintenance/repair guys in the hallway and mentioned it to them. They explained that was not their work responsibility. They did not offer to report it to the person in charge of the elevators. Transportation from the Boardwalk consists of water taxis, buses and walking. The buses that ran to Downtown Disney made numerous stops, and were often too full to take passengers. We discovered that a regular taxicab from Hollywood to Boardwalk and from Boardwalk to Coronado Springs was only $5-6 plus tip. A taxicab from Boardwalk to Animal Kingdom was only $7.50. Overall, our opinion is that we cannot recommend the Boardwalk as a destination. We are thinking that we will stay off site at Marriott or Hilton and enjoy better accommodations for less money. The draws of transportation, access and quality were not there for us. The Concierge Desk at Boardwalk was invariably unhelpful and unwilling.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected.”
Reviews.Author: Shatterhand
Reviews.Content: I think some of these negative reviews are from unfortunate misers with custom-tailored silver spoons. I saved for four months to pay for this trip with my fiancee and it was worth every penny. The service, from what I experienced, was great. As someone who hates to ask for help, there were a few moments where I had no choice as well as pleasant times it was offered. It began when we stepped off the Magical Express that had conveniently taken us from the Airport to the front door of our resort. I know some people have had luggage issues, but the luggage was at our room ten minutes after we got there. The club level concierge we met and got our keys from was pleasant, personable, and seemed genuinely happy to help. The most memorable for me was when I stopped by the lounge for a late-night snack and locked myself out of my room, my then-girlfriend sound asleep inside. Even though it must have been about midnight, perhaps later, I finally decided to head downstairs to the concierge desk for assistance. With no issue and only a minimum of necessary questions, they printed out a new card for me and I was able to get back in immediately. My fiancee also managed to lose her wallet and camera while we were enjoying a whimsical time at DisneyQuest in Downtown Disney. By the time we realized it, somebody had already picked it up. The next morning room service called to let us know they had it. Downtown Disney was about a 15 minute drive away, but someone made sure they got it to the resort overnight and made sure it was returned to us. That's service. On our last day, I noticed that the ESPN grill nearby (pretty good food, by the way) had charged a meal to the room's tab instead of using the meal allotment. I took this to the concierge, mere hours before checkout, and they called the grill immediately and removed the charge, no questions asked. The room was fantastic. I'm no interior decorator, but it felt like it felt the theme of the resort perfectly, an idealized version of Atlantic City or Coney Island in their golden days. The beds were comfortable enough for me to consider actually purchasing some of the linens and give us the best night of sleep we've had in years. The balcony overlooked a quiet little garden outside the resort, and every night we could go out and watch the fireworks at Epcot. We got two queen sized beds, but that wasn't an issue because we were used to sharing a single twin. While I would have preferred a king, I understood that there was no way to ensure that we would get one and that it really wasn't necessary. Room service was a major factor for us. We could use our meal plans for it, and at the end of a nice long day, it was great to just relax and let the food come to us. The food was good, too. I think we played it safe and got pizza. The soft drinks that were included were nothing extraordinary, but the deserts were as ample as the entree and we rarely finished one in the same night. Due to the size of Disney World, no one resort can have an perfect location. Magic Kingdom and Downtown Disney were the furthest, but Epcot and the Studios were a brief, laid-back ferry ride away. There are a few fine places to eat nearby. ESPN Grill for the more Americana-inclined, Cat Cora's for Greek, Flying Fish for -you guessed it- seafood, a bakery, a pizzeria, and a pair of nightclubs that I can't speak to, being underage at the time. The lounge was great. Actually, it rendered some of our meals useless because of the offerings. While we didn't gorge ourselves, picking up a snack here and there helped keep us full, and the complementary soft drinks (including lemonade and iced tea) helped us slake our thirst in between actual meals. A few cordials, and coffee. A great place to just relax or pick up a snack when you have some downtime. If I had to complain about something, it would be the price. But I won't. Because a trip to Disney should not be a penny-pinching affair. It should be a time to spend an irresponsible amount of money to have fun. In addition, there is almost always some sort of deal or special event to allow savings. Around the time that we went, some of the rooms were going for nearly 50% off per night. If money's that much of an issue, spend ten minutes to figure out a good time to go for less. It doesn't have to be the coldest week in February. These deals were around in mid-August. I would complement the service, rooms, and food, for the experience I detailed above. If you've got the money, don't whine about spending it. If you don't, look for a deal or go someplace else. The Value resorts weren't bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: oilersrule99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boardwalk Inn during May 2010 with our two girls ages 8 and 10. We loved our stay. The hotel is very well located between Epcot and Hollywood Studios. Epcot is an easy 5 minute walk and HS is about 15 minutes. You can walk to the Disney Beach Club and Disney Yacht Club hotels which are just across the lake. We took the ferry a few times just for the fun of it, they were always right on time. Staff were extremely friendly and provide the same level of service and Disney experience that you get in the parks. It was very convenient to have the shops and restaurants of the Boardwalk so close. We'd get our coffee and breakfast in the morning at the Boardwalk Bakery which was awesome. There were face painters, jugglers, and caricature artists every night to keep the kids entertained. We ate at the ESPN Zone a couple of times as well. Our room was overlooking a courtyard and was between the adult pool and the main pool. The main pool was great, the kids loved the waterslide and the activities/games that the hosts put on. The pool was a great temperature. Overall, it was a great place to stay and we'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: lovey8
Reviews.Content: This was a splurge for us to celebrate a birthday. I did the online check-in as advised to lessen the wait and I was told we could pick up paper tickets at the customer service desk in the hotel. I had gotten tickets through AAA and purchased tickets for Mickey's Christmas Party via phone; however the official paper Disney tickets had to be obtained. When we arrived at Boardwalk Inn there was no on-line check in line so we had to wait in a regular line. I showed someone my ticket vouchers and was told they could not provide the tickets because of some type of computer upgrade. We checked in around 10:30 AM and were told they would advise us when the room was clean . We asked to store our luggage in the meantime. The people at the check in counters were mostly tired looking and grouchy. The hotel never advised us our room was ready. Another family member arrived that evening and checked in later and that is how we knew the room location and that it was clean. When we went to retrieve our luggage there were about 5 or 6 people milling around with nothing to do and we were the only people in line, but it took about 7 minutes to retrieve 4 small bags. The birthday celebration was never mentioned or celebrated and it felt like we were one of a thousand and that extra bit of customer care was absent throughout our short stay. The manager was circulating around in the lobby and was pleasant but seemed ineffective. The room was lovely and it was wonderful to walk to Epcot. The location was superb. However, I would not pay this much money again for this level of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Boardwalk Inn more and more a Mickey Mouse Operation”
Reviews.Author: twisted_diva
Reviews.Content: This is our third year in a row at the Boardwalk Inn. Our first year was lovely. The second year wasn't bad although their check-in baggage handler (at the hotel) made a poor joke about luggage security which my husband did not take well and reported to Disney management. This year Disney appeared to have mounted a disinformation campaign for paying guests. Echoing concerns expressed elsewhere on TripAdvisor about the Boardwalk, the concierge staff was lazy, inefficient, and at times clueless. Online check-in gained us perhaps 2 minutes in line (an accompanying colleague did not check-in online and finished at about the same time). We arrived on a Wednesday to find out that the only way to get park schedules for the following week was to call the Disney information line directly -- no one at the hotel or in the parks could tell us the schedule for the following week, and generally weren't sure of park hours for the current week. The phone in the room wasn't properly programmed, making things even more confusing. And, at the end of our stay, the woman I spoke with on the information line about baggage check-in and the Magical Express argued with me about how to pay for check-in luggage, and wasn't aware of what the printed material Disney sent us regarding baggage stated. There was nothing 'magical' about her attitude and I complained to the hotel manager. Finally, for those of you who think that the weeks between Thanksgiving and Christmas are less crowded, that was not the case this year as one in our party was informed that Disney had booked a large number of conventions and gave free tickets to employee families so that the park would look full while they filmed their Christmas special.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: ssgtravel
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Boardwalk nearly every year for the past 10 years at least. It's a terrific hotel, quite convenient to two Disney parks. I had requested adjoining rooms as we were traveling with our daughter, son-in-law and infant grandson. When checking in, we were not assigned adjoining rooms, but when I requested that they try to accommodate us, one of the desk managers came over and spent quite a long time moving rooms around so that we could get adjoining ones. Both rooms were fine--clean and neat, no maintenance problems, cleaned every day. It's hard to understand the negative comments posted below. We've never had these problems. Hopefully, these are isolated incidents, which will not persist long term.

Reviews.Title: “I would agree....”
Reviews.Author: glyndab
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel - but service needs a big upgrade. I've been a Disney traveler for years and have stayed at several hotels on and off property and I have to admit that I was most disapointed by this hotel. The location was fabulous - you could walk to Epcot and to Hollywood Studios, but transportation anywhere else was a crapshoot. You didn't know if you were going to be waiting 30 minutes (or 45 like we did once coming back from Blizzard Beach) or if it would be easier to take a cab. Our big complaint was mousekeeping. Really disapointing. The room was never really cleaned. Dirty dishes were left in the room, there was mold or mildew on the walls in the bathroom that were never wiped down, there was old gum left in the trashbag from the day before - I just have to say it was really disappointing. We're already looking forward to our next trip - but we both have decided we will not stay at the Boardwalk again. Come on Mouseketeers - live up to your Disney standard, becaue this trip - it really didn't.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, comfortable resort in the middle of WDW!”
Reviews.Author: allenandstef
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at Disney’s Boardwalk Inn recently. Previously, we’ve stayed on property at a moderate resort, but on this trip we wanted to try a deluxe resort. After exploring all our options, we chose the Boardwalk because of its atmosphere and the proximity to so many other resorts and parks. We arrived very early in the morning to check in and went immediately to the online check in counter. (We had checked in on line before we ever left home!) We were greeted immediately by a very friendly cast member who had our welcome packet waiting for us. She explained the dining plan, gave us our keys and we were on our way within minutes. Our room was great – comfortable, nice size, plenty of closet space and shelf space, nice flat screen TV, couch, small balcony overlooking a courtyard. You could even see Spaceship Earth and the Eiffel Tower over at Epcot. The bathroom setup was very practical – two sinks with lots of shelf space outside the bathroom. In the bathroom was the toilet and shower/tub. With three adults in one room, this arrangement allowed us to get ready very efficiently in the mornings and still have privacy in the bathroom. The main resort pool was closed for refurbishment so we used one of the quiet pools. It was indeed quiet -- a simple, nice sized pool in one of the courtyards. It was all we needed for a cool relaxing dip in the pool followed by a warm soak in the hot tub after a day of playing at the parks. The Boardwalk itself is an enjoyable atmosphere. A few shops and places to eat. It’s a nice place for a stroll. You can rent a surrey bike (quadricycle) and go for a ride around the lake. There’s a dance hall and a dueling piano bar. All in all, a very fun atmosphere for a hotel. The location is excellent! From our room, we were a very easy 5 minute walk to Epcot’s rear entrance right between England and France in the World Showcase. We were also about a 15-20 minute walk along a dedicated path to the Hollywood Studios. Just across the lake are the Yacht Club and Beach Club Resorts, along with the Swan and Dolphin hotels. You can even walk to one of Disney’s miniature golf courses. Having so much clustered in one area provided many great things to do. We went to the Dolphin for dinner at Schula’s one night. You could easily go to Beaches and Cream (an ice cream parlor) over at the Beach Club. And… if you want to save your walking for the theme parks, they run boats regularly between the resorts and theme parks at the Boardwalk. So you can ride to Epcot or Hollywood Studios and back (or any of the neighboring resorts). That convenience to two of Disney’s theme parks and other resorts was a HUGE perk of staying at the Boardwalk! The only real downside to staying at the Boardwalk is the lack of a good counter service restaurant. There are plenty of good full-service options, but we often didn’t want to spend that kind of money. And the proximity to two theme parks and other resorts means that you can enjoy their dining options with relative ease. But so many of Disney’s other resorts have great counter service restaurants that offer a variety of foods and less expensive options than the full-service places. We missed that at the Boardwalk. That would be our only real suggestion to improve the Boardwalk – offer a good counter service place to eat. Because of that, there really wasn’t a good quick and inexpensive place for breakfast or an evening meal. Sadly, there just wasn’t enough time to enjoy it all. We never got to enjoy the health club or any of the restaurants. It’s Disney… so went spent most of our days at the theme parks and other attractions. But we would certainly go back to the Boardwalk again and look forward to staying there for longer someday!

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: fanofaruba
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I and our 2 good friends stayed here for one night November 30 and checked out December 1st. We were the last of a group of 18 that vacationed at Disney from Thanksgiving day. We all spent the first 5 night at Port Orleans - Riverside. 12 of the 18 of us left Tuesday, November 30th. 6 of us were staying. 2 stayed at a different resort and the 4 of us decided to move to the Broadwalk on the concierge level. On a prior visit, we stayed at the Grand Floridian on the concierge level and really enjoyed ourselves. We checked into the Boardwalk Tuesday afternoon and were led to our room by Pete. He seemed more interested in telling us about his brother's employment than the room. When we first opened the door, we were hit with and extreme mildew smell. The air conditioning was on and the room was extremely cold. Pete left and we got settled. We discovered that garbage from a prior guest was left under the sink nad there was taffy left laying around on the floor. Also, the trim around one of the windows was hanging and bottom of the door frame was rotted. As we stayed in the room, the mildew smell was so bad we decided to call maintenance. The gentleman came and started a dehumidifier that stayed on the entire length of our stay. It's a good thing none of us need quiet when we sleep as it was quite loud. The mildew smell never went away. We made use of the concierge level food and drink and it was quite good. However, we stayed in the Garden Suites and the room for the food and drink was a distance away. As we were sitting around the pool at about 4:30pm, a woman entered our room. We thought she may be checking on the dehumidifier so we just stayed by the pool. When we returned to the room, it had been tuned down (including the sleeper sofa in the living room). Now this was 4:30. We had to fold the bed back up so we had somewhere to sit when we were in the room. Also, the 2 others that stayed from our party came to visit. We had just come back from the 5-7 refreshments on the concierge level. There were no refreshments out after 7 so we decied to show the 2 people (my friend's nephew and his girlfriend) that stayed extra the great benefit of staying on the concierge level. At the Boardwalk, one can watch the Epcot fireworks from the balcony of the Inn Keepers Suite. We knew there would be no refreshments out as they ended at 7 and would not start again until 8 so we took our guests to the concierge room. Pete was stationed at the desk as we walked by, He said "oh, you have more people?" We stated that we had met them at the hotel and watned to show them the Inn Keepers room. He went on to say that you have to be staying in a Club level room to enter the Inn Keepers Suite. Tehn he backtracked when he realized the time and said go ahead. We decided to go back to our room and visit. Our guests left and we went back to the Inn Keepers room for Dessert and Cordials and to see the fireworks. They were closing at 10 but there were still about 10 of us in the room. Pete came in and starting turning lights off and taking everything away. We felt rushed as did the other people there with us. I understand taking teh food away but why could be not finish what we had? This experience was so so different that the Grand Floridian. I don't even know how these 2 hotels can be in the same category.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel brought down by poor service”
Reviews.Author: BeeJay22647
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, beautiful surroundings, but just enough clueless employees in need of retraining to lower the overall standard of good service found here and unfortunately to act as a minor irritation throughout our stay as well as to detract from the many good employees working there. Maid service was poor. Maid did not clean coffee pot and left clumps of dried creamer in the bottom of "supposedly" washed and changed coffee mugs. No daily room check by her resulted in several burnt out light bulbs upon arrival and constantly sticking flush toilet handle that let the toilet run throughout the stay. Front desk personnel listened to my complaints but gave no active feedback to have maid correct them. A maintenance department call did bring someone with one light bulb although 2 were reported as out. The Front Desk person running the online check-in window that was suppose to "breeze you through your registration process" took longer than the regular front desk check-in and was no help with the Disney packet she was bragged about online to "review" with the guest. An example of not really caring about detailed service was the telephone key overlay for one-key dialing of hotel departments was different from what the actual numbers represented. A call to the Bell Station was answered by Alamo Rental Car and another to Housekeeping brought a recording from entertainment ticket services. We ended up placing all calls through the hotel operator. A Front desk person did not know their own lounge sold the same coffee that she directed my wife to go one block down on the boardwalk to a bakery to buy. Each incident was not enough grief to actually ruin a vacation but was still a very surprising number of poorly informed employees found under one roof considering the hefty daily occupancy rate of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice out of the way Disney resort, away from all the noise”
Reviews.Author: newflyer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a few times and have been lucky to get one of the cottages behind the main hotel building on 2 occasions. I had very little time in my room because I was there on business but the room was very quiet, so sleep came easily. One complaint I have is that on one occasion there was a large bag of dirty laundry left outside my door for about 24 hours, it was removed after I complained. The other complaint I have is that I brought back some deserts on a plate and the cleaning person emptied the contents but left the dirty plate and napkin on the table outside my cottage for about 24 hours. It was removed after I complained. There was a jacuzzi in my room that worked, well sort of. The water was shooting out of one part of it that it was not supposed to come out of. I complained about this but did not have the opportunity to see if was fixed. I would still stay there again. I have stayed in a few Disney properties for leisure and for business and this one is my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “if i could live there i would”
Reviews.Author: Disneylover82
Reviews.Content: I am a HUGE Disney fan and i am always there. when i go to Disney i always stay on property and i always stay at the Boardwalk. when i checked in they told me that i have stayed there over 90 times!!! so that goes to show how much i enjoy the resort. Disneys boardwalk is just amazing. it has so much to offer. its great for adults and kids. The room are so nice and the beds are amazing. i always get a good nights sleep there. i love the pool there. it is so big and has a slide to match the pools massive size. it also has a kiddie pool for the younger swimmers, and right next to the kiddie pool is a small playground with slides for the kids, for adults they have a bar next to the pool. it also serves food. i also love the actual boardwalk. its loaded with stores and reastraunts. at night the boardwalk comes to life. it had arcade games and magicians. it also has a dance hall for those 21 and up. something else that i love about the resort is the location. you can literally walk to Epcot ( and at night you can see the fireworks from boardwalk). and if you want to go to hollywood studios then just take a short boat ride over. the Boardwalk is an amazing place with an amazing staff that make sure that you are having a magical experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort...room at the end of the hall is a long walk!!”
Reviews.Author: cmspock
Reviews.Content: The Boardwalk is a beautiful resort. We loved the theming, proximity to Epcot and the Boardwalk itself for the nightlife. The kids loved the slide at the pool. (No clown phobia here!)The only negative we could complain about is there is only one entrance and if your room is at the end of the hallway (like ours was), its a VERY long walk to get anywhere. I guess one bonus of being at the end of the hall is we had a room with 2 balconies. One overlooked the gardens and one overlooked the quiet pool. Overall is was a gorgeous hotel and we would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic quaint hotel in great location near Epcot”
Reviews.Author: perrystreet
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at the Boardwalk with family. The hotel is really charming. Nice rooms. Furniture adorable. Looks like its out of Cottage Living. You get 2 queen beds plus a couch turned twin. Perfect for families. Balcony faced a courtyard but even that was a great view. Easy walk to Epcot and you take the bus to Magic Kingdom and Animal Kingdom and walk or boat to Hollywood Studios easily. The Boardwalk area is really nice. You can relax there on a bench with a glass of wine. There is an arcade for the kids. The pool is very nice, has a bar, slide and play area but was not as great as the Beach Club when I stayed there many years ago. (Beach Club has a lazy river and a more natural atmosphere. Bus system was a long wait at times to get places and makes many stops to other resorts in the area, but not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: meg94
Reviews.Content: The Boardwalk puts you rigt in the middle of the action at Disney. You are close to the parks and there is a lot of enterainment right along the Boardwalk at night for you and the kids. You can walk to epcot or Hollywood Studios. There is a great pool with a waterslide that the kids loved even when it was only 50 degrees outside.

Reviews.Title: “Boardwalk Inn was Very, Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: aeh_07
Reviews.Content: We just came back from 8 days at DisneyWorld and stayed at the Boardwalk Inn. My husband and I were both impressed and enjoyed the hotel very much. We arrived late evening so our room was ready, of course. The room was very clean, the bedding and linens were immaculate. We had a small balcony with a couple of chairs and a table overlooking the courtyard. The staff was very friendly and helpful - the concierge desk answered many of our questions over the week. No matter what we asked about, we got an answer...the staff never replied with "I don't know". There is a small lounge to get continental breakfast (eat there or to go) or cocktails (after 5:00 p.m.). The Boardwalk itselft has a few different restaurants and gift type shops. We ate 3 times at Kouzzina - Cat Cora's restaurant - (2 b-fasts and 1 dinner) and the food was very good. The only issue came when we were charged 3 table service dinners on the Disney Dining Plan when we only used 2. I went to the hotel concierge with the receipt and they immediately credited back 1 table service to our plan. There is an ESPN Club - was a fun place for a couple of beers and to watch the games. I can't really say anything negative about this hotel. The quality of the staff, service, and transportation around DisneyWorld was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: dianainmass
Reviews.Content: The Boardwalk Inn is a great location to stay at Disney. You can walk to Epcot or jump on the water taxi to go to several locations and great meals. The only down side is no real restaurant in the hotel. They're all located on the Boardwalk. But a great place to go is the Piano Bar - JellyRolls which is a few feet away. You can watch the fireworks display at Epcot right from sitting on the boardwalk itself which is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, subpar service”
Reviews.Author: Barbarann
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Boardwalk Inn wasn't exactly objectionable, but for the price the service was certainly spotty. Housekeeping was unpredictable - we didn't know from day to day what would actually be done in the room, or whether we would even get more coffee or more than one mug for the in-room coffee maker (most days we got one, and my husband would take his hot tea in a glass). The concierge desk, which did our check-in and was available for answering questions, was staffed by unfriendly and unhelpful people. For example, when we asked how to go to Hollywood Studios from the hotel, we were told to catch a water taxi outside. No directions (something as simple as "go out the front door and it will be on your left"), no recommendations/estimated timetables, nothing. Also, I had told the reservations hotline that we would be celebrating my husband's birthday and was reassured it would be remembered - we heard nothing about it, in the form of congratulations or otherwise, until the day we checked out. I would definitely stay at a different resort in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort at WDW”
Reviews.Author: BrerPeter
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting Walt Disney World for vacation, and you want to visit both Epcot and Disney's Hollywood Studios, and even The Magic Kingdom, this is definitely the place to stay. Not only is the hotel clean, beautiful, and has great pools, but the walking distance to Epcot, DHS, and the BoardWalk is incredible! Easily the best resort at Walt Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect DVC location”
Reviews.Author: toby495
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom vacation club villa (preferred view-main pool), could not have been better. A great central location with a short walk to Disney Hollywood Studios and Epcot's world showcase. Can't think of anything I would change. We are already planing our return stay at this Disney resort!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to visit, would stay somewhere else though.”
Reviews.Author: dancer3644
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 7 night 8 day stay at the Boardwalk Inn. I thought that the hotel was a lot of fun and it provided great entertainment throughout the nighttime. But, there were some drawbacks to the hotel. Three years ago I stayed at the Moderate level resort hotel, Port Orleans French Quarter, I would stay there again before the Boardwalk. I say this because the room we received was a standard room but it looked so outdated, paint was peeling off of the walls, the bathroom was very tiny, the room looked like a value resort level room. I just felt like for the price we paid, the room would have been up to better conditions. Honesty, for anyone who is over 21 and traveling to Disney World, if you plan on spending all day at the park and just going to the hotel to sleep, just do the Value or Moderate resort levels. Also, the bus service for Boardwalk was VERY slow. Especially the Downtown Disney Bus. We stopped at one of the water parks and 4 hotels before we got to the Boardwalk. It easily took about an hour to get from Downtown Disney to the Boardwalk. The same went for the ferry to and from Hollywood Studios and Epcot. Boardwalk is the last stop on all of these. Honestly, I thought for what we paid, we would get more. Also, make sure to put the privacy sign outside your door! Right at 8:30 a.m. we had housekeeping knocking on our door waking us up! I really think that the Boardwalk is a nice place to visit during the day or night, but not worth the amount that it costs. Stay at the French Quarter in Port Orleans if you want a nice stay but know you will be staying at the parks a lot!

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: ShavonneTurner
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Boardwalk Inn from July 11 through July 16, 2010. We had a wonderful stay. There are many perks to staying at the Boardwalk Inn. The Boardwalk has great dining, shopping, and entertainment. You are able to walk or take the water taxi to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. Your luggage is retrieved by the staff when you arive and brought to your room. Valet parking is available, but we decided to self-park for free. The staff was very helpful and friendly. They gave my son and niece stickers and balloons several times during our stay. We had a standard room with a garden view, and we could watch Epcot's fireworks from the patio. The main pool is huge. Even though there were many people at the pool when we visited it, there were still lounge stairs available and plenty of room to swim in the pool. The slide was fun. I was the only in my family to try it. Apparantly, I'm the only thrill seaker. The beds and pillows are super comfy. I really like how there are two sinks outside of the bathroom. This design made it easy for my me and my family to get ready in the mornings. My favorite part of the stay was walking to Epcot and eating at Bistro de Paris. My mother kept the kids while my husband and I had an evening to ourselves. While we were eating, we were able to watch the fireworks. It's expensive, but it was worth the experience for us. Our waitor was great. He walked us through the menu and even taught us a little of the French language.

Reviews.Title: “they could not care less”
Reviews.Author: votewithyourwallet
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel in July. Entry door to the hall near our room made loud creaking noise. kept us up. Made people awaere 3 times. They fixed it the next day.......as we were checking out! All this took was to oil a hinge and they could not get it done at 1:00, or 3:00 or 11:00 PM. They waited until the next morning. When i called the hotel managers office on Monday......the reponse was ......sorry...we will talk to engineering. Engineering? this probably needed a squirt of oil. Not worth the money. Over priced underdelivered!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Boardwalk Inn!”
Reviews.Author: disneyfamilylover16
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Boardwalk Inn for 4 days with my husband and two young daughters. We absolutely loved our stay. The room (standard view) was beautiful and very clean. Service was friendly and prompt. We loved the access to the Boardwalk shops and restaurants, which gave us plenty to do between visiting the theme parks. I could not imagine staying anywhere else. My girls loved that there were 2 separate pools and they often had the "quiet pool" to themselves for hours on end as opposed to the busy water slide pool. Everyone was nice - we had no problems. It was a beautiful stay - we would stay there again next time. I loved that we could take go downstairs and take the ferry boat to Hollywood Studios and Epcot, as an alternative to taking the complimentary bus ride, which was always crowded. Loved, loved, loved the boardwalk. I recommend it. The rooms were roomy and the beds were out of this world luxurious and comfortable. It was luxury and deluxe all the way. One hitch the whole trip: do not order room service - go downstairs and find a restaurant. We had breakfast delivered and the food was inedible...but we enjoyed the food at all the restaurants we ate at (ESPN, Big Grill, Flying Fish, Cape May...all excellent)

Reviews.Title: “not our cup of tea”
Reviews.Author: swimfan75
Reviews.Content: we stayed here last summer and it just wasn't our style we have 3 kids also and had the 2 queen beds and a couch that made a bed not a cheap place either.We wanted to stay on Disney property tho because we wanted the dining plan. Gotta have the dining plan< I highly recommend it! We had breakfast at chef mickey's in the Contempory hotel and it is beautiful, more my style. The Broadwalk is also beautiful just not for us.. I did like the boat ferry to the studios , that was handy. The pool seems a little outdated and needed updates or something. Every night when we came back to the room it was freezing cold, they would turn the air higher and they do want to clean early in the morning. We will stay on Disney property again just not here.

Reviews.Title: “A Must-y Stay”
Reviews.Author: nooilslick
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 nights at this hotel. Our adjoining rooms on the 3rd floor had a musty smell when entering. What a turn off. The airconditioner was turned off but further investigation revealed wet carpet leading up to the rooms at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Boardwalk ALWAYS Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: star_travel_girl
Reviews.Content: We are Disney Vacation Club members and choose to spend our full two week vacation at the Boardwalk. You CANNOT go wrong staying here. It baffles me to read other people's reviews that include criticisms. The BEST part about the Boardwalk Inn is the action right at your fingertips! You have all of the wonderful restaurants on the actual boardwalk (Flying Fish- amazing, Kuzina- great Greek cuisine, and the ESPN club if you want to catch any sports games). If you want excitement "after hours" you can wine and dine at the boardwalk. Not only is the Boardwalk walking distance from Epcot but you can also walk to the Disney Studios. You have the option of using the boat service, which takes a little bit longer, but if you miss a bus just head to one of the other hotels around the water and catch the boat there or take a leisurely stroll to one of the two parks. The atmosphere in the Boardwalk is spot on. They nail the theme in both the lobby (which looks so grand and welcoming) as well as in the rooms. The Valet service is fantastic with enthusiastic workers that greet you every time you return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “recommend the concierge level”
Reviews.Author: east12
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights at the Boardwalk for our daughter's wedding which was being held there. She and I had rooms on the concierge level, known as the Inn Keeper's Club. It was worth in increase in price for us as the convienience of the concierge lounge on our floor allowed us to save time on meals. She had a direct boardwalk view and I had the garden view (yes, we could see the Epcot fireworks from our balcony.) Our schedules were hectic due to wedding related activities along with trying to spend time in the theme parks. It was wonderful to get breakfast at the lounge every morning. In the early evening, cocktails and hot appetizers were very good.. Later in the evening, desserts and cordials were served. Fresh brewed iced tea and lemonade are available during the afternoon. The staff was excellent. My only complaint is that we did not have enough time to spend in the hotel. We managed a few quick trips to the quiet pool which was mostly deserted and very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Disney”
Reviews.Author: UKtraveller50
Reviews.Content: This trip to Disney was our 2nd visit - had been to Boardwalk for a meal last visit and liked the position and the restaurant with its own brewery! Stayed first week of a 2 week break here. Because stayed in Disney first week; just went to desk in airport and were able to get the Disney bus to accommodation for free. We didn't drive for the whole 2 weeks, which is quite unusual. Benefits of staying in Disney - don't have to drive, free buses everywhere, early starts/lates in the parks so you get onto all the rides. Benefits of the Boardwalk - pretty high quality rooms, better choice of food (other than burger and chips), brewery with own beers, can walk to Epcot (5 minutes)/walk to Hollywood Studios (20 mins)/get a boat to both which makes a lovely change, also across lake to Yacht and Beach club, Swan and Dolphin at end of boardwalk to loads of different restaurants to try close by and a really pretty place. We didn't even take towels as there are free ones by the pool. As last time, the first week was magical; its like you are in another world. Would highly recommend the Boardwalk. The late night wandering round the world at Epcot I'd particularly recommend. We managed every Disney park from Sunday to Friday excluding Blizzard Beach. Before you go, plan exactly what you want to do. Get a guide book that tells you when its quieter on different days for each park. Work out which rides you want to go on. Get to the parks early and use FastPass to get on all the rides you want to. Don't bother queueing for ages unless you really love being in a queue - it really isn't necessary. Break up the rush with a water park or by a park in the morning, then back to the hotel for a rest/swim and back to a park for a late night/parade. Hotel rooms have everything in them. Staff were great when we needed them. Only issue was the bakery for picking up breakfast buns/croissants. Daft small shop where you had to get served so took too long. It can work out expensive, but staying in Disney even if just once or for a few days is worth it for the experience. When you stay in Disney, you get your room key and can charge your credit card to it - in effect you only need one card for your whole time staying in Disney - you use the key in the hotel bars, shops and in all restaurants and shops in the parks - even in Downtown Disney restaurants which aren't obviously part of Disney e.g. Rainforest Cafe. If you aren't sure if you want to visit Disney, just go, its fantastic for any age group. You don't need children with you to enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional experience!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: disneyfan74
Reviews.Content: After checking out of Coronado Springs (read that review separately), we drove over to the Boardwalk. What a difference!! Paying more was definitely worth it as the Boardwalk does it right. Just the first impression of driving to the front and having friendly employees greet you and assist with luggage makes the difference. We were able to check in early and were pleasantly surprised to be upgraded for our one night. The room was absolutely beautiful, super clean, and the welcome Mickey made of towels on the bed was a hit. We had a nice view with a balcony overlooking the boardwalk. The room was spacious and well designed with wonderful furniture and artwork. The bathroom was so sparkling clean and bright. Plus, the carpet was so bright and clean too. My wife asked a concierge if they could make some Disney towel animals since the Coronado failed to do so, they were more than happy to assist. We returned from the pool, and lo and behold, there were animals waiting for our daughter. She was thrilled!! The pool area was crowded, however, we expected this as it was a Sunday afternoon. We walked over and ate lunch at nearby Beaches and Cream which is also excellent. The next morning, our housekeeping attendant looked for us, and she had made another special animal for our daughter as she remembered from the day before. Again, this is Disney service at its best. We wish that we could have stayed for more than one night. The Boardwalk is just superb and definitely recommended!! On the other hand, avoid Coronado!!! It's not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Save your Money, we do NOT recommend the Disney Boardwalk Inn”
Reviews.Author: QuincyMA
Reviews.Content: Have always wanted to stay here. Finally had a extra money and decided to splurge in the "Deluxe" style Hotel in Disney. Love the feel of actual boardwalk, love the walking ability from this Hotel to Epcot. Was very disappointed when we opened the door to our $494.00 per night room and found two Queen beds and a couch. Our family consists of 2 adults, 3 kids. Really thought for this price, we would have had a roomier room. The balcony looked out literally to a HUGE tree that hung over our balcony. No view. The Pool is the reason to NOT stay here. The slide is awesome and the kids liked it over and over again, but good luck to anyone attempting to find a lounge chair or anywhere for you to lay down your clothes so your kids can jump in. All the while, people starring at you as you search for even ONE chair. The chairs are really really close together. So if you are lucky enough to find one, you best like your neighbor. We witnessed 5 chairs near pool side with towels and flip flops on them. A random pair of sunglasses. These people did not sit in these chairs until 2:00pm, however the seats were saved since 9:00am. I swear they were at Epcot while they saved their seats. Upon their return, the seats went from the shaddy area to complete sun for their leisure in the afternoon. There is a sign up at the pool to not save chairs, so I know this is a major problem at this hotel. Once I did score a chair on our second day, I watch new people just checking in strolling out to the pool with the same dumb look I had the day before. I actually moved items from one of our chairs and welcomed this family. They were a family of 5 that had to share ONE chair. They were expected to be in the Hotel for the next 6 days, so I explained the drill to them. Get down there early and be selfish like everyone else if you expect to be able to sit and watch your kids so they don't drown in the the pool. Completely uncomfortable. Also found out they provide group rates and if the hotel is not completely full, they do provide discounts for the rooms. That was upsetting knowing we paid so much per night and the couple at the pool was paying $100.00 less pernight. Knowing that they offer discounts while we were staying there was a double whammy. Disney has other locations. Look into those BEFORE booking this one if you have kids.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel. Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: mocha7119
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boardwalk Inn April 14th through the 19th. It was wonderful. The resort is located in a great spot. You are a short bus ride or boat ride away from everything. You can even walk to some places. Like Epcot. The rooms are a nice and clean. The staff was super helpful and very nice. All of them. We ate at the Red river restaurant/brewery that is located on the boardwalk. It was very good food and great beer. There are lots of shops and places to eat right there in front of the hotel. I really have no complaints at all about this hotel. It was great and we will be staying here each year now. Oh I almost forgot! The beds and pillows were amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, fun, great Disney experience”
Reviews.Author: mountains2beach
Reviews.Content: Disney knows how to do it right. The Boardwalk is in a fantastic location, on the water, between Epcot and Hollywood Studios. A gorgeous hotel, Disney thought of every little detail. It is pricey, but worth it. Our room had a view of the fireworks from Epcot every night. There is enough food and fun on the boardwalk to entertain at night. We loved going to Epcot everyday to eat. We went in January so the parks were not as nuts as in the summer. It was unseasonably cold, but in spite of that, we had a great time. The rooms were very clean, mostly quiet, and a decent size. We needed a microwave and the staff got us one right away. The concierge service was excellent as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in the perfect location-Disney's Boardwalk Inn”
Reviews.Author: need2travel2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boardwalk Inn from 3/26-4/1/10 & could not have asked for a better stay. The location cannot be beat, the proximity to Epcot & Hollywood Studios is terrific (5 minute walk to Epcot, 10 to the Studios.) We also cut thru Epcot & took the Monorail to the Grand Floridian for dinner one night-it took a little while but was a lot more fun than the bus. The hotel is very pretty w/ a turn of the century boardwalk feel to it, very airy & light w/ polished wood floors, just picturesque in general. Our room was very nice, roomy, w/ 2 queen beds, armoire, closet, couch, fridge, desk & desk chair & still room to move around. The bathroom had a tub/toilet area seperate from the doublesink area so sharing while getting ready is very easy. Our balcony was spacious & had a great view of a fountain & quiet pool, very quiet & relaxing. Our only downside was that it was a really long walk to our room from the lobby/Bellevue Lounge but we had a short walk to the quiet pool so it all evened out. The Belluevue was a nice place to have a drink before/after dinner, pretty room w/ a large balcony that overlooks the boardwalk & water. The themed pool looked like fun (we used the quiet pool) w/ a great waterslide. I've read reviews of people complaining about the lack of breakfast places but we didn't find that at all, for sitdown b'fast we ate at Kozzina's & for quick service we got from the Bellevue. The hotel is a bit pricey but you do get what you pay for, a beautiful resort, a nice room w/ a balcony & the perfect location for a fun Disney vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kcirtap09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends during New Year's Week. Incredible place to stay, close to Epcot & Hollywood Studios. The party outside on New Year's Eve was great! A+ hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel - Service Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: LoveToVacation67
Reviews.Content: Overall, my family and I had a wonderful stay at the Boardwalk Inn. We were able to stay in a one bedroom villa due to the promo they were running where you buy 4 days and get 3 free. If they ran this promo again, we would consider staying there again (although it was not a perfect stay). I guess the best way to rate this hotel is to discuss what we saw as the pros and cons (see below). If Disney really wants to get this right - they should throw in a few Fast Passes with each standard vacation package (that would ensure I never even consider staying off property, as I am considering now). Moreover, I would absolutely consider buying a Disney Vacation Club (DVC)membership, if that was part of the deal. My friends and family have all said the same thing! Fast passes would ensure countless more DVC sales! We don't want Extra Magic Hours - we want Fast Passes!! Pros: - Walking distance from Epcot. - Villas are big and roomy - with kitchen area where you can cook a meal, if you wish. - Pool has a huge waterslide that my children adored! - Lifeguards were friendly and attentive. - Very clean rooms and property. - Boardwalk has live entertainment each night (street jugglers, etc...). - Many table service options on the boardwalk. - Washer/dryer in room. Cons: - Virtually no counter service available at this property, except a small bakery (i.e., no dinner counter service available). - Poolside bar closed early - no place to get a soda, lemonade, or something a bit more grown-up... - Poolside bar didn't offer any food at all (would be great if they offered chicken nuggets, hot dogs, burgers, grilled chicken sandwich, fries, snacks, etc...) - Concierege staff was the least helpful conceierge staff I have ever experienced at any hotel - Disney or otherwise. Sometimes, they were actually rude. I went to the desk about 4 or 5 times for help - only one person I dealt with seemed to have the "Disney attitude." I finally stopped going there for help because I only left annoyed and frustrated and this was not how I wanted to feel on vacation. - The Disney Magical Express has some bugs to work out of the system. We only rec'd 3 of our 4 boarding passes. Then, we only rec'd 3 of our 4 necessary luggage tags. We were told by staff that we would need to get the other tag at the airport. In other words, we were told that we needed to stand in line at the airport and check-in, just like everyone else. This is our third time using the Disney Magical Express - this is the first time it has been this much of a nightmare. We wasted our last day at the hotel going from counter-to-counter trying to get the issue fixed (it was never fixed - we ended up having to check our bags at the airport even though we were promised the Disney Magical Express Service as part of our hotel package when we booked the vacation.) The hotel manager overheard and did end up sending us to the airport in a cab va. the bus, but it was really too little too late, at that point. Being comp'ed a $40 cab ride did not make up for missing the last day of our vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: sheerah69
Reviews.Content: Disney Boardwalk Inn was a fantastic hotel. Spend the extra money to stay there. The transfers to and from the airport are well worth it. The shuttles from the hotels to the parks....absolutely worth it. We had a fantastic room. It was on the 2nd floor (only two floors to this part of the hotel) and it had lots of room. Two balconies, one over looking the garden and the other over the quiet pool, which my son loved as he was the only one ever in it. This was an extremely quiet part of the hotel. The location of the Boardwalk to the theme parks is #1 in my books. We were a five minute walk to Epcot, less than 10 minute boat ride to Hollywood Studios, and no more than a 25 minute bus ride to the other parks and Downtown Disney. When you stay at the Boardwalk you also have access to the pools over at the Beach and Yacht Clubs. They have sand bottom pools and a lazy man river. Very nice!!! Our theme pool at the Boardwalk was closed for reno's while we were there. We were here from February 4-11, and I highly recommend this time. The temperatures were cooler, (anywhere's from 58-78), but we still got a sunburn. But the crowds were very tolerable. No line ups for rides, with the exception of a few of the thrill seeker ones, which were only a 20 minute wait. But we went back on the extra magic hours and walked right on. I would give up the weather anyday to be able to enjoy these parks with the less crowds as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Business Hotel--But Mostly Ok”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1Denver_Co
Reviews.Content: Let me say first that holding a convention at Disney World is a bad idea. The area is akin to a company town so everything you do is Disney. Now to the hotel.
