Wonderfully managed, clean, although dated continues to maintain its' character. The weather was awful, cold, damp, and windy so there was little to do in the area. The hotel is convenient to Epcot only and the boardwalk area is essentially hotels and hideously overpriced horrible restaurants. The boardwalk area (at least in the winter) is pretty dull and the taxi rides are $15 minimum to anywhere close. I really don't have any criticisms of the hotel itself. I was forced to use the business center in the hotel and expecting little received less. The staff in the business center is rude to say the least. Frankly I am shocked that the hotel puts up with the Ikon franchise business center. To give you an idea of just one problem with them I was set to receive an early morning FedEx package sent by my office. Hearing nothing by noon I contacted my office. I was told that the Ikon business center at the hotel signed for the package at 9:30am. I contacted the business center with no success. Finally, at nearly 5pm after numerous calls I walked to the business center. The package was there in plain sight. The employee said oops and then wanted to charge me a handling fee. I complained to the day manager at the hotel who was professional and pleasant but that is the last I heard. One other note. If you want a taxi at the hotel you are on your own. Don't expect the bell staff to move to help you find one. After a day or so I just walked out to the taxi row and hailed one on my own. I guess if you are a family and want to focus on Epcot it is a nice location. If you are on business or attending a convention I suggest a hotel off the Disney property (only a few miles in any direction). I think that the hotel is used to dealing only with familes on vacation and not the business travelor. One important note, the main pool was closed for renovation and no one told us about it (not that you could use it anyhow do to the weather). It should be on their website or told to you at the time you make your reservation. They send you a half mile to another hotel pool instead and with little kids it would be a disaster.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: commscholar
Reviews.Content: I was really disappointed with the hotel. I got a significant discount on the rate because I was there for a conference. For what I paid, I was sure the hotel would exceed my expectations. It was well below them. First, no one at the front desk explained the amenities or privileges of staying Disney. Apparently we get free parking at all parks, but no one told me that (even when I asked). No one said anything about the extra magic hours either, even when I asked they said they didn't know. And there was no literature in the room explaining this stuff either. There are lots of little perks, but nothing tells you what they are. The room was very basic. There was a giant hole in the marble on my nightstand. The blanket was old and tattered. There was a brochure in the room about how you can buy the things in the room (like your bedspread, lamp, or disney themed bathroom items), but none of those nice things were actually in my room. Then at the end, they couldn't straighten out my bill. I wanted a bill that showed what I was charged at the hotel, and that I paid that (showing payment or a zero balance) so that I could be reimbursed from work. I just wanted a basic, regular statement, like I get from hundreds of hotels around the world. He told me the bill is really for them, not designed to be clear for the customer. I was disappointed at my lower price, I would have been downright angry if I paid full price. I stopped by the animal kingdom lodge. That place was beautiful and the staff was very helpful there (I learned about the Disney perks from them, that the staff at the Boardwalk didn't know about). I really love Disney

Reviews.Title: “1st class stay”
Reviews.Author: hergeEurope
Reviews.Content: Bo issues with this hotel - really enjoyable stay in lovely room.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: rubygirl68
Reviews.Content: My Husband, 11 year-old son and I just returned from a New Year's 2010 visit to the Boardwalk. What you are paying for here is the LOCATION. As my 11 year-old son even noted, the rooms need some routine maintenance. The sinks were cracked, there was light mold on the shower tiles and major condensation on the patio french doors. This is Disney Deluxe hotel not "real world" Deluxe. The wonderful location allowed me to sleep in one day and then casually walk over to the International Gateway at Epcot and meet up with my husband and son who left early to ride Test Track. Go with the expectation that you are paying for the 5 minute private entrance to Epcot and the 1 mile walk or boat ride to Hollywood studios and you will be very happy. Also, I was able to get a good rate on Expedia. Next time, I would like to stay in one of the Magic Kingdom resorts but this was an awesome place to stay in the Kingdom. Just a note for families with small kids: there is no food court at the Boardwalk and this could be inconvenient. But all rooms have refrigerators (no charge for deluxe resorts) and most people brought food with them for breakfast and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, but not quite perfect”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinRoadtrip
Reviews.Content: We spent the extra money for the Boardwalk for convenience and comfort. One of the things we love to do is sit on the balcony before we go to bed to visit, and start the day on the balcony with coffee. Our view was pleasant and quiet, but our balcony only had one chair. It took 4 days to get our chair, and it arrived in time for our last night. No morning coffee, we had to leave early. Tip: insist that staff do a written workorder to housekeeping. We asked every day, but only when a workorder was done did we get the chair. The rest of the hotel was great. Beautifully decorated, and relatively quiet. The Belle Vue Lounge is a "hidden gem". The gal at the check-in seemed indifferent, short responses to our questions, and was hard to understand, but everyone else was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing week at Walt Disney World”
Reviews.Author: billnjax
Reviews.Content: We wanted to spend a week relaxing before the hectic end of December. As our favorite park is EPCOT, we like the fact that it is an easy walk to the park from any of the resort hotels at this location. We have stayed at the Swan and at the Dolphin before, but the Boardwalk Inn was more expensive. This trip, we decided to stay there anyway and could not be more glad that we did. Starting with the Disney attention to period details, the Lobby and other public areas were worth spending time to examine. As it was Christmas time, the Ginger Bread House was a fantastic display. The room was large and comfortable. If I were to make one observation about the room, it would be that it is impossible to view the TV from the sofa. That is about the only thing that I found strange. The service by housekeeping was as good as any I've had anywhere. We had a room with the basic view, but that was not a problem. We could see the top of the Tower of Terror and some of the lights from the Studios. The beds were comfortable, the service was excellent, the location is fantastic if you spend a lot of time at EPCOT. All in all, it was a great week and we will stay there again. There is not an actual Restaurant in the hotel it's self, but the the Board Walk has several, all were excellent. The only thing I wish that Disney would do is provide Wi-Fi somewhere in their resorts. I do plan to bring that up with them in an e-mail soon.

Reviews.Title: “Another Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: callover325
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Christmas at the Boardwalk. This hotel never disappoints! We stay in the Villas as we are vacation club members, but if it is available to non-DVC members, it is definitely worth the extra money. There are so many restaurants and clubs to enjoy, as well as a wonderful pool area. We always come home with clean clothes, as there is a washer/dryer in the room. The proximity to many excellent restaurants on the Boardwalk, as well as the ones at the Swan & dolphin hotels is great, but if you don't want to dine out, the hotel is equipped with a full kitchen-ideal for eating in. Many of the rooms are newly refurbished-clean and comfortable. The only (slight) negative is the walk from the elevators after a long day in the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Back to Childhood in Disney's Boardwalk Inn”
Reviews.Author: TheTraveler777
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Point Resort from 2 October 2009 to 6 October 2009. We came to Orlando by plate from New York. The purpose of coming to Orlando was to visit in Disney World. It was my graduations present to me self. The morning we arrive to the hotel I was amazed by the beautiful resort. The Front desk staff welcomed as with a big smile and was very helpful. They recommended as which Disney parks to visit and which restaurants to visit for a dinner. The room was amazing, king size bed and many other facilities. The location was very convenient for visiting Disney's parks and the price was right. It was the best place to stay!!! The hotel is beautifully designed inside doors and outside. He is nearby most Disney parks, close to many attractions, shopping centers and restaurants. I truly recommend visiting this hotel for your next visit in Disney world. I will come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven.”
Reviews.Author: SPBeans
Reviews.Content: I must confess to this being an entirely non-impartial review. The night we stayed here, my partner proposed so my feet didn't touch the ground once. I thought it was perfect. The room we had was absolutely massive, the bathroom was gorgeous, it was clean and bright, everyone loves a Minnie Mouse lamp. Also, don't worry about paying more for a boardwalk view, the gardens are very pretty and we ended up opposite the little swimming pool. You also get a little patio to sit out on and enjoy the balmy Florida nights. The service on check-in was disappointing, I was expecting the Disney works but never mind, a small gripe - it was perfect on check out. Also, if you arrive by boat finding the entrance can be a little baffling, so maybe a sign post might be in order. We got breakfast from the bakery which was Disney priced but what can you expect. The Boardwalk itself a night is a brilliant place to be, lots to watch, pizza is cheap and tasty. Also you can walk round to the beach at the hotel opposite and watch the Epcot fireworks from there which is a lovely way to pass twenty minutes. We had some drinks in the bar - the service was lovely, measures were generous and a bit of free trail mix never goes wrong. Another thing I like about this hotel is it feels slightly more grown up than other Disney properties. The theming is undeniably there but the general ambience is less in-your-face. The rooms are more elegant and it is a pleasant escape from the whole Disney-thing. I loved it, I've been back a month and still wish I was there!

Reviews.Title: “Fine, Convenient, First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GVTrai58
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Boardwalk Inn and left very impressed. We had a courtyard view with a nice balcony. We had a great view of the fireworks at Epcot every night at 9:30. The room is beautiful and tastefully decorated. Epcot is a boat ride away. They say it is a five minute walk but we caught the boat the day we went. And the boat lets you in at what seems like a private entrance and that was nice. Hollywood is a boat ride away also. You have to take buses to Majic Kindom and Animal Kingdom. We ate at Flying Fish and Kouzzina. Both restaurants were OK food wise, but I like some of Disney's other signature dining restaurants much better. The service at all the signature dining restaurants is wonderful. All in all my wife and I loved the Boardwalk. The kids loved it also. Every night there were street performers on the Boardwalk and my kids were always entertained. The kids swam once in the pool and it was nice. We have stayed at Wilderness Lodge, Contemporary, and Animal Kingdom and now the Boardwalk. And I have to say we loved them all. They are all impressive in their own way. If I had to say anything negative at all is Disney gives you very little selection of TV channels. The TV went from 2 - 60 and a bunch of those channels were Disney infomercial type channels. And NO Fox News Channel, so you are stuck with only far left news.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of rooms above the bar”
Reviews.Author: PeterStPaul
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boardwalk with our family including small children. Overall, this is a very nice property. However, our rooms were just above the only bar in the hotel that is open until midnight and has an outdoor patio. Very noisy when you are trying to put small children to bed early and we were not there in warm weather when I am sure it is worse. I called this to the attention of the front desk manager who was sympathetic, said he would talk to the bar manager, but basically if guests want to have a drink on the patio outside the bar until midnight, those with rooms close by are going to be impacted. I advise avoiding rooms in this part of the hotel if you have the option.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, room, place - all in all almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: intrepidtravellers44
Reviews.Content: Boardwalk Inn is situated in the middle of the Disney experience: it sits between and is in walking distance of both Epcot and Disney Studios. It is built in the style of late Victorian / early Edwardian and it convincingly carries this illusion off. We stayed in a one bedroomed appartment overlooking the Boardwalk itself. These rooms are definitely to be recommended as you have views of the Epcot fireworks and all the associated action on the Boardwalk. The quality of the rooms is universally excellent; flat screens and DVD players are standard, the one bed had a whirlpool bath, the balcony's are of an excellent size and the soft furnishings are just great. Boardwalk itself has much to recommend it: try the Big River Grille for a great take on pub food with interesting beers and the ESPN sports bar for the in your face burger and sports experience/ live TV show. The evening entertainments are not be missed: in particular the street magic is very good. The hotel bar is relaxed and informal and serves the usual range of Disney cocktails. Try Shulas for some upmarket steak and Il Mulinos for fantastic Italian food. All in all we loved this place and will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Boardwalk Inn!”
Reviews.Author: cajundiver
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here Oct. 21-25. The hotel is beautiful and being on the Boardwalk is a lot of fun. The main reason we stayed here was to be close to the Food and Wine Festival and it was so easy to just walk over. The stay didn't start off very magical because the cast member that checked us in was very sick and could hardly speak for coughing all over us. The manager really should have had this person in the back or just sent her home!! I had to stand 3 steps back the entire time for fear of getting sick! After that all was well. The room was very clean and spacious (compared to Animal Kingdom). We were located next to the quiet pool and there was a shortcut from our room to the boardwalk so there wasn't a lot of walking to get to the room. One side note, I did have a pair of earrings go missing that I know were left on the dresser. Of course, I can't be sure what exactly happened, just be sure to store valuables in the safe to avoid any problems. It was my own fault. All cast members were very friendly and always had a smile. The room seemed to have been renovated recently and was very clean and new. Overall, I enjoyed our stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our absolute favourite resort”
Reviews.Author: mindy6540
Reviews.Content: This is our favourite resort. You can't beat the location! Couples travelling will love the location and the resort amenities.

Reviews.Title: “October at Disney”
Reviews.Author: traveljacq
Reviews.Content: Like all Disney properties, The Boardwalk Inn is over the top. The decor is like the olden boardwalks of Northeast. It is beautiful and walking through was a pleasure. We are a family of Dad, Mom, Brother, Sister & Grandmother. We booked a room with two double beds and had a great surprise that the couch converted into a perfect bed for a 4 year old. The staff were friendly and helpful. We used Disney transportation (bus & boat) to the parks. They were fast & fun. We walked 4 minutes to Epcot. A great and convenient place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Boardwalk inn Disney special treatment!!!!”
Reviews.Author: morganlnn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boardwalk Inn from June 15 to June22 this year and had a very wonderful time. We stayed club level the food was great!!!! The staff is the best both in the lounge and at thedesk as you enter the club level. The room was beautiful and the view was what I had hoped for right on the boardwalk facing the Yacht Club. We decided to stay at the Boardwalk Inn instead of moving to another hotel for the last three days and we were upgraded to a Garden Suite. Always wanted to stay in a Garden Suite. The upgrade was at the same price as the room were in. We were treated royally our whole stay!!!!! After 31 trips to Disney this one was the best!!! We are going back in November.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Redpare
Reviews.Content: Went here for an assocations annual convention. It was very nice! Rooms were superb (we had a little cottage), hotel was magnificent. Some rooms overlook the boardwalk and the lake while others overlook the courtyard. It was quiet, very charming and a very pleasant stay. It is nearby tons of restaurants and very close (walking distance) to EPCOT.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sam1am
Reviews.Content: A short walk away from Epcot's International Gateway, location is one of the Boardwalk Inn's greatest features. You can also walk to Disney's Hollywood Studios (or take a boat to either park). Nightlife on the boardwalk is fun, with a bunch of dining options, and Jellyrolls Dueling Piano Bar for the adults (a blast). We stayed in a cottage suite, which was a bit pricey, but very spacious. The hot tub with shutters into the bedroom was great! The suite also came with access to the 'Innkeeper's Lounge' which had food and drink available for breakfast, snacks, and evening desserts. You could have a full breakfast and construct a dinner here most nights, which helps offset the cost of the room. It's a short walk to the lounge from the cottage suites, but it was only a couple minutes away (including up the elevator). Would stay here again if we wanted to splurge - it was great for Jellyroll's and quick access to Epcot (we were visiting the food and wine festival), but the staff at all Disney resorts (including the value ones) are great, and we'd likely stay in value resorts like Pop Century on trips as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Trip To Disney and The Boardwalk Inn”
Reviews.Author: HeldonPittsburghPA
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Disney World and the Boardwalk Inn was wonderful. Thanks to Lynda Hower of Dream Makers Vacation Services. She went above and beyond in planning our vacation and made it an awesome experience. The Disney's Boardwalk Inn was beautiful. The staff was incredible. They catered to all of our needs from the moment we walked in the lobby to the moment we got on the Disney transport to take us back to the airport. The room was very nice although we did have some small issues (ie. musty odor in the room so they switched us to another room-they were very accomidating). I would recommend the Disney's Boardwalk Inn to anyone visiting Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: JWMCGIRR
Reviews.Content: I just didnt feel special during my stay there. This was our first stay at an "official" Disney hotel having only stayed at Shades of Green in the past. Everything I had read before-hand had led me to believe that I was going to have a "magical" experience at the Boardwalk. Unfortunately, I didnt. The hotel IS beautiful and the staff ARE friendly and outgoing but not really magical. Maybe I expected too much, but the overall experience was just okay for me. On a more practical and informative note, breakfast on the boardwalk kind of sucked. Room service was way to pricey. The Boardwalk Bakery was okay for coffee and pastries but the line was rediculous. Getting around to the parks, besides walking to Epcot, was easy by bus but a drag because the Boardwalk was the last stop on a weird circuit that included 3 other resorts with the bus making a stop at the other 3 resorts in both directions so at peak times the bus would arrive almost full from the other resorts and then go by them again on its way to the destination. Strange, time consuming and annoying. All in all, while I rate the hotel highly for staff and accomodations, I would probably not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disney quality is slipping”
Reviews.Author: ADMA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 8 years ago and found the hotel to be perfect. This time, I traveled for business and was really disappointed in a number of ways. The superlative disney quality is missing its perfection. There was an opened partially eaten box of chocolates left on top of my dresser. My internet connection didn't work. It took three phone calls and 6 hours to get another internet cable. The housekeeping supervisor never called me back. I never got shampoo in my room, and the mouthwash wasn't replaced. The voice message system doesn't work if you have fewer than 4 letters in your name. The wait times for an operator were too log for a hotel of this price range. I saw staff members bickering and being berated publicly by a supervisor--this is not the magical spirit!! The decor is amazing, and the locale is nice, and the gym was very well appointed, but for the money Disney charges for a room here, I expect better service.

Reviews.Title: “Boardwalk Inn - Wonderful Location & Great Fun”
Reviews.Author: ncsunshine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had stayed a few years ago at the Swan for a few nights and love the Boardwalk area so decided to splurge on a Deluxe Location and be near Epcot (favorite park) and ESPN Club (favorite bar) on this trip 8/19 - 8/26! It was an "adult style" Disney vacation as we don't have kids and we are the kids! Flew Southwest direct from Raleigh, NC and arrived at 9:00 a.m. to hook up w/ the Magical Express transport. Let them take our luggage directly from hotel which is GREAT - after the much organized bus transport and a few stops at other resorts we arrived at 10:15 a.m. at the Boardwalk Inn. Checked in, given "keys to the world" with Deluxe Dining" and we were off to do what we wanted to do. Room was ready at 3 p.m. on the dot and they called cell phone while we were at Epcot w/Room # and we could go straight to the room and luggage was already there. GREAT SERVICE! Can't beat the location to Epcot and great restaurants. Yes, the quick service meals for families is a problem, but since we had dining reservation for lunch and dinner all over Disney Parks & Resorts we would just grab continental breakfast at the BellVu Lounge using refillable mugs for juice & coffee and roll out! Fine for us, but could see where it may be an issue for some. Room was on the 1st floor as we requested, but strangely enough you had to go from the Boardwalk level, up stairs to get on an elevator to go back downstairs again - very odd and a little bit of a pain, but we liked having a garden courtyard view and patio with 2 chairs & table for morning coffee so willing to put up with that inconvenience. Service, staff was great and we had no issues throughout our stay! We would go back in a minute and hated to leave even after a week! Disney sure has all of the details down to a science - LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: PghParrothead
Reviews.Content: Our original plan included a stay at the Caribean Beach Hotel. However, after reading some Trip Advisor reviews we decided to upgrade to a deluxe resort instead. Our goal was to stay at a nice Disney hotel that was conveniently located to the parks. We did not rent a car for our trip and used Disney transportation, including the magical express to and from the airport. The location is great for easy travels to the parks-- a bus gets you to the Magic Kingdom or Animal Kingdom pretty quickly while a nice boat ride takes you to either Hollywood Studios or Epcot. The hotel itself was lovely. Check in was a breeze. The room decor was nice--although the room was a little on the small side. We did like having a small refrigerator for drinks and snacks. Our room had a balcony which was a joke--it is really only big enough for one person at a time and even that feels cramped with the chair on the deck. I don't know if I would call the resort deluxe--but it was nice. One downfall of this hotel is the lack of a restaurant at the hotel. The boardwalk is located outside and there are a few locations there to eat but we had difficult finding a good quick service location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: FallbrookTraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked three rooms for one week for a special family vacation. The hotel has a very comfortable, quiet atmosphere and is less "high energy" than other Disney resorts. You feel like you are in a stately mansion with fine furnishings, hardwood floors and top-notch attention. Two of the rooms we booked were the Garden Cottages and one room was on the fourth floor facing the garden. All were club level rooms. One of the nicest parts of splurging for the club level is that check in is a breeze at the club's fourth floor office while the family is treated to the snacks in the lounge. We were even greeted by name when we drove in and a wonderful gentleman was waiting to take us all up the lounge for check-in. Garden cottages are two levels with a loft containing a king sized bed and bathroom with large jacuzzi tub and separate shower. Beds were very comfortable. A small kitchenette was included with sink, refrigerator and microwave on the lower floor. One cottage housed one couple and two children. The sectional couch in the downstairs living room folded out into a large bed. The downstairs area also included a half bath. There was plenty of room for the children (aged 5 and 10) and privacy for the parents. The other cottage housed us (grandparents). Though very nice and near the grandchildren, I probably would forego the larger two story unit and get a regular room on the fourth floor as they are very nicely outfitted and closer to the club lounge (and I could avoid the up-down of the stairs in the cottage). The cottages are not separate buildings but rather the first and second level of a 4 story building. The cottages also look out onto the "Quiet pool" which was not used very much except for perhaps half a dozen people at the most. The club lounge was a nice place to gather and served a continental breakfast in the morning, snacks and sodas during the day, hot and cold selections, wine, beer in evening and deserts and cordials in the later evening. The staff was very helpful in making reservations. We also had the basic Disney dining plan which we found easy to use but also too easy to let accumulate until the end of the trip when we madly tried to cash in snacks and quick service meals. You need to pay attention or else you will have too many meals left over which is a waste of money. The Boardwalk is very convenient to Epcot and Disney Studios and there are lots of activities on the boardwalk. We enjoyed Jelly Rolls which is located to the lefty of the hotel and has talented guys singing and playing dueling pianos. Depending on the crowd's wishes the music could be modern, folk or country or a combination of everything. The main pool was a bit of a walk from the cottages and includes a water slide, which the children loved, however this pool is not as large as some of the other Disney resort pools so if you are looking for a resort with a pool with a "wow" effect this one isn't it. We would definitely return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “At home in Bordwalk Inn !”
Reviews.Author: Sandrin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the inn keepers club during the end of July and as the first time, it was a magical moment! From our arrival to our departure everything was perfect; the atmosphere of this resort is so serene and joyful that you feel at home. The resort itself is never crowded; the newly refurbished rooms are superb and sunny. We chose a deluxe room because we were a party of five and we had the surprise to see how huge and comfortable it was. Our balcony faced the lake and the boardwalk promenade. We spent many times watching the beautiful view and especially at night with all the illuminations. The innkeeper Club is far the best lounge of all the Disney hotels we have done. All the Cast members are so nice, they pay attention to every detail, they make your vacation a Disney Dream: Thank you Pete, Scott, Lorenzo, Anita, Morgan and all the others for your attention, for your so good advices that ease vacation and make them unforgettable. The main pool is my 9 years old boy favourite, we always have found seats and the slide is great. Nevertheless if you want a peaceful moment to rest before returning to the parks on the evening, I recommend the quiet pool where you will have the feeling one more time to be at home. If Epcot and Hollywood Studios are your favourite parks so consider Disney’s boardwalk inn: you won’t be disappointed and this resort is the one for a perfect family reunion

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Disney”
Reviews.Author: RacheD54
Reviews.Content: We recently came back from Disney after a week-long trip. We booked the Boardwalk, taking advantage of the promotion of but 4 nights, get 3 free. We stayed at the Boardwalk due to the proximity to Epcot and the Hollywood Studios (We would walk to Epcot and back, sometimes taking the boat at night, and we used the boat to go to Hollywood Studios). Another plus was using the Boardwalk Bakery for the complimentary morning tea (after buying the resort mug) and breakfast (even if the bacon, egg, and cheese was almost $6). The Boardwalk itself was great even just to grab pizza or a snack midday as well. The cast members at the check-in (thank you Andy!) were wonderful and welcoming as we arrived to check in. When we had a problem while dining at Norway, we had asked a cast member at the Boardwalk to give us some help in resolving our problem. Joshua at concierge and the management staff we spoke were wonderful in trying to help us, all of them living up to the Disney standard of going above and beyond for guest service. We had no complaints staying at the Baordwalk and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Happiest Place on Earth!”
Reviews.Author: CatiLyn
Reviews.Content: The Boardwalk Inn is absolutely gorgeous...and huge! I went with my husband, my parents, and my brother and his family ( wife and children ages 6 and 3). We stayed for 8 days. 7 nights. The main pool was lots of fun for the kids, and my husband and I enjoyed the quiet pool almost every afternoon. We had a corner room - 1290 - and it was HUGE! I usually try to stay away from hotel rooms on the first floor, but this was perfect because we were able to walk out our patio doors and walk right over to the quiet pool. You absolutely cannot beat the location of the resort...the walk to the Worlds in EPCOT is a leisurely 5 minute stroll, and the walk to the Hollywood Studios is very short with beautiful scenery! We took the boats to HS most of the time, which were fine, but kind of slow. The buses were frustrating, only because they stopped at the Dolphin, Swan, and Beach/Yacht Clubs before heading to MK, AK, or Downtown Disney. My husband and I spend most of our time at EPCOT/Hollywood Studios because, with no children, taking the buses to the other parks wasn't really worth the hassle, and after 1/2 day at MK and AK each, we'd seen all we needed to. One small, very minor complaint...the bottles they give you with conditioner make it very difficult to get the conditioner out...so if you use a lot of conditioner (like I do), I would recommend bringing your own or asking for extra as soon as you get there. Mousekeeping was good, no real problems with cleanliness. The cast members were WONDERFUL to us...check-in was a breeze, and every time we had a request, it was handled quickly and with a smile. At the resort, we ate at the Bakery, the Brewery, the take-out pizza window at Spoodles, ESPN Club, and Boardwalk Joe's...all very good! Loved the Bakery for breakfast/lunches. All in all, a wonderful vacation made even better by staying at this beautiful, convenient resort!

Reviews.Title: “VERY HAPPY GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: tripper060
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week long stay at the boardwalk inn,, we had garden suite room near the quiet pool...room 1215. .I was abit nervous after reading some reviews about non working air conditioners,bad service,out of date rooms.... I am happy to report that I was nervous for nothing!! :) The room we had was recently updated.( looked brand new)The bedding was wonderful(3 choices of different firmness of pillows on the king bed upstairs loft)the downstairs (AKA livingroom)had a sectional that pulled out to a queen size bed.One of my teenage daughters slept on the bed,one on the side of the sectional.( 3 people could sleep on it) . we had our own white picket fence with a gate .The service was FANTASTIC! We had the" innkeepers club" which we used for breakfast and snacks throughout the day/night .Sodas,coffe,water,cookies,gummy bears,fruit,pb and j ,... evening had liquor, shrimp,steak ,potatoes..... cereal in the morning w/ fruits, juices ,bagels,croissiants,..... the staff was wonderful! You can even ask for Evian botteled water to bring back to your room ( 8,00 a bottle)which you will need for summer time. The quiet pool is open 24/7 ,We never did use the 'Clown" pool... we didnt want all the noise that the front pool had.For transportation--- boat to Hollywood studios and epcot.You can walk there also from the hotel.15 min walk to epcot,25 min walk to hollywood. Other than that we used the bus.Yes ,the busses can be crowded at times,BUT there isnt much of a wait if you want to wait and catch the next bus.We ENJOYED our stay and cant say enough!!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful resort -stay off the buses”
Reviews.Author: MidwestMomof2
Reviews.Content: The resort itself is lovely. The location on the boardwalk added many activities for the evening that were close to home. Boardwalk Bakery is a must for families using the DDP. Transportation to and from Epcot (walk, ferry) and Hollywood Studios (ferry, walk) was by far the best anywhere. Bus transportation, however , was horrible! Given the price of the Boardwalk, one might think that getting those visitors to and from the themeparks where more money can be spent would be a Disney priority, but travel to Animal Kingdom and Magic Kingdom was downright maddening. As mentioned by another reviewer, waits for busses are sometimes in excess of one hour, the busses are packed to dangerous capacity AND the BWI, BC, Swan, Dolphin and YC all share one bus line. Again, totally ridiculous given the room price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and clean”
Reviews.Author: pbjwb
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our trip to Disney and loved the Boardwalk. The beds were the most comfortable of any hotel I have stayed in anywhere (disney or not). The rooms were very clean and staff made sure it stayed that way the entire week. Plenty of towels. Our room faced the courtyard so we did not get a view of fireworks in the evening (But isn't that why you go to the parks??) The desk staff were also very helpful especially when I ran out of prescription eye drops for my son. They put me in contact with the local drug store and by evening we had the new drops. As other reviewers have stated, very close to Epcot. You are at World Showcase within 5 minutes. And a 20 minute walk to Hollywood Studios. There is also a boat to Hollywood Studios and if we would miss the boat from the hotel we would walk to Swan and Dolphin and pick it up from there. We also used that trick when we would return from the Studios. We would get off at S and D and walk back. It saved about 10-15 min because the boat would head to Yacht and Beach club and then Boardwalk. Of course it rained everyday and if you would come back to the hotel during the storm there would be a cute old fashioned suitcase at the doorway with towels rolled up for you to dry off. It's the little things....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: Zanika2005
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Disney's Boardwalk Inn for two nights in June. We first started our trip at an All Star resort, and decided to splurge the last two nights at the Boardwalk. Let me tell you, it was worth every penny! We knew it was going to be a step up from the All Stars, but we didn't realize it was going to be a giant leap. Our room was fantastic! The room was spacious, with plenty of amenities. We had a large balcony overlooking the boardwalk. The beds were incredibly comfortable. I felt like I just sunk into them and never wanted to get out. We could watch both the Epcot and the Magic Kingdom fireworks shows from our balcony! We ordered breakfast room service one morning and were satisfied with the food and service. The actual boardwalk portion connected to the hotel is also a lot of fun. There were street performers doing magic shows, plenty of shopping, an art gallery, and my personal favorite, Jellyrolls dueling piano bar! There are boat systems that will take resort guests to Hollywood Studios and Epcot every 15 minutes, while the other parks guests ride the bus transportation. I liked how The Boardwalk and The Yaht & Beach Club were right next to each other. We went and swam over at the Beach Club pool one afternoon. I really recommend staying at this hotel. I know it's pricey, but I found it completely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Bad Parking”
Reviews.Author: Tbro1971
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week, June 11th thru June 18th. Our room was on the lobby level, close to the Belle Vue Room Lounge which made coffee and soda refills convenient. The hotel is beautiful and well run with the exception of the parking situation. Now I know that the hotel has valet service and that may be fine for some, however, I believe that when you pay the high price for a deluxe room, you should be guaranteed a parking space. We would come home from The Magic Kingdom to find the parking lots full with Boardwalk visitors not staying at the hotel. After approximately a 30 minute parking lot trolling session, I relented and dropped off the family at the front doors and resumed searching for a space. Eventually, I found one by the guard house check in which resulted in a long, weary, angry walk back to the room. If the hotel has 400 rooms, then there should be 400 room key spaces reserved for paying guests. The pool is wonderful but there are "Squatters" galore. Since Disney doesn't check resort I.D. at the pool, there are a lot of swimmers who aren't staying at the hotel. Makes me wonder why we paid so much for things others got for free. Overall, the hotel itself is great but they need to tweak some things to make it right.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: ellenolenska
Reviews.Content: My family of four had a wonderful week-long stay at the Boardwalk Inn. We stayed at the Polynesian previously, but we wanted the Epcot area this time. The location is incredible--a pleasant walk to Epcot or a short boat ride. We also walked to the Disney Studios. The bus to the Animal Kingdom does take a long time. The early 20th century theme is charming, and the grounds are beautiful. The hotel reminds me of the Grand Floridian on a smaller, less formal scale. We were fortunate enough to have a deluxe club level room that overlooked the Boardwalk. The kids loved to sit on the balcony and watch the street performers below. The newly refurbished room was huge, with two armoires with flat-screen TVs, two comfortable queen beds, and a double sofa sleeper. The bathroom is small, but the sinks are conveniently located outside the toilet/shower room--easier for a family getting ready in the morning. The club level offered a good continental breakfast and snacks like popcorn and goldfish crackers throughout the day. There were different offerings--chili, dips, chicken and beef skewers, a pasta dish--each evening, along with wine and beer. They also had PB & J for the kids. Desserts, including wonderful cookies, were offered after 8 p.m. We came home one evening to find a basket of cookies and a carafe of milk in our mini-fridge! I loved being able to take bottles of Evian and cans of pop back to the room. The outstanding customer service is what makes the hotel. All cast members we encountered were friendly and helpful, but the club level folks went above and beyond. Pete truly saved our trip. Our young daughter became ill with strep throat (coming down with a high fever and cough at the height of the swine flu scare), and concierge arranged for free transportation to urgent care. Pete even replaced--as a surprise--a stuffed animal from AK that she left on the van. She needed to remain in the room for several days, and room service and housekeeping were very helpful. Room service even brought coloring pages and crayons up with her meal. Pete helped us cancel restaurant reservations, reschedule others for one parent and my son, and offered stickers and "tattoos" to cheer my daughter up. When my she was better, Pete re-booked her much-anticipated Princess Lunch at the restaurant in Norway (a tough reservation to obtain.) Despite my extensive planning beforehand, we would have been adrift without these wonderful people's help. This is the kind of customer service you need when something goes wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Disney does Grownup”
Reviews.Author: DownunderSugarglider
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Boardwalk for 5 nights as part of a holiday and whilst attending a course at the Disney Institute in the Boardwalk Conference Facility. So the room was great! It was very quiet and down a side corridor so there are no hoards of people walking past the door to the lift or the foyer. I was told by Disney staff that the Boardwalk is considered among the higher end of the Deluxe (so Wilderness and AK are lower end delux) and that meant sheets and towels with higher thread count and duvet's instead of bedspreads. Also more pillows on the bed than one can possibly use. The room was really clean - the only thing was lots of hair left in the bathroom - on the floor, in tub, in sinks on vanity top - strange but not enough to be be completely problematic. Plasma screen TV, small balcony overlooking the Garden Units gardens, small fridge but no mini bar, desk and chair, couch, drawer unit. The safe was not big enough to hold a laptop. The toiletries were a bit below average - only shampoo, shower gel, conditioner, lotion and soap. Not even a shower cap! No milk supplied for tea or coffee - had to buy that in the general store. I didn't really interact with any of the staff. so I can't really comment. I didn't use the pool - but it seemed a bit open to the general public for my liking. If you like looking for Mickeys there are heaps of them - carved into the furniture, the fittings, the carpets, the shower curtain, even the paintings on the wall. But it is all done very elegantly and the whole place is quite plush and adult. Possibly driven by the conference centre but there are fewer families staying here than say WL or AKL the location of this place is great - walking distance to Epcot and HS and lots of other resorts. The Boardwalk is interesting for it's shops and restaurants. the one bugbear I had was with the buses. Every bus I got on would be diverted through Swan, Dolphin, Yacht and Beach resorts before going where I wanted. and the same coming back. Buses would drive PAST the Boardwalk and go Swan, Dolphin, Yacht and Beach before returning to the Boardwalk - I never got a break and it added 20 mins to every journey. In the end I did the 5 min walk to Beach and started catching buses from there and getting off at Swan and walking the 5 mins back. The conference centre was very nice - large, spacious rooms, well appointed, comfortable. the food served was very good quality. Again - Disney gives nothing away for free - wifi internet available in the conference centre - $5 / 4 hours or wifi avail in hotel lobby $10 / 24 hours or internet cable available in room (which I couldn't get to work - $10/24 hrs). A lovely stay - overly expensive for what you get - and not quite special enough to make me want to return.

Reviews.Title: “Best on property!”
Reviews.Author: HighMaintenanceUk
Reviews.Content: I've just got back from a week's stay club level at the Boardwalk Inn. I've stayed there twice before, as well as other Disney deluxe resorts and this resort is by far the best! The newly refurbished rooms are beautiful and very comfortable. Every member of staff I encountered from 'mousekeeping' to club level were professional and extremely helpful, nothing was too much trouble for anyone. The Epcot resort area is a great area to stay in, not only can you walk directly into Epcot or Hollywood Studios, but you have the restaurants at the other resorts you can go to. There's so much variety you're never bored, and you're never 'stuck' at your own resort. The club level cast members here really are the best, they treat you like you're a long lost friend, whether it's your first stay club level or you're a returning guest. I was really sorry to be leaving at the end of this trip, I could have stayed at least another week. Food offerings in the lounge are also amongst the best, there's good variety and they're topped up constantly, other club levels I've stayed at really aren't a patch on the Boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “THIS HOTEL SPOILED MY FAMILY!”
Reviews.Author: krisyandjames
Reviews.Content: During our stay at the boardwalk hotel we was treated like kings and queens. The boardwalk staff went above and beyond to make sure our stay here was enjoyable and it turned into the best trip ever. We are military so we travel alot. So, for me to say this was the best trip ever is a huge compliment. The resort had so much to offer for the kids and adults in our party. If you are trying to decide between hotels choose this one. The southern hospitality of the staff will greatly be missed;-*(

Reviews.Title: “Not our favorite Disney resort”
Reviews.Author: OCT1
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Disney with the past two trips at Caribbean Beach and the Polynesian. This hotel did not offer the relaxed experience of the other two and we were a bit disappointed with the trip as it wasn't a good fit for us. My wife and I talked a great deal about it, trying to figure out why the two past trips were wonderful and the most recent one mediocre. I will share our insight into this hotel. It is important to mention, I think this is a terrific hotel and it simply wasn't a good fit for us, but I am sure some others might feel the same way. First, I will comment on the good aspects. This is a beautiful hotel, and I very much enjoyed the early 20th century theme. Our room was beautiful. We had a very nice view of the lake in a standard room, so we were quite happy. It is within easy walking distance to Epcot (walking was faster than the ferry) and has a ferry to Hollywood Studios. Now the aspects we didn't like. This was the nosiest hotel of the three we stayed at. The door was perhaps the heaviest hotel door I have seen, but we heard hall conversations readily. Between the hall and the boardwalk, it is not for light sleepers like my son. Our room was generally not cleaned until sometime between 1 and 3 pm, so as we have a three year old and returned for a mid-day nap, 3 days of the vacation were without maid service. We have never had that problem at the other resorts, and perhaps we were simply at the end of the list, but it was a bit annoying. Finally, the boardwalk is a mixed blessing. Unlike the other two resorts which have their own dining and shopping resources, the boardwalk inn and boardwalk are one unit. So whereas we previously looked forward to the much more tranquil resort after a busy day in the park, at the boardwalk inn, you don't feel like you leave the park. Some people might love this, but we didn't find it relaxing. Unlike most Disney resorts where the dining and shopping options are mostly for guests of that particular resort, the boardwalk is heavily toured by everyone, so the lines for everything are much longer than other resorts. While this should seem obvious by the hotel ads, it really didn't dawn on us that we would miss the quiet of the polynesian or carribean beach resorts. This is a wonderful location at Disney and a beautiful hotel. It offers a unique experience which is quiet different from other Disney resorts. I think if someone likes constant activity, it would be a great location. However, if you look at your Disney resort as a place to recharge after a day in the park, it probably isn't the best place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience of Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: 5dixiehighway
Reviews.Content: Absolutely stunning experience with Boardwalk Inn - staff very helpful and great fun only downside was the cost of General Store on Boardwalk - a little too pricey for recessionary times!! Food in Restaurants also excellent - a great trip to Florida finished with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, just awesome”
Reviews.Author: Frandib
Reviews.Content: Nothing I can say, other then it was perfect. Worth the extra money for sure.

Reviews.Title: “GREATEST DISNEY RESORT!”
Reviews.Author: love2travel2791
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Boardwalk September 13-18, 2008. I must say this hotel is immaculate. As drive in, you are immersed in not only the experience of a 1900's seaside town but the Disney experience. The staff was extremely attentive and kind. We were fortunate enough to be the first guests to stay in the newly constructed wing of the hotel and let me say they were fantastic. The yellow and white colors and amazingly comfortable bed were welcomed after a long day in the hot Florida sun. The bathrooms and rooms were extremely clean and remained that way, even with two toddlers and teenagers running around. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Disney world who can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Boardwalk, will RETURN and stay again!!!”
Reviews.Author: capacitybuffalo
Reviews.Content: We had arrrived to early on Friday the 13th, We checked in our room was not available, but the Hotel Clerk from the UK, she offered us another room to rest and freshen up at no charge, so we stayed in the room, we will not forget this show of class from the Boardwalk Inn, Jeff and Beckey Robertson NIagara Falls Ontario

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay - great atmosphere, location”
Reviews.Author: My2centsBoston
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Boardwalk at the end of January/beginning of February. It was beautiful, clean, the staff was helpful, the concierge was excellent! You really could have almost three meals a day at the concierge room if you wanted to! We had breakfast there every morning, dinner there a couple of nights. (So we were lucky enough not to miss a quick-serve restaurant as others have noted). The balcony was great to watch the fireworks at Epcot. And as everyone mentions, the location was fantastic. A short and pleasant walk to Studios, and even shorter stroll to Epcot. I love the area - the restaurants, performers, bars, other hotels - all in walking distance makes for a nice atmosphere at night, instead of sometimes feeling a little closed in at some of the other resorts. It was very cold when we were there, so didn't get to enjoy either pool, but they both looked great. Am looking forward to staying there again sometime and using them. We had the extra large room (deluxe) which was quite spacious and great for families. Everything went smoothly and it was a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “location is great”
Reviews.Author: SassyMaryland
Reviews.Content: I love the location of this resort. It is a short walk to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. You can take the buses, a boat or walk to most of the Disney resorts and the wait for the buses and the boat was 20 minutes or less. the rooms were spacious and well designed. We had a room over looking the the quiet pool. I have only two compliants. The first was with the housekeeping. On the first morning of our stay the housekeeper knocked very lightly on the door and started to let herself in. This confused me because it was around 8:45 in the morning and the paper was still in front of the door. I usually throw my trash away but I missed a empty coffee cup and a empty bottle of water on the night stand one morning and these were not thrown away but the tip next to them was noticed and taken. Several days later our room was not cleaned at all; the towels were still on the floor and the beds were not made. I did call the front desk and made them aware of the problems. I vacation at Disney on a regular basis and Disney has always been the cleanest resorts and I have stayed at six or more resorts there. This might have been limited to our housekeeping staff member. The second compliant was the pool slide was always closed in the evening when we returned to the resort around 8:30-9:00. The sign said that the pool was open until midnight but they turned off the jets on the spa and the heat in he main pool before 10PM and we were in the pool. The pool was the only reason we did not stay at Beach Club or the Yacht Club because that pool was being refurbished.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: BRBM
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 6 day stay at the Boardwalk. Kids loved the big slide at the pool. The hotel is huge..had to walk real far to the room. There is no quick serve restaurant at this hotel. We ate at Spoodles almost everyday for breakfast, it was good but got boring quick! On the last day we walked over to the Swan and had a nice buffet breakfast with Goofy and Pluto!! It is worth taking the bus to Animal Kindgon Lodge and eating at Boma. This hotel was nice, but I felt the room could have been cleaner. There was dust on the walls and baseboard trim. There was some cracked tiles in tub and some black mildew in shower too. It was only a little bit, not a big deal but it shouldn't be there for $400.00 a night room! Last year we statyed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge and we will go back there next time. All in all Boardwalk is nice but I have no need to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed dozens of times--can't beat!”
Reviews.Author: ehan31
Reviews.Content: I'm a DVC member whose home property is the Boardwalk. It is truly the most charming, beautiful, convenient place. My favorite parks are Epcot and MGM so the public transport via boat is fantastic. The rooms are well-appointed and offer lots of space and amenities. Service in all areas (valet, desk, concierge, housekeeping etc) have always been great. Common rooms kept in impeccable shape. Lovely place to spend time outside of the parks. I live in FL and go stay at Boardwalk for a mini vacation of my own! Great pool options with large, kid-friendly main pool and smaller quiet pools. Only downside is lack of cheaper, more fast-food style options on the property like a cafeteria or pizza/burger/chicken joint. The restaurants on the pier are fantastic though.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay at Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: RelaxedTraveler2
Reviews.Content: Boardwalk Inn was recently renovated, and looked fabulous. They were still working on the villa side, but there was no construction noise or disturbance. Very ideal location. Walking distance to EPCOT and Hollywood Studios. Service staff was not as "magical" as previous Disney stays. Concierge was probably the worse, rather condescending and rude.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL RESORT”
Reviews.Author: GGD3
Reviews.Content: Beuatiful resort....very expensive week after Christmas! Room was very spacious and very nice! Checkin staff NOT very "magical"....very convenient to restaurants and Epcot. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Boardwalk -Nice Location & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: patmatleo
Reviews.Content: Greal location - easy walking distance to Epcot and Hollywood Studios - also offers boat rides to both locations (huge time savers and hug plus not having to deal with buses). Hotel decor nicely appointed and staff was very friendly. Grounds and landscaping were beautiful! Only neagtive was the lack of quick food (there are no restaurants in this hotel - all food options are only available outside on the Boardwalk). Quick food consisted of hotdog/sandwich vendors with very long waits. Long waits were seen in all food lcoation on the Boardwalk (we were not there during peak/holiday season). Make sure you make early reservations if you would like to eat on the Boardwalk. Overall very nice hotel, but might try the Beach/Yacht Club another time to access the proximity to Epcot and Hollyowood Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: scottish_scrooge
Reviews.Content: We knew we wanted to stay on Disney property so after MUCH debate and thought we opted for the Boardwalk Inn. The reason for this was the locations which is, without doubt, the best place in Disney World. The Boardwalk Inn is located as part of the Epcot Resorts on a bank of a lake. epcot is a 10minute walk and Disney Hollywood Studios is about 15mins (although Epcot walk is much nicer). Upon check-in we told the receptionist we were on Honeymoon and we were upgraded to one of their newly re-furbished rooms. the room itself was fantastic. The size of the room was good (standard disney size) with 2 sinks outside the bathroom, small table, sofa and large queen size bed. We were also fortunate enough to have a balcony overlooking a courtyard. With a flatscreen tv and an ipod dock you could tell the room had recently been redocorated but the nice touches were the small mickey mouse's doted about - shower curtain, chair, lamp etc. There were no restaurants in the hotel itself as they are all located just outside on 'The Boardwalk' - 30seconds away, although you could buy croissants in the morning from the bar area. there are plenty to choose from (personal favourite is the EPSN sports bar). As with other Disney Hotels the there is the busses to the parks and water parks and your room key is also your park ticket and charge card at any shop and restaurant in Disney. Overall whilst the room was gorgeous this was partly to do with it being recently refurbished, the additional cost of this hotel above other Disney hotels is the location, it was great to be able to walk to 2 theme parks and around the Boardwalk area itself. We would definately stay at this hotel again and would do so over the Beach and Yacht Clubs (the 2 other Disney Hotels across the lake.

Reviews.Title: “Fond memories”
Reviews.Author: Chelley14
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a deluxe concierge room at the BoardWalk Inn several years ago with my daughter and my niece, and we enjoyed our visit. The location of the hotel is perfect--just a short walk to Epcot. We had a wonderful view of the BoardWalk, and the girls enjoyed sitting on the balcony in the evenings and watching all the activity outside. The concierge lounge offerings were plentiful, and the concierge staff members were gracious. I am looking forward to visiting this resort again; I will be returning later this fall.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, pretty good...”
Reviews.Author: crazyg8r
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 days as my husband was in town on business This is the 3rd Disney property we have stayed on (with the other two being the Beach Club and Fort Wilderness Campground). I don't know what it was about this hotel, but the "magic" just wasn't there for me. A couple of staff issues... the valets drove like maniacs... worse than we have seen... and we encountered one of them actually blaring the horn of a car he was driving at a family of pedestrians on the sidewalk (who had the right of way) so they would get out of his way and he could turn into the road. We were stunned (as were his "victims").... and on the way into the hotel, reported this to the valet manager. A couple of mornings later, I had some business to do @ the concierge desk... and was "helped" by Debbie. I tried to cash a check and first she tried to dissuade me by saying, "you'll have to wait, this takes a while." Well, she had difficulty getting an authorization for the check for whatever reason because "it says it is no good" (and kind of announces this to me as other guests were standing around). So I ask her "WHO says it is no good?!" We had a credit card number stolen a few years ago, so we get hyped up easily on this sort of thing. Well, not understanding what the problem could be, I pressed. So she had to call them back... and she was speaking VERY loudly and SLOWLY to me like I was somehow impaired... and I was getting more and more aggravated. Finally, it was approved... and there wasn't so much of a Thank You for your patience, sorry this took so long... nothing. She handed over the cash and turned back to her coworker who had kind of helped her along through this process. Unfortunately, these are the type of memories that burn into your brain when you are paying 370 a night. It is unfortunate, because we had stellar service and treatment everywhere else at this resort... the pool, the gift shops, the lounge, the maid service...the rooms were well appointed... the grounds beautiful... everyone was helpful...and seemed to delight in hearing us say Thank You or smile at them (this is thankless work dealing with tourists all day!!) We didn't see much construction that might have obstructed one's stay...but those two experiences made the most impact on dragging the score down in our minds. I would return, don't get me wrong.... but in comparison to other places, 370 is a lot to pay for "average" and given a choice and if the price was comparable, I would try another resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: elizabethelia919
Reviews.Content: I booked thru Disney reservations and paid more than I wanted, but the experience was well worth it. It was my daughter's 7th birthday and they gave her a baloon bouquest and a birthday card with an autographed picture of all the princesses. I was crying I was so happy for her. This was the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in, you could eat off the floors. Fun pool with water slide. 10 minute walk to epcot's back door. I would definately stay again(once I save enough money).

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Home is for real”
Reviews.Author: TheMemom
Reviews.Content: We stayed there twice this summer, both times on the concierge level where a lovely lounge area serves breakfast, lunch, snacks and evening cordials. Rooms are updated and very clean. Good quality bedding. The magic is in the staff who seem to have a mission to make your stay "magical." This is a place to stay when you want a little Disney fantasy but have outgrown the Magic Kingdom. You don't need a car. Epcot and Hollywood studios are walkable (or take the boat). Lots of things to do day and evening and fast and easy transportation to the other parks are right at the front door. If you use the Magical Express to get to the hotel, once you are off the plane, you and your luggage are taken care of until you get back on the plane. Disney knows how to take care of people and there's the magic!

Reviews.Title: “Sterile and Artificial”
Reviews.Author: zzkk
Reviews.Content: Our (conference rate) $250+ room, with two queen beds, was very generic - and not in the league of a room at a Doubletree hotel. Service was rather poor, with 45 minute room service and no phone access to the concierges. The concierges strongly discourage any non-Disney activity or restaurant. My advice is to stay at a non-DIsney hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: Ryjata
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to DW. The hotel was nice; however, it is an older one. (Before we stayed at Saratoga Springs, which was newer and beautiful.) It wasn't bad at Boardwalk, just not as nice. Unfortunately, our view was where they were doing construction. The pool was great with a really cool slide. The boardwalk itself was good. The room was for 5 - but one of us had to sleep on a horrible sleeper chair. It was too crowded for us. Next time we will get another villa. We were just trying to save some money. Of course we didn't spend much time in the room, only to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: readynow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 8/2 - 8/9. We were there for friend's wedding. We were in room 3305. We had a standard view room with 2 Queen beds & 1 day bed. didn't really care about the view & this room turned out to be just fine. Far enough away to have no problem with the refurbishing contsruction. There were 5 of us staying in the room. The daybed was a bit short, but the room had plenty of floor space so we put the matress on the floor & added a few pillows at the end & my 17 yr old had no problems at all sleeping there. Room had a refrigerator, in which we kept cold bottles of water. Took a peek at the rooms they are refurbishing & there was now a sofa in there instead of the day bed. We arrived to check in at about 11pm, no concierege there at that time so all we did was check in. We needed a couple of extra towels & sheets for the day bed. Called for those & received them about 15 minutes later. From that point forward, they always delivered enough towels & sheets for the room. They would accept no tip for delivering. Lobby is a good waiting place to gather while waiting for every body. The concierege staff was excellent for our stay. They answered all our questions & were able to get us restaurant reservations the day of & the next day in all the restaurants except the most in demand. The air/line check-in desk had a problem with their system being down when we went to check in, so had to check in at the airport, but the bell kept our luggage with no problem until we were ready to go to the airport. Location is excellent, have to disagree with previous poster. EPCOT was only a 5 minute walk away at most, even in the 90 degree heat & humidity, was quicker than taking the boat. Disney Studios was about 20 -25 minute walk but we always took the boat. If you take the boat back, get off at the Swan & walk back to the Boardwalk, you can beat the boat back by about 10 minutes. Magic Kingdom & Animal Kingdom were reached by bus & worked fine. We did the night extra hours a number of times & had no problem with the buses. The bus to Dsiney downtown was about the longest to get to & from. Would definitley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Construction nightmare, bad attitudes, lazy staff”
Reviews.Author: MellowKnee
Reviews.Content: Was recommended this hotel by the Walt Disney Reservation staff. Reserved a 2 BR, 2-1/2 BA suite on the Club Level with concierge service. Paid top dollar for the accomodations - over $1200./night for 3 nights. Checked in on time and the staff was super nice, until after I signed the credit card slip. We checked into the room which was really nice and newly redecorated. Large and confortable. That's pretty much all the good I can say about the hotel. The toilet in the master bath was not working when we got in and had to get it fixed. The next morning we were awakened at about 7:30 a.m. to banging and relentless construction noise, hammering sanding, etc. I called down to the front desk to find out the problem and they said that they were sorry that no one told us they were doing construction/redecorating work. I told them that this was not acceptable. They said they would call me back after they investigated, I waited another noisy hour and finally called them back. I talked to the front desk manager and he said he would call me right back. Another hour later, I called again and they told me they were again sorry they didn't tell me that they were remodeling. I went out of the room down the hall and was choked by dry-wall dust. I went back to the room and packed my bags and found the concierge and told them I was done, get me out of here and left. They finally called me back about an hour later and agreed to move my family and I to the Contemporary Resort. They said they would move my bags. To make a long story short, they lost 2 of my bags and it took hours for us to get all our luggage. The "club level" option that I paid for consisted of really bad food and very little of it. No way worth the extra $1500 I was charged. Breakfast was tiny stale danishes, few cartons of yogurt, raisin bran, milk and some fresh fruit and juices. The rest of the day the hors doerves consisted of peanut butter and jelly uncrustable sandwiches cut into fourths with some potato chips and a few stale cookies. This was no where near what I was told would be available. I was also to have concierge service available. They did manage to book us one character dinner, but we were at a table off to the side of the main dining area and couldn't see the main part of the show. The other dinner reservations/shows I asked about they just told me that the restaurants were full. I went to one restaurant that they told us was full and asked for a reservation and got one immediately on my own for a prime 6:30 p.m. serving time. All the staff workers, housekeepers were constantly gathered up together in the halls complaining about their working conditions. We didn't even get towels after the first night. They came in and took the dirty towels and left us no fresh towels. The hotel location is hard to get transportation. We were told that the hotel was "not more than a baseball throw" from EPCOT. Wrong. The walk was much longer. The water taxis stop running around dark. Getting to any of the other parks is by bus and is slow crowded and difficult. Synopsis - hotel was a rip-off, club floor service was a major rip-off and concierge service was worthless. Disney should be ashamed of their lack of service at these outrageous prices.

Reviews.Title: “Another Relaxing Stay at The Boardwalk, but didn't feel the Disney magic !”
Reviews.Author: trvlgrl422
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this resort. It's a quiet and beautiful property. Everyone is very friendly and helpful on property. It has an awesome pool area. We were always able to find some loungers by the pool. They keep the halls very cold, so bring sweaters. The restaurants along the Boardwalk are great, esp. ESPN Zone and Spoodles. We couldn't get in at the Big River Brewery, so we went across the way to a Yacht Club to the restaurant off their lobby. It was expensive and really not worth it. The service was lacking and the food had very little flavor. The parks were very crowded, which was to be expected during this time of year. I've been to Disney many times during summer and school breaks so I knew in advance what to expect. Disney really needs to add another park or more attractions to satisfy the crowds. We also visited Universal for the first time during this trip and found that Universal was less crowded and had more updated attractions. We paid extra for the express passes in advance thinking that they would be necessary, but they weren't really needed. Although the Disney parks were crowded, our stay at The Boardwalk made up for that Disney magic that was missing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: jenntyl99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boardwalk Inn July 21-28, 2008. Our first impression of this resort upon arrival was it was nicely decorated. The front desk staff person was very helpful, as we arrived around 10 am and were able to check in. That was nice considering we did not want to wait until 4 pm to check in. The biggest benefit of staying at this resort is its location. It is only a 5 or so minute walk to Epcot and 12 minute walk to Hollywood Studios. This saved us so much time compared to waiting for a bus or other transportation. In fact, we tried to boat to Hollywood Studios and waited 15 minutes for the boat and it took another 10 minutes to stop at the resort. So, this is a big time saver. The resort This resort has nice landscaping. There are sitting areas around the resort outside for guests. It also has three different pools, with the largest one being the Keister Coaster pool. The kids loved this pool because of that reason, but the other pools are just as nice to get cooled off. The decor inside the resort is alos very charming and the theming falls right in line with the old time boardwalk of the East Coast. The room Our room (room 1342) was a garden view overlooking the "quiet" pool. This was an added benefit for us because we could easily go outside for a swim and be close enough to the room. Another benefit of the rooms here is that the seem to be larger then most other Disney resorts. Our room had two double beds and a sleeper sofa. The bathroom was large enough as well. The pools As stated above, there are three pools. The large pool is nice for kids and those who love water slides, but is a bit more crowded. It was least crowded after a storm had passed. The two other pools were nice but had no extra benefits for kids (ie. a slide). But they were less crowded and oftentimes you would be the only one there. Also, there were no lifeguards on duty. On Site Amenities This resort's feature benefit is its location. I could not say enough about having such a perfect location. Being able to walk to two parks was a time saver. At this time of year the parks are crowded and waiting for a bus or being crowded in the bus can make for some unhappy people. Plus, if you really wanted to get to Magic Kingdom you can easily walk to Epcot and take the monorail there. Our biggest complaint about this resort was its availability of dining services. Usually we get a mug because it works out well. However, at this resort getting a mug can be an inconvenience. You have to walk quite a distance and the dining areas where you get mugs close quite early. Plus, you need to wait for someone to fill it (it's not self service). Also, the dining establishments here do not make you feel as though you have your own exclusive dining like other Disney resorts. Although this is a problem, the food is spectacular. We ate at Spoodles for breakfast and it was very delicious. The portion sizes were also enough to feed more than one person. In addition, we did in room dining for breakfast the one morning (Family breakfast). This was meant for 4 people but it seemed like we could feed 8 or more people on it. The price was reasonable for the breakfast and the room service staff was very friendly. Overall Impression This resort has pros and cons and depending on your needs you should look at what it is you most want from a resort experience. We loved the fact that we were within walking distance to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. However, if you like having close dining within the resort, this is probably not the resort for you.

Reviews.Title: “Boardwalk -True Disney Fashion”
Reviews.Author: job13ri
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boardwalk during the July 4th holiday. We have stayed at several other Disney resorts and this one ranks up with the best. It's decor is based on the 20's - 30's Atlantic city hotels. The feel walking through the resort transports you back in time with the music played in the halls to the old radio shows that are played in the lounge just off the lobby. There is just enough "Disney" to add to your experience without being overwhelmed by it. We found it extremely comfortable and very clean. The rooms are adorable and very nicely sized. The beds were extremely comfortable. We had a nice balcony with a couple of chairs and a table to relax on. The cleaning service was immpecable. They provided all that was expected and more. The lobby is very nicely appointed with great models of an old carousel and roller coaster as well as the "carousel horse" chandelier. There is a great large back porch that faces the Boardwalk that has plenty of wicker rockers to lounge in and watch all the action on the Boardwalk. Our stay at this resort was fabulous. On the day we left we nearly had a major problem. One of the people in our party left her purse on the bench while we were waiting for transport to the airport. She did not realize it until we arrived at Orlando Int'l. No ID, credit cards and cash. Just as panic was setting in, I received a call from the hotels valet service (John) saying that they had found her purse. He assured us that he would have it delivered to the airport within a half hour. Noelle drove it over and kept in constant contact with us so we knew when she would arrive and where to meet her. True to their word she was there in plenty of time for us to get to our flight with time to spare. I had to beg her to take a tip since they had really bailed us out of a jam. Her response was "not neccessary, that's just what we do". That reply rang true thoughout our stay at this fabulous resort. Everyone we came in contact with was very friendly and tried to go above and beyond your expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Conciege Level Gave Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: renelle06
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay --- conceirge level was wonderful. Great meals. Certainly needed no other breakfast or lunch. room very comfortable. Easy walk to Epcot. Pools very nice and accessible. Easy to get lost in long corridors and different wings. Only issue we had was lack of room service or restaurants after 12 midnight -- where to eat after late park hours was a problem. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for our WDW trip!”
Reviews.Author: CristinaTx
Reviews.Content: Our family really enjoyed the BWI. We stayed in a two bedroom suite (#4205) on the concierge level (this was a complimentary upgrade from 2 standard rooms given at check in). The rooms were very spacious with queen beds plus a small daybed in the second room and a king in the master. The LR had a pull out sofa and desk, DR table and bar area with mini fridge and microwave. We could see the fireworks from Illuminations on our balcony (over the tree line). This room is just behind and to left of the ESPN restaurant and was still surprisingly quiet. A generous, cold breakfast was served daily in the club with fruit, cereals, yogurt, pastries and juices, etc. There is even a cappuccino maker. There were light snacks and lemonade/tea during the day and heavy appetizers plus desserts in the evening including wine, beer and cordials. The service from the entire club staff was outstanding as they helped with everything from dinning reservations to directions. The family pool at the hotel has a fun slide that looks like an old wooden roller coaster which our girls really enjoyed. All of this coupled with the proximity to EPCOT and DS/MGM and great dinning choices on the Boardwalk makes this hotel is a winner!
