One final note - the staff mentioned that all of the concierge floor rooms and club are getting upgraded in July (carpeting, fabrics, flat screen TVs, WIFI, etc.) so it should be even better!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sarakenny
Reviews.Content: The room was impeccable though the daybed was a little small for my teen (he didn't want to share a bed with his sister and Disney doesn't provide rollaway beds). The double sink outside the bathroom was wonderful for getting ready in the morning and for bed at night. Housekeeping responded quickly to all requests. The bellhop service was dependent on who was on duty. I needed something brought up to the room and they said it would be there in 15 minutes but after a half hour, I carried it up myself. But on other occasions, the folks there were very helpful. The concierge was wonderful -- no matter who was on duty! Funny story: One day I swung by the front desk to ask for a box of tissues. She was from a Latin country (can't remember which one) and said "we don't have those." I realized it was a language barrier and just called housekeeping from my room. The boardwalk location was good: Quick walk to Epcot and short trip to Hollywood Studios though the boat there was inconsistent. Buses to Magic Kingdom were great sometimes while other times it seems we waited forever. The kids loved the pool and we never tried the fitness room. The lobby bar was a nice break before heading up to the room at night. The general store was aptly supplied though as a Diet Pepsi fan I was disappointed my only choice was Diet Coke. The location was worth the price though we spent very little time in the room and I wonder if we could have gotten away with staying at a moderate resort. Maybe next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Boardwalk!”
Reviews.Author: BeagleMomWisconsin
Reviews.Content: My husband attended a medical conference at the Boardwalk, and we got to tag along! I hadn't been to Disney since 1979(before Epcot and MGM), and my husband and children had never been. Needless to say, so much had changed. We had a room on the Garden Side; very quiet, clean, roomy, and great beds. The location is superb! You have so many dining and park travel choices at your door. The "extra magic hours" are great. You really appreciate the minimal line wait at night, compared to the busiest time of the day. The staff were all excellent. Our main housekeeper placed my children's stuffed animals in the cutest poses. This was such a thrill for them. I felt safe and secure, something very important to me. We looked at some of the lobbies of other resorts(G.Floridian,Wilderness Lodge,Yacht and Beach Clubs) and they were all very nice, but I felt perfectly content with our choice. I also liked that my husband could conveniently reach the conference center without extra travel on a bus, taxi, etc. You will be pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Disney hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelkitty28
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boardwalk Inn for 3 nights, and it was a nice hotel with a 1940' s theme right on the water. The problem is the weather got rather cold - so it made it much less enjoyable - as there are no decent restaurants inside the hotel. You have to walk outside! And so I needed to wear my winter coat (no kidding) to get to the restaurant. The restaurant prices were very expensive - more like you would expect in NYC. The other problem was that for breakfast you had no good options. The bar had some danish and coffee self serve, or you needed to bundle up and go walk outside to a restaurant (Spoodles) which was very high priced. The food choices for breakfast were very limited here and none sounded healthy (except for the fruit plate, which is what we ordered.) They have a "bakery" which was overrated, crowded, and had no good bagel s or bread selections. They need to have a breakfast buffet INSIDE the hotel. The room was okay with a tiny terrace that fit only one chair.. but the view was of the court yard which was fine. The room was quiet and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Disney at its Best”
Reviews.Author: Keys2Serenity
Reviews.Content: We made reservations in advance to stay here for part of our honeymoon and requested a king bed, waterview room with a balcony. When we arrived to our room it had two double beds(not cool on your honeymoon) and a balcony with a great view, so I call the front desk and was told to return so the error could be corrected. The next room had a crappy view from the balcony and a large family of screaming kids in the adjoining room (yes, I know it's DIsney but it's also our well planned honeymoon), so I called back down to the front desk. The person at the desk and the bellhop (probably tired of all the moves) were so nice and understanding, we were given two choices of rooms to pick from and taken to see them - a king, no balcony (I think its the only room w/o one in the entire place) for our reservation price or a Garden Suite - Club Level that cost per night what our previous reservation cost for the entire stay. We took the suite because it had it all - a private rose graden courtyard with two patio chairs and a table (complete with several wild bunnys that stopped by daily) overlooking the gardens and adult pool area....believe it or not, complete with a white picket fence . I cannot express how nice this 2 story room was, it had a four poster king bed, two nice fluffy robes, a jetted tub and huge marble shower upstairs and another bathroom, living room area with sleeper sofa and tv downstairs. It had a small kitchen with microwave, coffee maker, ref, sink and dining area. Guest services were the best, the suite was very clean and housekeeping always suprised us with the cute towel animals they would leave in our room. We had a wonderful time and could not have asked for a better stay, even though we were going to be so broke when we got home! But the story gets even better!!! About a week after we get home, we get a refund for the additional amount we were charged for the upgraded room. So we stayed in the most expensive room for the price of a standard room...How cool is that! THANK YOU, DISNEY!

Reviews.Title: “Good weekend at the BoardWalk”
Reviews.Author: WDWZEUS
Reviews.Content: I treated myself and my family to a weekend at Disney's BoardWalk Resort, and I wanted to say it was a real treat. I spent the extra money to get a water view hopping that I would end up with a BoardWalk view (as it was explained that they could not guarantee it). We had a great check in, and then we ended up with the BoardWalk View! My family loved it, and I we just had a wonderful weekend relaxing, and spending time at the pool! The one thing is the rooms are nice, but not nearly as nice as you'd expect for the money you are putting down. But I guess you pay a premium for location! All in all it was a great weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but great location”
Reviews.Author: Cardoza
Reviews.Content: This was my third time to DisneyWorld, first to Boardwalk. I chose it because of the location, pure and simple. The boardwalk itself is full of food and entertainment. However, the Yacht and Beach Club resorts are nicer, and just as conveniently located - but still pricey. The walk to Epcot and Hollywood Studios is a bit of a hike, and might be difficult with really young children or with anyone disabled. Frankly, the Animal Kingdom Lodge and Wilderness Resort are every bit as nice as the Boardwalk as far as the accomodations are concerned, but not as convenient to the parks. They are a much better value, and for the money I'd choose one of them if I'm willing to take the bus to the parks. One quick gripe, be weary of the Disney food plan. They significantly changed the terms in 2008 -without notifying us- but did not change the price. Not a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Very Expensive, food choices limited.”
Reviews.Author: graciediane
Reviews.Content: The grounds are beautiful, The location is amazing. Staff is friendly and helpful. The price is just so ridiculous. (Even with my friend's Florida Discount) We stayed here (3 adults & 2 kids) because we wanted to splurge and stay at a deluxe resort. Plus, the day bed gave us an extra sleeping spot. Compared to other Disney Resorts, the food choices are just not available. You're only choice is to walk far to spend a lot of money to eat breakfast. I can't say we had a horrible experience here. Overall, fancy and nice accomodations. I just feel like we're a family that enjoys the moderate & value resorts more. This is a high-end resort more suited for adults and singles with money to burn. If you've got the kiddies with you, you can still have a great time staying at a lower priced resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great treat for a family of four”
Reviews.Author: FamilyoffourBoston
Reviews.Content: We went to Disney back in 2005 and stayed at the Dolphin Hotel, liked it but choose this hotel as there was more for the kids, age 9 and 6 to do. We were very please with the pool. We stayed there our arrival day and felt like it was as great a day as one at the parks. We were very pleased with our room. Plenty of space, in fact my kids fought over sleeping on the day bed instead of the queen size bed. We ate breakfast at the board walk every day, then off we went to the parks. I say treat yourself and book a trip there.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Disney”
Reviews.Author: barat99
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Christmas day and the hotel was dirty, the bathroom had body hair from other guests, stains on the carpet and the wallpaper is coming off the wall. After waiting 5 hours for our luggage, we called and the person yelled at my husband(the information given is a maximum of 3 hour wait). Once we got our luggage it was SOAKED, Disney left our luggage in the rain. The managers answer was "we have laundry facilities available in the hotel, for you to use". The laundry room was dirty and most of the machines were not working. The staff is rude and it took us 2 days just to get room service menus. The menus were out dated and not correct, we ordered Mickey waffles for our son and we did not get the waffles, we were told they were no longer available. My mom ordered the Mickey waffles 2 hours later (we did not tell her they were not available). She got the waffles. We requested a hotel directory everyday for 7 days and it never arrived. The hotel does not have a restaurant directly on property, and the restaurants in the area were so slow, one morning it took my husband 1 hour to get coffee. We would have had it in the room but we could not seem to get housekeeping to leave coffee. Spend your money somewhere else, this was not the happiest or cleanest place on earth. Disney needs to make some changes.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - but a word of caution”
Reviews.Author: CH_LondonEngland
Reviews.Content: I'd stayed at the Boardwalk Inn in a boardwalk view room in May 2007 and loved everything about the resort. This time (December 2007) I was staying at the InnKeepers Club, the resort's club-concierge level. Unlike 'normal' rooms you cannot book a specific room view. When we arrived we were escorted up to the 4th floor to check in at the club level. Check in was friendly and efficient and we were soon on our way to our room. This is where we hit it a bit of a problem. The room was very pretty (same as my non club room in May) but it overlooked the satellite dishes of the ESPN club (it was actually over the ESPN club) and a service/access road. Even with the door closed you could hear the traffic. For $550 dollars a night I don't think this is acceptable so I spoke to a club staff member who changed our room to a room overlooking the gardens and with a prime view of the Epcot Illuminations (fireworks). Fantastic room. The club level was very relaxing, unlike some of the resort club levels where it can be a bit of a scrum when the food is put out. I would rate the Boardwalk club level as one of the best, aside from the Grand Floridan Royal Palm Club (main building) but that is exceptional. The cast members were all very friendly and approachable and would do anything for us, and the resort is so beautiful, especially with the christmas decorations up. Although the resort was full you wouldn't have thought so, until you went to the main lobby or the valet, and even then the staff handled everything to the best of their ability. Like all Disney resorts the Boardwalk isn't cheap but if you're after a 'nice' hotel in a superb location this can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TTTravelers1
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at all deluxe Disney resorts this is the most disappointing. The staff was very difficult and we spent more time on the phone with the front desk or standing at the front desk. Billing problems, mousekeeping problems, poor dining choices compared to the other WDW resorts. When you walk into this resort it really has the feel of a timeshare not an inn or resort. Sound is a big problem if you stay in the highest priced rooms. The entertainment goes until late night and you are sure to know when the bars close at 2 a.m, because there is a significant amount of noise.

Reviews.Title: “Grumpy old Men at BWI Concierge”
Reviews.Author: Maryella
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the BWI over 5 nights at Thanksgiving. Booked a concierge level room at the AAA rate of $500.00 a night. The room had 2 Queen beds and a tiny little day bed that a small child could barely fit in. The sink was cracked and the toilet bowl was tilted (looks like it had been removed and replaced several times from the grout marks on the tile).The food/snack/beverage offerings in the lounge were pretty pathetic. A simple continental breakfast in the AM (bagels, toast, danish, 3 cereal choices.) A few bags of chips and pretzels and a few soggy cookies in the PM. At cocktail time the white/red wine and beer did not appear until exactly 5:00 and not a minute sooner. At 10 minutes before 7 the conciege announced "10 minutes before we take everything away". A real class act!!! There were 2 hot entrees every night (some inedible) and the same cheese, crackers, veggies and dip every night. In addition the lounge itself was very small with only 1 table for 4 and 2 tables for 2. There is 2 couch areas with a cocktail table. But try eating your cereal bending down over a low table. The room is way too small to handle the large amount of rooms assigned to the concierge level. In addition huge familiy groups desend on this spot so there was usually never any place to sit. You could bring your food back to your room but whats the point. There is only a small bistro table with 2 chairs in your room. What do the other 2 people in your room do? The staff up on the concierge lounge also left a lot to be desired. With the lone exception of Lorenzo everyone else had a puss on their faces and every question you asked them was an effort for them to respond. They were all a grumpy bunch of old men and women who I never saw crack a smile. The one positive note is the hotel is in a great location to walk to Epcot and MGM. The pool is very small for the size of the hotel with the most rock hard lounge chairs I have ever sat in ---if you could find one. If you are looking to have lunch at the pool---forget about it. They only serve 2 cold sandwich selections. I stayed at the Yacht and Beach Club concierge and I feel they are far superior. For the money I paid for a room at the BWI I was very disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great time with the Family”
Reviews.Author: Lmacmay
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a fantastic family vacation. My entire family (parents, brothers and sisters and their spouses) stayed at the Boardwalk and all of us had a great experience. The check in process was painless! They were able to check us all in quickly. Our rooms were clean and overlooked one of the two “adult” pools at the resort. The adult pool was simple and quiet, which was nice. The restaurants at the Boardwalk were nice and there were plenty of options at the Boardwalk for each meal. The Dolphin, Swan, Beach Club and Yacht Club are all within walking distance, so you can also have a meal there as well. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet at the Yacht Club. It was nice to fill up and then walk some of the breakfast off. EPCOT and MGM are within walking distance of the resort. You can take a boat to both but we found walking to be faster. We took buses to Animal Kingdom and Blizzard Beach. The Boardwalk is close so both rides weren’t very long. We walked through EPCOT and took the monorail to the Magic Kingdom. The Boardwalk lights up at night. We stayed on a Friday and Saturday night so there was a lot of activity at the Dance Hall and the Piano bar. The ESPN club was lots of fun on Saturday during all of the college games. I would probably not include the meal plan in our next Disney package. The package provides more food than you really need. Our only bad experience was at the Grand Floridian. We decided to use two of our sit down meal points at Citricos. Our waiter was incredibly nice and cordial until we mentioned that we were using the Disney meal plan to pay for the meal. After that our service went down hill and his attitude went sour. The Disney meal plan includes an appetizer, the entrée and a dessert. It also includes gratuity (18%). Needless to say, we waited a long time for our food (which was puzzling since it was 9pm and we were one of the last groups in the restaurant), he was slow to refill our drinks and water, and we waited quite awhile to get our bill. We are a relaxed group and we were enjoying the conversation but we all noticed the delay after awhile. All in all, we had a great time. I would recommend the Boardwalk to anyone and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at the Boardwalk!”
Reviews.Author: SchafG
Reviews.Content: My husband, my parents and I stayed at the Boardwalk for the EPCOT Food and Wine Festival. I would highly recommend this hotel for that event. You could walk from the hotel to EPCOT (a short walk I might add) or take a free water shuttle. It was very convenient especially since you enter into the World Showcase. The hotel itself is nice. There are alot of food options at the Boardwalk, so that is convenient. I thought it was a little overpriced for what you got, especially if you pay full price. We were spoiled and paid the Florida Resident discount. I did not encounter any real negatives but for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Boardwalk was a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysPlanning
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights at the Boardwalk. I loved the Magical Express and the close location to Epcot. It wouldn't rank as a 5 star hotel in my book, but the room was large and the pool was very nice. My only complaint was with the bus system. I thought the buses were few and far between. I am comparing it with last years stay at the Port Orleans Riverside. I would recommend this property for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Fun but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Whit2810
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for my honeymoon. It was cute and cozy and the atmosphere was very nice. However, I still had some complaints. As always, the Disney staff was amazing. Very friendly and helpful. When we first go there, we asked about having a king size bed but when we got to the room we had 2 twins. My husband called and we were switched to a different room with a king size bed. Then it took them about 7 hours to get our luggage to us and it was 1 am before they got it to our room because they had sent it to the wrong room. The room was nice but definitely not as clean. There was mildew on the ceiling in the shower that had not been cleaned. I think all the maids did while we were there where change out our towels and make the bed. The sheets weren't changed out once while we were there b/c there was a hole in one so that we were able to tell it was the same sheet the entire trip. The food was good however at the restruants that were on the boardwalk. At night time you can see the fireworks being shot off from the Magic Kingdom and Epcot. The bus rides were awesome b/c you are the first stop in the morning so the busses are always empty with plenty of seats and at night when you are tired your the first stop so you can get off instead of having to go to all the hotels. The pool was a very good size with a very fun slide. Also, you are within walking distance of Epcot and MGM. There are little paths to both which make it very convient. I would recommend taking these instead of the boats that can take you to each since those take so long waiting on passengers and stop at all the hotels. Its quicker to walk. We did have fun and overall it was nice. I'm not sure we'd stay there again since there are other hotels to try and we like trying different places. As long as you aren't a super hotel snob, the rooms are ok if not the nicest, but if you are looking for luxery, this isn't the place to stay. Its great for a family though.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort!!”
Reviews.Author: Schmengi9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a wonderful five night stay at the BoardWalk Inn and would strongly recommend it to anyone looking for a deluxe lodging at WDW. First off, it is a gorgeous hotel that is extremely well located in the Epcot Resort Area. Well the exterior along the actual boardwalk is fine, it is the interior that really captures your eye. The attention to detail with the decorations is exceptional and reflects the trappings of 1920s American decor. Beautiful floors, furnishings, memorabilia and tapestries make the public areas really pop. The rooms are also spacious and well decorated, with plenty of closet and drawer space and two sinks on the vanity outside the bathroom. Our room had a small balcony that overlooked the first floor garden suites, but more significantly, the fireworks at Epcot, which made for a nice evening in. In general, the staff was great and the little details were paid close attention to for the most part (like the steady stock of hand towels in the men's room that could be "borrowed" for use as a head mop while out in the Central Florida summer heat! :o)) Unlike a fair number of WDW resorts that suffer from things to do outside the resort, BW is right in the thick of things on the boardwalk, with a handful of dining options nearby as well as the kitschy trappings of the boardwalk itself. Only a five minute walk to the World Showcase entrance to Epcot, it's nothing to walk or take the boat over to Epcot for a bite or a drink. One of the real gems of the resort is the Belle Vue Room bar located on the second floor of the Inn. A bartender who really knows how to mix and serve a cocktail works the comfortably furnished and largely quiet room just past the main lobby. It is a kids-free zone for the most part and was a really pleasure to retire to for a quiet drink at the end of the day. This is not to say that we didn't have a couple of quarrels with the BW. The main pool, which is generally very nice, is well removed from the Inn side on the Villas side and requires a march across the resort campus or through the hotel lobby. We would have used the "Quiet Pool" on the Inn side to cool off more, but there is no bar in the Quiet Pool area so our business went to the main pool. Signage in the complex could be better (lots of arrows pointing into the beyond with no reference markers to pick up the trail). Bus service can take a while because BW shares many of its bus routes with some combination of the Swan, Dolphin, Yacht and Beach Club resorts. And, unlike many other Disney resorts that are organized around some sort of central service node, all of BW's shops and restaurants and most of its amenities are located along the boardwalk and not really in the hotel itself, which can make a run for convenience items more of a trek than you might anticipate. Still, those complaints aside, we would very much recommend this hotel for a future stay at WDW. It is very comfortable, attractive and well located and the service is very, very good. While my wife tells me we need to experience other resorts at WDW, I know I would be very happy returning to the BW time and again on our future trips!

Reviews.Title: “Disney Boardwalk - Telling it like it is”
Reviews.Author: Following24
Reviews.Content: Just got home from a 3 night stay at The Boardwalk Inn. While I would consider the resort very nice, I was a little disappointed with the lack of dining options in the morning hours. Several of the establishments did not open for business until later in the afternoon. To me, if you truly want the full Disney experience, your better off staying at The Contemporary or The Polynesian. Having the monorail is worth it weight in gold. Well let's get back to the Boardwalk. The rooms are average at best. Nothing fancy, but they are clean. I have to admit, the beds are just about the most comfortable that I've ever slept in. They are firm, but also soft and plush. Every morning I awoke well rested. The staff in all areas of the resort were very friendly as well as housekeeping. The grounds are well kept. I guess overall I'm spoiled with the convienence of the monorail when I have stayed at The Contemporary. Waiting for a bus to shuttle you around the park and make several stops was not that pleasurable. The resort has two pools, one is for everyone and one is just for adults. The adult pool has no charisma what so ever.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: maengleman
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Wilderness Lodge, but decided to try a different hotel. Upon check in we were told we were "upgraded". The room was at the end of the hall and looked like they removed some of the furniture. The one chair in the room was stained and room looked worn. The bellman called down to request a different room for us, when we returned we were given another "upgraded room", this time with handicapped bathroom and torn wallpaper, table with uneven chair legs. We were moved to a third room, which was acceptable, had all of the furniture. The lights didn't always work, and the ceiling fan was broken. The best I can say is location is the only reason to stay here. As for us, the Wilderness Lodge is a much better choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: emjvw
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5-night stay at the Boardwalk Inn. We typically stay at the Grand Floridian, but this time I chose the Boardwalk because of the location--walk to Epcot, a quick boat ride (or long walk) to MGM Studios and a central location to Magic Kingdom, Animal Kingdom and Downtown Disney. Our room was clean and had everything we needed--empty fridge for our water, plenty of towels and a nice view of the Eiffel Tower at Epcot. The bathroom did smell a bit musty, however the shower curtain was impeccably clean. I wouldn't say the rooms are much different, good or bad, from any other deluxe resort on Disney property. When we arrived, a light was out over our vanity. I called down before we left for dinner and the bulb was changed by the time we got back. We enjoyed the activities on the boardwalk itself, especially the piano man on wheels! It was nice to sit at one of the tables in the evening people watching and soaking up the atmosphere. The only downside to this resort is the Disney bus system. The bus for the Boardwalk also goes to the Swan, Dolphin, Yacht Club and Beach Club to pick up passengers. This can make for a long trip, especially to and from Downtown Disney. I believe that a resort where guests are paying $300 and up per night should have its own bus. Or, at the very least, there should only be 2 resorts sharing.

Reviews.Title: “What A Magical Place!”
Reviews.Author: jaimelemer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the BWI when we were at Disney for my cousin's wedding. It was such a charming hotel! Room: The rooms were very spacious for a hotel, and we had a fantastic "Epcot View" with Spaceship Earth and Paris's Eiffel Tower in clear view. We also could see the EPCOT fireworks every night, and even hear the music! It was so magical! The fridge had plenty of space for water and baby food (my daughter was 7 months old at the time). The coffee maker is small but made 4 cups of coffee, which was all we needed. Room Service: Yes, it was expensive, but it was SO good and the portions were good-sized. We ordered breakfast twice, and it was fantastic each time! Location: Cannot beat it. Walk to MGM, Walk to EPCOT, Walk through EPCOT to monorail to Magic Kingdom. Cannot beat it with a stick! :) Pool: So much fun! It had a neat theme, and I loved the little elephant showers! I cannot say I had a single complaint about this hotel. The beds were comfortable, the theme was charming, and the room size was comparable to most of the other deluxe resorts on property. The added benefit is that we could ship all of our Disney purchases right to the resort. Loved it! While it may not have the over-the-top theming of the other Deluxe resorts, the location is top notch and the theme here is charming and wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great location average accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Windwardmom
Reviews.Content: Of course, one expects Disney world to be pricey, and it doesn't disappoint. I do not think it is necessary to spend $1000. plus per night for a family of four to be comfortable in clean and quaint accomodations. The views are lovely, the common areas evoke the appropriate nostalgia, the rooms are tiny. Check in was efficient, but we did have to call twice and wait 20 minutes for our bags. Similarly, requests for towels and shampoo required more than one polite phone call. Access to Epcot and MGM is an easy walk, however, and I suppose that is why we have stayed here more than once. I did find that our visit of 2 years ago to the nearby Dolphin hotel to be a far better value for the money. If space is at all important to you, I would give it a try. The Disney Express bus ride to the airport was a huge help, as was the ability to get boarding passes for our flight right at the front desk. Lastly, every staff member we encountered was polite and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Disney Resort/Trip Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Tizbit
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Walt Disney World Boardwalk over MLK weekend. We had a great time at the Walt Disney World resort, but Boardwalk Inn was the low point of our trip. I have been to Walt Disney World many, many times. I have stayed in the Caribbean Beach Resort, Coronado Springs, Contemporary Resort, All Star, Pop Century, Port Orleans, Yacht Club, Wilderness Lodge, and Shades of Green. The Boardwalk Inn was the nastiest, worst appointed resort I have ever stayed in on Disney property and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. I had far superior experiences at their value resort than at this $300 a night resort. The theme is a cool idea, and the location is great, and that is what you are paying for. The rooms are small, and ours had a terrible moth ball kind of smell. Our lights flickered, and we had no hot water. The service of housekeeping was the worst I have ever seen. From now on I will be staying next door, at the Swan and Dolphin Hotels. I have had great experiences there, and I can still enjoy the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Not Delux”
Reviews.Author: Capt_T0ny
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here after staying at the Beach Club and Port Orleans Resorts in previous years. What a mistake. This is not a delux resort; the room smelled musty (even on the third floor) and was dark. Our bathroom walls had a yellow stain on them-as if a little boy "missed". We had to ask for washclothes, our keys didn't work to open our room ( after a day, one and only one would work on occasion) and we could not charge on them at the park until our second day. On a better note, our children loved the pool (great staff at the bar and for kids activities) and we enjoyed saving time getting food on the boardwalk. The transportation to the parks was excellent as well as the location, but we won't stay here again unless they renovate or lower the $300/night price tag. This resort is not in the same class as The Beach Club and very far from our favorite the Portifino Bay Hotel at Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location Available!”
Reviews.Author: DallasTraveler06
Reviews.Content: We have been to Disney World probably a dozen times - we go once or twice a year. We ALWAYS stay in a Disney property because of the great bussing system and the little "perks" you get. We never have been able to convince ourselves to spend the $300+ per night just based on the location, but this time we took the plunge! Our expectation, based on reading the reviews, is that we needed to keep reminding ourselves that we were paying what we were paying for the location, not for a $300 room and the best service. I think that expectation was met. We arrived very late - 1am - due to travel delays. Like the previous reviewer, the checkin clerk was not at all friendly. He was very robotic and didn't make us feel welcome. This is definitely a departure from all of our experiences in the past. Almost always, regardless of time of day, the Cast Member makes you feel welcome upon checkin. But not this time. We had called in to request a king-size bed 5 days prior (the soonest you can do so at this resort), and of course, by the time of our arrival, they did not have any more. The clerk, of course, didn't mention this, so we were disappointed when we finally got ourselves into our room and there were two queen-sized beds. We called back to the front desk and arranged to transfer to another room the next day. This isn't the biggest problem on the planet, and it wasn't unexpected. This is one of the complaints we have about these very expensive Disney resorts - at most of them, you cannot guarantee yourself a king-size bed. We understand that Disney does not have enough king-sized beds to meet demand. However, at the moderate resorts, you simply pay a premium to guarantee that room type, and therefore there is no let-down at the time of check-in. We told the Boardwalk staff that we HIGHLY preferred paying a small premium for the room we want. They wouldn't say for sure, but seemed to think that the Boardwalk would soon offer king-size beds at that premium price. That would be wonderful, so that we don't have to transfer rooms the next day to get the room we requested originally. When we did go to the front desk for the transfer the next day, the front desk didn't seem to know about it and we were worried that they weren't going to get it right. But after lots of tense moments, they did get it right. ROOM SERVICE: We had toast, coffee and "fruit yogurt" sent to our room the next morning. The concept is lovely, as this level of service is not available at Disney's moderate resorts, where we normally stay. However, the toast wasn't warm at all, and did not seem toasted. Instead of butter, we were given margarine. And the yogurt was "light" which means that it has aspartame in it, and we do not eat aspartame because of the health concerns of these chemical sugar substitutes. We are definitely picky eaters when it comes to wholesome foods, so we didn't eat the yogurt OR the margarine, and called in to the food service staff. They said that they ONLY have the aspartame yogurt available at the resort, but next time we could request butter instead of margarine. They did credit us for the yogurt, but our final bill for four pieces of bread and coffee was over $20. So that was the last time we did the room service. RESTAURANT OPTIONS: As many may know, the value and moderate resorts have a "mess hall" as we like to call it - a large kind of self-service cafeteria. It's not a fun experience as it is always crowded and stressful. But it is convenient, and we missed this convenience at the Boardwalk. For breakfast, you basically have to eat at Spoodles, which is a sit-down restaurant. We were always able to get in without a wait, but I doubt this is the case at other times in the year. The breakfast was good and the prices reasonable, and we will definitely return there in the future. It's just that you might need to plan ahead to make sure you get in. HOTEL BAR: The hotel bar here is just a small area in the main floor, but very delightful. It was never very crowded and had a very great selection of cocktails. LOCATION: This was absolutely the best feature of the resort. You can just walk down the boardwalk and into the "back door" of Epcot. This convenience is SO GREAT. You can also do this from the Beach Club and Yacht Club resorts, and we hadn't realized this before, for some reason. The ability to walk to Epcot, and boat to MGM (or walk) was the best. The Disney bussing system is awesome, but the only thing better is not even needing to use it for two of the parks. You still need to ride the buses to the Magic Kingdom and Animal Kingdom, but the location of this hotel is absolutely wonderful. We had an overall good experience and will stay here again in the future, but the reason that it gets a 3 rating from me is that they need to step up the customer service at the front desk and pay attention to the foods they offer. I think that as people are becoming more and more aware of the dangers of chemically created foods such as sugar substitutes and margarine, they need to consider offering more wholesome options. My husband and I feel that we can't be the only ones who won't eat aspartame and don't want margarine. At $350 per night, don't we deserve butter, not margarine? :)

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay at Boardwalk Inn”
Reviews.Author: DollOhio
Reviews.Content: My husband & I and our 19 year old son stayed at the Boardwalk Dec. 8 - 13. This was our first visit to Disney. Let me start with the Magical Express pickup at the airport. This was a great convenience, but if you haven't been there before, be advised that trying to find the Disney Welcome Center at the airport was ridiculous. When you go to the lower level you will walk and walk and walk with no signs to let you know you are going the right way. And it was rather deserted, so you think you're not in the right place. Eventually, we found it. They took our luggage to the hotel - no problems. Check in was quick, staff courteous. As a matter of fact, I had read previous posts that said ask for a free upgrade - you might get lucky. We paid for a standard view room - I asked the lady at the desk & she told me they were filled up but she would give us a couryard view room. The layout of the Boardwalk is kind of weird & we had trouble finding our first floor room. After going down one stairway and going up another, we eventually found our room. It wasn't one of their newer rooms, but it was not old and smelly, as some others posters have had. It had double sinks, 2 queen beds and a sofa. My only problem with it was that the french doors that opened to the outside were quite thin, and the only lock was so chintzy I believe anyone could have kicked them in or at the least broke the pane of glass and unlocked the doors. I was not at all comfortable with the room for that reason, but when I called the desk they said they only had one room left in a very inconvenient locations far from the elevators. We stayed put. It was very quiet, overlooking the pool, which wasn't being used much considering the temps! As it turned out, the room was in a great location to the boardwalk & Epcot. Only you had to walk across the courtyard, up more stairs into the hotel lobby and then down stairs to get access to the boardwalk. There was no way to go directly from the room to the boardwalk. In retrospect, I think this was good considering the vulnerability of the room! Christmas decorations were up everywhere & it was just gorgeous! Not supposed to have been a peak time, but it was still quite crowded. Not much in the way of places to eat/drink in the hotel, but there are places on the boardwalk. The bakery & Spoodles is very good. We walked to Epcot, boated to MGM & bussed to M.K. Also took the monorail to M.K. - it's quite a walk to get to the monorail at the back of Epcot, but worth the ride. This is a GREAT week to go! Highly recommend going to the Candlelight Processional. Every restaurant we ate at was absolutely wonderful. MAKE RESERVATIONS BEFORE YOU GO! If you don't, you won't get in to the best places. Our favorite was Alfredo di Roma in Epcot (Italy). Food was fantastic and waiters (Hey, Davide!) delightful. They had an accordian player and the manager sings with him. They serenaded me at my table because my husband told them I'm Italian. So cool. Also, San Angel Inn in Mexico (try to get a table next to the Rio Tempo), Le Cellier in Canada, Coral Reef in Mexico - all had great food. Definitely go to the Prime Time Cafe at MGM - it's a hoot and the food is just like your mom made (really good & lots of it). To sum it up, I recommend the Boardwalk highly. Not sure it qualifies as a "deluxe" in my book, but I wanted a queen size bed so we had to go "deluxe". If we go again I would try the Beach Club across the lagoon. We walked over and looked around inside and it is very nice and has it's own little "convenience" store/bakery/souvenir shop. AND a great pool. Also, if you don't want to be around a bunch of noisy little kids, staying there in the Epcot vicinity is the place. Magic Kingdom was a nightmare of strollers and mobility scooters (watch out, they'll run you over if you get in their way!). One last thing - buy your tickets with the meal plan!! Food is very expensive & most everyplace is on the plan. We never paid for anything while there except alcohol. You had so much food you didn't need snacks in between meals. We even threw out some desserts because we were too full to eat them even later.

Reviews.Title: “Poor value and horrible experience with housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Courtesy_Flush
Reviews.Content: The Boardwalk was my second stay on Disney property in Orlando. Previously, we had been at Coronado Springs and really enjoyed it. We tried the Boardwalk since we were able to get an incredible deal ($160/night), and the location is just about perfect. Besides the great location, I loved the theme of the hotel and found the beds to be very comfortable. However, the room was on the first floor, and it felt and smelled like we were in an old basement. The room definetely showed its age. The lights kept flickering, and the hot water only appeared for one of the three showers taken that morning. What totally ruined our experience was the rude treatment we received by the housekeeping manager, Dan. I cannot believe how unprofessional and unaccomadating this individual was. We asked for a later check out, and he was so condescending and threatening to my friend. I will never stay here again. For $300/night, you could easily get a suite with a kitchenette at one of the non-Disney hotels.

Reviews.Title: “below expectations”
Reviews.Author: theshoemaker
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at Disney's Board Walk. location wise it's quite convenient as epcot is within a walking distance, and other connection are good too. (though this probably applies to most disney resorts) first noticeable thing was that the hotel had seemed to age a bit since our last visit several years ago. This time our room was very dull, as in plain looking and shabby, which also goes for the hallways. the exterior of the hotel is great and nicely built. biggest dissapointment was in the valet service which was a total chaos. when leaving, we had to wait 25 minutes for our luggage which we had stored earlier and another 5-10 minutes for our car, totaling at over half an hour. unacceptable. apart from the valet, the service was good, though. overall our stay was ok and there were no major problems, but I see no reason in staying there the next time as there are several hotels that are in much better shape.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Marriott/Hilton -quality”
Reviews.Author: Rane
Reviews.Content: This is not a DeLuxe hotel, rather average first class. Everything is ok but nothing luxury inside. Rooms are dated. Very basic bathroom with small towels, basic toilettery. Inkeepers Club is far too small. Had to wait for a table every visit. Staff at the club is exellent. Location is exellent.

Reviews.Title: “Home Sweet Home”
Reviews.Author: SFBank
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Boardwalk Inn Nov 26th-Dec 4th. It was our third stay and our second stay at the Innkeepers Club. As said in another review, we were treated like royalty. All of the Castmemebers at the Innkeeps Club are wonderful. We had a deluxe room with a Boardwalk view which can't be beat. We love the ambience of the Boardwalk at night. The location can't be beat. We walked to EPCOT and boated to MGM. The buses were always effecient. The rooms are wonderful. I would recommend this resort to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Best Disney Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PEIGUY1
Reviews.Content: My family and I (from Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island ,Canada) stayed at the Boardwalk in the INNKEEPERS CLUB section from Oct 14 -22. We where treated like royalty by the conceriege staff! I want to make a special mention of Jackie who in my opinion is the best Disney Castmember I have ever dealt with in all the years I have gone to Disney World. Jackie's kindness and caring manner will always be remebered by my family!!!! Our room was super - clean, great shape and so quiet. Innkeepers Club food offerings were tasty and very plentiful. My family had a great time and look forward to returning soon!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: gotraveller
Reviews.Content: Visiting Orlando and have tight pockets..... this place is recommended. No second thoughts. I travelled from Tampa (was on business trip) and met my family here. Good place to save money for those visits to Disney. Donot be bothered with staff or room service or decor ...... who wnats to stay and write a book on that..... come to visit Orlando .... get out of that room.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Ains'Mum
Reviews.Content: Since we usually stay at Disney's Grand Floridian, I thought an Epcot Boardwalk Resort would be a nice change of pace. The hotel ambience is really quaint and cute (old seaside theme), but the service is equivalent to a Days Inn or other motel, and the rooms were damp and frankly, pretty gross. I would've switched rooms as soon as I noticed the brown substance splattered all over the toilet rim, but since the bellman had already dumped all our bags in the room and left (we got lost trying to find it based on the front desk person's directions of: "Just turn right down there") I just sucked it up, grabbed some Purell wipes and wiped it down myself. Sorry, but for $300 a night, I shouldn't have to clean some stranger's diarrhea of the toilet. Anyway, the first morning we were there, my 60-year-old mother and I decided to take a walk on the Boardwalk. We noticed it was wet from being hosed off and extremely slippery. We discovered shortly thereafter that there is grease or motor oil from the vendors apparently, and they spray it down in the morning creating one of the most dangerous situations I can imagine. Needless to say, even being careful, my mom took a horrible fall. Luckily she didn't break a hip! I doubt she was the first person to do this, and I'm willing to bet Disney is going to open themselves up to liability if they don't rectify the situation. We're not litigious, and settled for their measly offer to reimburse my mom for her ruined pants (they were covered from top to bottom with motor oil/grease and even housekeeping could not get the stains out). Of course this "offer" came after several compaints to three different managers and about four phone calls. The $60 barely paid for my breakfast and wasn't even worth my time. What I really wanted was for my mother to enjoy Epcot without limping. The bottom line is that the service here is terrible. I called down to preorder (room service) breakfast for my daughter, and they refused. Said I needed to complete the breakfast order card and hang it on my door, which wouldn't have been a problem had the housekeeping staff actually left me one. The rooms are damp, smelly, and in need of updating and cleaning. There is rust underneath this rather protruding marble shelf in the bathtub my 2-year-old almost hit her head on a million times while she was taking a bath. I just returned home and can't wait to shower off. I give this hotel a star for it's cute decor and that's about it..

Reviews.Title: “Better then expected”
Reviews.Author: GaterGal
Reviews.Content: At first I was a little weary becuase of some of the comments below about the pool and the room but once I arrived I was more at ease. It's a very beautiful hotel and the room is very large. The set up of the bathroom was perfect - sink & mirror seperate from the toilet and shower. This made it fairly easy to share the room with three other adults. We got very lucky because we were upgraded into the concierge floor so although we had a REALLY far walk to the room, it was worth it for the free wine, beer, snacks, breakfast, coffee, water ect.. Sure saved a lot of time and money knowing we had access to that! One note is the concierge staff wasn't as friendly as you would expect them to be. They almost seemed annoyed when asked a question. The hotel is in a great location - walkable to epcot and MGM, the ferry to both is right out the back door and the bus to Disney and Animal kingdom is about a 1/2 hour ride. Note: get off at Swan and walk back to the hotel - it's quicker! I had sent one of my shirts into the dry cleaner and somehow it became seperated (it was a shell with a tank & sheer cover attached). All I got back was the sheer cover and I was not happy. I got no where with the maid service on duty that night. Unfortunately I didn't discover this until the night before I was supposed to leave. I was very very upset and as I was walking down to the front desk to talk to demand to speak with the hotel manager, a food service person tried to help me. God bless this young man - he was an angel. He didn't leave me until I was calmed down. Anyway.. he put me in touch with the head of housekeeping and the very next day i met with her and she searched everywhere for my shirt - couldn't find it so reimbursed me for the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Boardwalk Inn -Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Emme2
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a July trip to Disneyworld and stayed at the Boardwalk Inn. We have previousley stayed at Old Key West, Wilderness Loge and 2x at Port Orleans Riverside. The Boardwalk Inn cannot be beat for its location. We had 2 connecting rooms on the fifth floor 5291 & 5293. Our balconies looked out over the entrance to the Boardwalk and in the distance you could see Tower of Terror. The rooms were spacious and clean, the beds extremely comfy. The only downfall was that they were located near the elevators and you heard the motors of the elevators all night. We were a bit disappointed in the size of the main pool and it seemed to need a little TLC -- as compared to the other resorts. The quiet pool was perfect and never crowded. The parks on the other hand were extremely crowded and the extra park hours at night made them seem more crowded -- just remember the extra park hous are for everyone staying on Disney property ..and there are alot of people! We decided that the night there was EPH at Magic Kingdon we would go to MGM becasue everyone on Disney property would be at MK - this strategy actually worked great! One restuarant that we would highly recommend is Shula's Steakhouse in the Disney Dolphin. Themed after the Miami Dolphins "perfect season" this was our family's "special night" out dinner. It is extremely pricey but we felt it was worth every $. We spend one afternoon just walking from the Boardwalk around the lake to the Beach Club, Yacht Bluc, Disney Dolphin and Disney Swan. It was a great way to beat the crowds and gave us a chance to see what the other resorts looked like. All in all we would certainly recommend the Boardwalk for location, cleanliness and variety of restuarants available.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Boardwalk!!!”
Reviews.Author: irunnoft
Reviews.Content: At first I was hesistant - especially after some of the reviews I've read on this website. However, a discounted rate for Florida residents popped up on the Disney website and we switched our vacation booking from the Wilderness Lodge to the Boardwalk Inn. I wasn't too sure about this move as I was already looking forward to the Wilderness. I'd already done my restaurant research for the Wilderness, traveling around there, and all the goodies that went with that resort. However, at a savings of over a thousand dollars and to move to a resort that would be considered an upgrade, I had to make the switch. As soon as we were dropped off at the resort by the Magical Express bus, all my worries and concerns disappeared. The outside of the resort is nothing spectacular, but when you walk into the lobby, you are greeted by a massive chandalier comprised of cherubs, mythical seahorses and pearls. It almost looks like a huge gold carousel, but it isn't. To say it is impressive is an understatement and you will most definitely crane your neck upward to take in the entire expanse of this marvel. Everything in the lobby makes you feel as though you stepped back into time to say Coney Island in the early 1900's. The furniture and appointments are sublime yet gorgeous. Not too ostentatious, but definitely ornate. I loved it! The staff were all very courteous and quite friendly. We arrived at the resort at about 11:00 am and one of the two rooms we'd reserved was ready, so we unloaded our carry on bags into that room and walked over to Epcot. Before I get into the proximity of this resort to the parks, let me just touch on the rooms. Our room was very tasteful and quite lovely. Again, I loved it. The theme of turn of the century luxury continues into the guest rooms with soft pastels contrasted against dark cherry furniture. Quite nice. There was a double sink w/ a marble countertop. The bathrooms were tiled as was the shower. The showerhead had about seven different types of spray (the one that really pounds you actually feels great after a looooong day in the Orlando heat!). The carpeting was rather thin and not super comfy, but it was clean, neat and in good condition. The air conditioner was very quiet and worked like a charm! The room was very comfortable and quite spacious, also. This resort also had the most comfortable beds I've slept on yet in a Disney resort. I don't know what kind of mattress it was, but it was absolutely heavenly. My wife also commented on what an absolutely wonderful bed that resort had. Prior to this, we've stayed at the Coronado Springs resort, which is my favorite of the moderate resorts. Our room also had a nice patio area with two chairs and a small glass table. We were on the first floor with a standard view room that overlooked a nice, quiet area between our wing and another wing. There were several trees and the area was well landscaped. We didn't have a view of a parking lot or anything objectionable at all! You can't beat this resort for convenience to Epcot. It is just a five minute walk down the boardwalk and then you come to a gate that lets you into Epcot in the World Showcase portion right near France. This is perfect for retreating back to your resort after catching Illuminations fireworks show during the evening. You don't have to fight the press for the front gate of the park. So, as far as Epcot is concerned, you can't beat this resort for convenience. You can also walk into MGM Studios from this resort, but it is a much longer, arduous walk (especially in Summer). I'm estimating it would be about a thirty minute walk to get from Boardwalk to MGM. However, there is a ferry boat that runs from the dock at the Boardwalk to MGM. The ferries run about every twenty minutes or so and the ride from Boardwalk to MGM takes about twenty minutes. Unless you want to work off some pounds, take the ferry, enjoy the ride and the AC! The back of the ferry boat is actually nice to ride on in the evenings! There is also a ferry that runs to Epcot from the Boardwalk, also. Here is the basic circuit that the ferries ran on while we were there. The ferry that picked us up to take us to MGM went from our resort to the Yacht Club/Beach Club resort (both resorts share one common dock) and then to the Dolphin/Swan (again, both resorts share one common dock) and then to MGM. For the return trip, the boat left MGM and went to Dolphin/Swan, then to Yacht Club/Beach Club and then to Boardwalk. If we'd stayed on that boat, the next stop would have been Epcot. So, if you catch the ferry from the Boardwalk dock to Epcot, there are no stops between the resort and that park. All that being said, I prefered the ferry to MGM over a bus ride to MGM. Animal Kingdom seemed to be the farthest bus ride away. There is only one central bus stop at the front of the Boardwalk and the buses also stop at the Dolphin, the Swan, the Yacht Club and the Beach Club. HOWEVER, and I felt this was a plus, every bus stopped at the Boardwalk FIRST. So, if you were leaving to go to the Magic Kingdom or to Animal Kingdom, Boardwalk resort guests were the first ones on to relatively empty buses. As the bus went on down the line to the other resorts, those guests found it rather difficult in the early mornings to get seats on the buses as they were generally arriving already close to full. The only downside to this was that the Boardwalk was always last on the list for the drop off on the return rides back from said theme parks. That wasn't a big problem for me because I'd rather have first opportunity to load the bus than last! The ride to the Animal Kingdom and Magic Kingdom wasn't too bad. It didn't really take any longer than it seemed to take when we took buses from Coronado Springs. Overall, I'd have to give this resort an excellent rating with regards to ease of transportation to and from the parks - especially the MGM Studios and Epcot theme parks. Now onto the resort itself. The Boardwalk is a neat resort! There's a lot to do at this resort and things really start to come alive out on the boardwalk at about five to six o'clock at night. The sun is beginning to wane, the temperature is somewhat better and it actually gets downright pleasant out there! There were a myriad of entertainers who were extremely lively and jovial! Everybody I saw looked like they loved their cast member position! There's lots to do and see on the boardwalk! From carnival games, to a traveling bicycle/piano player, magicians, jugglers - not to mention some of the carny games! You can rent a bike to pedal around the resort or even a boat to zip across the lake. Fun! Of course, the real attraction for the kids is the pool with the Keister Coaster. This is a 200' water slide made to look like an old wooden roller coaster. The slide dumps out of the mouth of a clown (scary!), but the kids LOVE this thing! My son went down this slide 45 times in a row if he went down it once. There's a nice poolside bar for adult beverages, but it also serves non-alcoholic drinks. The only downside to the pool was that there was no real food service near it. If you wanted, say, a burger, you had to go onto the boardwalk itself. No biggie, though! I didn't go to the pool to eat - I went to slide screaming out of a clown's mouth! We were there in mid/late July and the pool was busy but not over crowded. We had no problems finds chairs, tables, etc. There were also plenty of towels available poolside. The pool gets an excellent review from me! This pool does close rather early, though. It closed at 8:00pm, which I thought was early especially considering it was still light out until past 9:00, however there is a quiet pool that stays open until midnight. This resort had a game room in that it had a room (small) and there were about five games in it. It was really not very good, but it had some games my son loved. It had Jurassic Park III which involved shooting dinosaurs (right up an 8 yr. old boy's alley), Mario Kart and some Fast and Furious game. The games run on cards that you swipe. The cards are dispensed from a machine and you can always add money/credits to your card at any time. The good thing is that these cards work on any games in any resort. I took my son over to the Contemporary Resorts BIG game room and he played the same three games he played at Boardwalk! Go figure! There's much more fun, family oriented stuff to do than sit in a gameroom anyhow. Think Surrey Bike!!! For food, the Boardwalk is tops! Ok, so you've got the ESPN club on one side and that's a GREAT place to get wings, burgers, and similar fare. The atmosphere is awesome if you're a sports fan and there's always something goin on at the club. Also, if you're a guy, you have to check out the bathroom. I know, sounds weird, but hear me out here. Every stall had a flat panel tv hanging over it from the ceiling. There are also flat panel tv's by the sink. You can't miss a play even if you have to run to the restroom! How cool is that!! Can't say about what's in the ladies room, but I'd guess it was similarly equipped (maybe it had the all Desperate Housewives station running in there!!!). Had a great burger and fries at the ESPN Club and it was very reasonable. We never made it into Spoodles, but the food always smelled marvelous as we passed by the restaurant. The menu also looked yummy!!! Well..... not the menu itself, but all the food listed on it. However, Spoodles did have a walk up pizza window that was the bomb! One night we got back to the resort from the Magic Kingdom and my son said, "Dad, I'm hungry!" I was too - go figure! I took a quick jaunt out to the Spoodles walk up window and ordered two slices of piping hot pizza and some cold root beer! In less than five minutes, I was back in the room with the food and we had a little pizza party! The pizza is goooood, too. It isn't the same stuff you can get from the parks. This is REAL pizza! Lots of gooey, drippy, hot cheese and the sauce had just the right amount of spice to it. Magnifico!!! You can order pizza by the slice or by the whole pie there right up until 11:45 pm! The window closes at midnight. The real treat for dining is definitely the Flying Fish Cafe. I had a dinner of fresh scallops that was to die for. The Flying Fish recently won Best Seafood Restauarant in Orlando for 2006! Quite a feather in the cap of the chefs! The food is excellent and it is worth planning one night to dine there. The scallops are outstanding. The steak is also highly recommended. The food is very fresh and prepared to order. It was the most expensive meal from the trip, but also well worth it! You won't be disappointed if you dine here. As far as noise was concerned, my room was not overlooking the boardwalk, so it wasn't noisy. We did have some drunk people that came down the hallway making quite a bit of racket at about 2:00am one night, but that wasn't the resort's fault. They must've been coming from Pleasure Island or somewhere, but they were rude people who weren't considerate of other guests. You can find that in any resort. I was able to hear them probably more than I would've heard them in the Coronado, but that's due to the encloses hallways (whereas the Coronado has open air walkways outside the doors). All in all, I'm glad we didn't stay at the Wilderness, although I'd love to stay there and at the Animal Kingdom. However, the Boardwalk has just wowed my family with it's numerous amenities and conveniences. I'm afraid it has spoiled us for moderate resorts from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Quite Nice - Just make sure you have a car during your stay.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying in Disney's Boardwalk Inn for three nights over Memorial Day weekend. After booking a Garden Suite based on last minute availability, I envisioned the layout being similar to a normal two room suite you would find at a high-end hotel chain. Well, this is Disney, so I should have expected something different (but good!). A Garden Suite (more acurately referred to as a Garden Cottage at the Inn), is actually like a really nicely appointed two floor loft apartment (with a beautiful fenced in garden outside). You enter the room from the outside through glass french doors. Once inside, the first floor has a large sitting room, a wet bar area with fridge and microwave, and a 1/2 bath. After you walk up a nice staircase, the second floor loft area has a king size bed, and a bath area with large whirlpool, double marble vanity, and a spacious marble shower. My room was immaculately clean, and housekeeping did a great job keeping up with cleaning and turn-down service (loved the taffy!). There's definitely tons of space in a Garden Suite, and it's the perfect room for those looking for some privacy and quiet away from the rest of the often-times busy hotel. Garden Suites are conveniently located across from the quiet pool. They also allow you access to the 4th floor Innkeepers Club area, which has food presentations during the day/evening, dessert and cordial offerings at night, and anything you might need from the Innkeepers-specific concierge (reservations, questions etc). The only negatives for the room were shower noise from one of the two rooms above, and some room-service plates weren't taken away overnight after I called to have them removed. As far as the Boardwalk Inn itself, well, it's pretty much the perfect on-site Deluxe Disney resort. It has the best location (lots of restaurants and things to do right outside), it's gorgeous and classy, and it has some of the 'newest' (10 years old) Deluxe accomodations in Disney (aside from the newly opened Saratoga Springs resort). While Memorial Day weekend is a bad time to visit Disney World (extremely crowded), the staff at the Boardwalk Inn made my stay extremely pleasant. They went out of their way to help me when needed, and made my trip a memorable one. Traveler's Tips: If you can rent a car while at Disney World, do so. Disney's Magical Express works fine, but a bus is a bus. Plan on it taking an hour or so door to door each way, depending on when you get on the bus, what stop your hotel is, and if your departing terminal is A or B on the way back. Additionally, while the Boardwalk Inn is wonderfully located (next to Epcot and MGM), it is close to four other Epcot resorts who all share the same bus route. My bus ride back from Animal Kingdom was an hour-long nightmare that consisted of a long wait at the park, wheelchair loadings/unloadings, too many people, and too many stops. A car will get you to to many more places, much more easily, including: Downtown Disney, Fort Wilderness, the two Waterparks, and all the great restuarants located in other hotels, like Artist Point in the Wilderness Lodge. As others have said, a regular room at a deluxe Disney property is nothing more than a typical Marriott or Hilton room (but at a MUCH higher cost). Upgrade to a suite if you can - they're WAY more than twice the size and value of a regular room, and sometimes not more than twice the price. Check for availability - it's definitely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Not the magic we were hoping for....”
Reviews.Author: clarkefam
Reviews.Content: We were to check in the Boardwalk Inn for the last 2 days of June for the long holiday weekend. We have never been to Disney before despiting living in Florida and were very much looking foward to it. When making reservations we picked the Boardwalk Inn as the representative on the phone stated it had the wireless internet we required for business in the rooms and was one of the luxury resorts for a Florida resident special. The outside of the hotel is pretty and I thought the lobby was beautiful. We were pleased that when we arrived early that we could check in early and the valet staff was friendly. However, the friendliness stopped there. The hotel staff was very "vanilla" with no magic at all. A lifeless woman handed out cupcakes and a man was making balloon animals, but clearly was either tired or not in love with his job. Just not what we expected. We were guaranteed a king bed and nonsmoking room for medical reasons. We were stunned at out room, the beds were low standard hotel type, we had double beds instead of the king, the carpet was worn, the wallpaper was worn. Overall it was not the magic we thought it would be. We decided to make the best but then when we could not get our computer to work we went back to the lobby and they stated that they did not have wireless in the hotel. Which even smaller hotels have it, and a park the caliber of Disney it was very surprising. I was told the wireless they have is in their conference room and lobby only. We asked about other resorts and suprisingly were told no other wireless internet at the hotels at Disney, which not only did the representative state that they had but their own website advertises it on the resort pages. They do not state it is in the lobby area only. They do over data ports, which is not what we were equipped for and the cord was less than 2 feet long and at a charge of 9.95 a day, also not mentioned at reservation time nor on their website. We told them this was very upsetting and instead of offering or finding a way to fix it she blandly stated she would credit our credit card and we could go elsewhere. We will never return to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SNMK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Boardwalk Inn for three nights in June. Overall, this is a nice hotel. We arrived early before our room was ready, but we were able to check in and get a telephone number to call to see when our room was ready. We had a room with two queen beds, and we found the room to be quite spacious and clean. The beds were very comfortable. I expected the pool to be larger, but it was fine. The location just cannot be beat - right on the boardwalk and within easy walking distance to the other Epcot resorts or Epcot itself.

Reviews.Title: “It works”
Reviews.Author: denniso482
Reviews.Content: There are some many things I would like to add but it would take too much time. I think by going to a Disney resort I made some of my own mistakes. I should have mentally prepared myself for the Disney life. I will say the first 2 hours at this hotel were a joke. We took the magical express in from MCO. It was a 20 minute wait which was not so bad. We got to the hotel and there were no lines for check in. I started checking in and based on other reviews I started asking the all important questions. How far are we from the elevator and do we have a board walk view? I was told we do not have a BW view but we have a pool view and we are not close to the elevators. The lady gave me a look that I only now remember. I wish she would have told me we were the furtherest room from the BW and the elevators. We walked to the room, it was about 300 yards from the lobby. They should offer gold cart service. We opened the door and a scent of smoke came out. The room was dirty and the people staying in it before us were smokers. The drapes were browninh yellow. I could not believe they were still hanging. We opened the door to see our pool view and saw the Swan hotel. Acually a construction site, it was impossible to see a pool. I called the front desk to get a new room and was told they could not move us for 4 days. At $450 per night that was not going to be the case. I was transfered over to the hotel manager. I spoke with him for some time before I told him I was coming to the lobby. We talked about how they advertise the web site and this room is not a fair representation of their site. He then decidied to come to my room to talk to me. I think he was worried that I was going to make a sceen in the lobby. (he was right) He came to my room and told me that he could put me in a normal room for $20 less per night with a BW view. I told him no. He really did not want to work with us at all. He also told me he has never seen the BW website @ disney(--)??? He finally said I could speak with the property manager as his arguements were lame and without merit. I spent no less than 45 seconds with the property manager. He said give me 10 minutes. He came out and explained he was going to bump a member to another room and give it to us. He said I must inspect it first to make sure we like it. I was blown away by how much nicer, cleaner this unit was. Now I see why there are so many one stars vs. 5 stars for this hotel. The first room we were in was a $175 a night room and the second was worth what we paid. That is why I gave this place 3 stars. To be honest, if we were placed in this room at first and did not have a 2 hour arguement with the staff I would have given them a 4 star rating. The location of this hotel is great, the boats come every 5 minutes for Epcot and MGM. The bus rides wait time can be 1 to 30 minutes. There are a lot of stops so be patient and prepared to wait. The fish resturant is unreal at the BW. The entertainment is great as well. The kids loved it and this really all that matters on a Disney trip. Be ready to spend money, wait in line and do not let them push you around any you will survive.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat but, otherwise, the Boardwalk Inn was disappointing. The room was dark and not well maintained. It was hard to sleep late because the drapes didn't block the morning light. We were near one of the "quiet" pools, which was quite noisy w/ screaming children. Our three requests for help to subdue the children at the pool were ignored. We were in a "garden suite," but the garden looked like an atomic bomb test site (gardens on either side of us were nice, 'though). We sat outside on our patio often, but the chairs were standard-issue molded plastic--very uncomfortable. The living room television was SMALL. And we encountered a cock roach in the living room while we were packing to leave. The linens (towels & sheets) were cheap and thread-bare. On the plus side - the bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Love It!!!”
Reviews.Author: skatermom1
Reviews.Content: We are DVC members and have stayed at all the DVC properties at WDW. Boardwalk, by far, is our favorite. The beds are the most comfortable hotel beds we have ever slept in. The rooms are clean, the staff is courteous and helpful, and it's just a wonderful resort. After staying at other DVC resorts and other Disney resorts (Caribbean Beach, Port Orleans & Animal Kingdom) I would NEVER stay anywhere else on points (if paying cash we would stay at Animal Kingdom Lodge - it's wonderful). The only complaint we have is there is no food court like they have at many of the other resorts. The places on the Boardwalk are on the pricey side and our kids are picky eaters so there isn't much there at BW to please them. We love the quiet pool and the Keister Coaster (water slide). It's a very short walk to EPCOT which is nice because you're not fighting large crowds to leave at the end of the night - walk out the back entrance and have a leisurely stroll back to the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who asks. It can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Boardwalk is my second home!”
Reviews.Author: DisGirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Boardwalk Inn for the second time this past February. I must say I find, like other reviewers, that the location can't be beat. We love to eat in the International Showcase pavillions in Epcot, which makes this resort ideal.(a nice walk to and from)The atmosphere is tranquil yet whimsical and the decor fits perfectly with the theme. The Boardwalk itself is an entertainment venue and Jellyrolls, with its dueling pianos should not be missed. Although the resorts restuarants are located outside the hotel itself, some people are dissapointed in this respect, the food @ Spoodles and Flying Fish is great! The room is well appointed and we were impressed with the mousekeepers and were surprised with hand towel "creations" every night. Disney is a truly magical place and this resort is Disney magic for those who want a place they can relax but still know that they are in Disney! We will return to the Boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Access to Parks”
Reviews.Author: OtusAsio
Reviews.Content: Just another "two thumbs way up" for the Boardwalk Inn. This was our first stay in a deluxe Disney resort and the upgrade from moderate (Coronado Springs) is noticeable. We had no problems, loved everything and would make this our first choice for a WDW stay. As good as the Inn is, though, its location is the best feature, better than Yacht & Beach or Swan/Dolphin in my opinion since it is right on the Boardwalk. Also, for those who like to walk (and it was January, so cool enough), EPCOT is 5 minutes at most, MGM is about a mile, but a pleasant stroll and to avoid the bus to the Magic Kingdom, just walk through EPCOT and grab the monorail. The only Disney bus we needed was to the Animal Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Magic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the Disney Boardwalk Inn. It was lovely, clean and just all together perfect! The pool was fantastic and the extra blankets were clean and fluffy. We stayed in the Animal Kingdom Resort last year and loved that as well! I would stay at either hotel again but love to try new Disney Resorts each year, therefore, I hope to stay here again some time in the future. There is absolutely nothing to complain about! Just Perfect and full of Disney Magic!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are experience WDW people, w/2 children ages 10 and 8, and the one bedroom villa we had was wonderful. It was huge, we could really spread out, two balconies that allowe us to see the Illuminations fireworks and the Tower of Terror and the sky light up from Fantasmic. Service was great, pool was great, but we couldn't get over the size of the room. The sleeper couch was more comfortable than most hotel room beds, not some painful, springy thing. We brought an airbed that one child slept on, and STILL had plenty of room to move around while watching the tube during the evening. And the fun on the Boardwalk, the food right there, the proximity to MGM and Epcot...well it was just outstanding!!!! No doubt, we would stay here again. We had a room on the top floor that we loved. If you are not familiar with this area, the walk around the lake is only 3/4 of a mile and along the way is Beaches and Cream ice cream shop, ESPN, the Bakery (MMMMM!!), vendors, magicians, shops...you name it.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: doubleflyaway
Reviews.Content: We were married on the Boardwalk, so I'm obviously biased. However, the hotel really surprised me with just how nice it is. We've stayed in other WDW deluxe hotels, but this is our new favorite. We stayed in one of the garden suites and also in a standard room later in the trip. The staff is great, the hotel is beautiful, we enjoyed both the quiet pool and the main pool, and you simply cannot beat the location! So many restaurants, both right on the boardwalk and in the Epcot World Showcase.

Reviews.Title: “Total Luxury”
Reviews.Author: ILuv2Travel
