Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with my husband and 2 small children. What a lovely resort! The foyer is breathtaking and the rooms are very pretty and luxurious. The resort is immaculate. Try to get a view of the lake/boardwalk. Catching the boat to EPCOT was so handy. The kids loved the waterslide. We have very high standards and cannot fault this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - pleasant staff - good access - Disney pricey but worth it”
Reviews.Author: munchman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here early October for a conference with wife and two year old. Disney Magic Express bus / baggage service was great / convenient / easy. Check in a bit slow with a newer person / but manager stepped in and helped. Extremely friendly bellmen - in a good way. First room was courtyard facing the Boardwalk - OK - but you want the Garden View which is what we had for days 2 - 7. Garden View allows you to see the Epcot fireworks every night - which is a pleasant diversion if you are there with a 2 year old who can't stay out late. Disney wake up calls had the same characters each day - a bit of a bummer. Our cleaning staff had a lot of fun arranging my daughter's stuffed animals each day - and even made her an animal out of a towel!!!! Our room was close to the elevator - but still very quiet. Balcony on both rooms could fit two people in chairs. Good Sprint & Nextel service (4 of 5 bars in room) in case you care. You can walk to EPCOT in about 9 minutes at a slow pace, and it takes about 20 minutes to walk all the way around the lake. The Boardwalk is the last prior and first boat back to / from EPCOT. MGM is two stops and about 20 minutes on the boat. On the buses, you can go direct from here to Downtown Disney, but it is two stops and 20 minutes to Animal Kingdom. We walked through Epcot to the monorail for Magic Kingdom. Elephant pool is big and the slide has one Very Fast turn at the end, so you can't put a kid lowere than 4 through it. Lifeguards were a little too aggressive in safety for me, but no one else minded. The kiddie pool is small with room for maybe 6 kids comfy. The separate Quiet Pool in the Garden View area is nice for sunning with a hot tub, but deep so no kids play there. The play area does not have swings, but nice slides and climbing. Fitness area is comprehensive and relatively large for the size hotel - never had more than two people in there with me. I recommend the Beach Hotel character breakfast with Goofy / Minnie / ChipDale (convenient, good selection especially fruit), the Brewery restaurant on the Boardwalk(fantastic tastes, reasonable prices), and ESPN Zone (as long as you tolerate the very LOUD environment). We found the Boardwalk restaurants Flying Fish and Italian/pasta one very expensive for the small portions, and not really that unique in taste - skip them. In the Magic Kingdom, the Crystal Palace character dinner was fantastic with Pooh / Piglet / Tigger (plus dancing), and very tasty. Otherwise nothing really stood out great or bad. The Boardwalk has a small general store with reasonably priced milk (2%) / beer / wine / liquor / snacks / soup but not much else. We supplemented with an online order from Goodings supermarket. A Disney vacation is always nice, and this was no different. We found a Disney hotel to be a HUGE benefit for access / enjoyment, but pricey - it will a once in a while trip for us.

Reviews.Title: “An adults paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a place that I dream of living in all the time, a place that I can explore and marvel at its treasures, a place where serene is sublime, here you can live out a fantasy of life on the boardwalk and walk directly into EPCOT center. ESPN with its hundreds of TV screens is at your doorstep, fresh home made baked goods and restaurants galore, and then EPCOT a shoppers and diners paradise! what a way to spend some time, the service is great, the place is immaculate, the experience is most memorable and best of all, the people are NICE!

Reviews.Title: “We found our official Disney hotel forever”
Reviews.Author: breapers
Reviews.Content: The Boardwalk Inn was my 4th hotel stay at Disney and my husband's 3rd. It will also be the only place I ever stay at again. My husband and I honeymooned here and we are going back in November of this year. We loved the atmosphere, the staff, the food, the convenience. It was perfect. The scenery also made for some terrific and memorable pictures!

Reviews.Title: “one of my favorites”
Reviews.Author: smoochie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first time in March. Whole family. 11 of us. Brother and his family and my parents. I have stayed at 3 other Disney hotels and have to say that this is just as nice as others I have stayed in. The week started out not so crowded, then all you know what broke loose. Ive never seen it this crowded before. We would go to the parks every day and then back to the hotel pool. The pool was nice, but not alot of chairs and pool area space. I hate to have to save a chair, or survey the area for someone who looks like they are about to leave and then jump on them for their seats. The waterslide was great. The room was on the side of the hotel where Spoodles is. In fact our room was right above it. I know people say hotel rooms in Disney aren't that great, but it is what it is. All we did was shower and sleep there. Not bad, but the decor is not my style. Beautiful view and you could hear the ferry horns. Stayed on concierge level, which I would recommend if you have kids. We would have breakfast every morning before heading out. In the afternoon we would go in for snacks. At night we would go for cordials or a snack before bed and always they would have milk, soda, etc available. The only down side was that it seemed that the rooms were far from the pool and far from the lobby to catch the bus. Not bad if you are walking alone, but when carrying a sleeping child, far, far, far. All in all, I would stay here again, because the night life on the boardwalk was nice, and you can walk to Epcot. You are also really close to MGM.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Gathering”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter took us to the Boardwalk,,,,there were 11 of us.....four parents,,,,six children(under the age of 9),,,,and, of course,,,,me the GRANNY. We stayed on congierge level. Your website and the Cast Member's phone conversations could never do justice to the service and atmosphere of your hotel. We had a wonderful time,,at the hotel, and in the parks of DisneyWorld. As this was our first trip to DisneyWorld....now we understand why people return. And we shall return,,,but only to the Boardwalk,,,,and the next time,,,we will bring the other twelve grandchildren. And , this time,,,the Grandfather could come along. As an aside,,,,I lost my camera while there. The Lost and Found Department,,,,,,found it,,,,and mailed it to my home the next week. I am still amazed that this courtesy was given. I guess that is part of the Disney Magic. Do you know the Concierge people even took care of our Bitty Baby doll on the days that she did not go to the parks with us. You have a nice hotel there. Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Whimsical and Sumptuous!”
Reviews.Author: Elarbolita
Reviews.Content: My only complaint is how much the Boardwalk cost. Other than that, the view of the water was fabulous, check-in went smoothly, the decor was whimsical, and the staff was helpful. I especially liked the way I never got tired of the decor even after five days. It was soothing. So was the staff. It was a break from typical Disney too-much-cutesy-happiness. Every evening when we came back from the parks, we were delighted to get back to our room! The pool was warm, there was a huge, wonderful slide that even middle-aged parents could comfortably slide down, a very nice jacuzzi, and a shallow kiddie pool. I didn't like the selections on the menus at Flying Fish and Spoodles. They seemed boring compared to Artist's Point at Wilderness Lodge. We also ate at the French restaurant in Epcot and it was great. It's not far from Boardwalk. At Boardwalk, you can really save money at breakfast by eating at The Boardwalk Bakery. You can even buy cereal and milk there. Years ago we stayed at the Polynesian Resort. It was more expensive there to eat, and after a few days I got very tired of their decor and overly-friendly phoney staff.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good but not worth all that money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was on business at Disneyworld in April and was booked at the Boardwalk Inn, one of the resorts. Granted it was quite nice, but didn't really have any more on-site hotel ammenities than a Marriott, and cost about $350 more! From my vantage point, you're paying to be near Epcot Center, MGM, and have access to beach club, eateries, etc. I understand that this is Disneyworld, probably the #1 tourist destination in the country. But I figure if I'm going to spend $470 a night, I want a little more than beach club and proximity. On the upside, the place is great for families and it's near everything. The staff is nice and the rooms are clean. Still though, I'd think twice before shelling out all that money for Mickey Mouse, before you even get to the park.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further than the Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: armchair
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic and within walking distance of EPCOT and MGM. The decor is whimsical and the pool is so much fun. You are transported back to Coney Island in the "old days". At Boardwalk we were in the midst of all the action, yet our room was quiet. Our standard view room was enything but! The balcony overlooked a small lake. The jacuzzi tub was heavenly and the service top-notch. The only complaint is the bus transportation to animal kingdom is laboriously long!! This needs improvement!

Reviews.Title: “Great location to parks”
Reviews.Author: maymeburk
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Boardwalk last year, there were 10 adults and 3 children our only problem was our rooms (2 two bedroom and one studio were so far apart and some distance from the main lobby, and that there aren't any restaurants on site only outside on the Boardwalk. This year we will try Old Key West, because we couldn't get into the Yacht & Beach.

Reviews.Title: “best disney hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: london057
Reviews.Content: best disney resort ever they have the best food in all of the resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, Will return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself, brother in law and sister in law went to WDW to run in the marathon in Jan. 05. We had booked two rooms, stayed on the concierge level of BoardWallk Inn. A week before our arrival, the concierge called to see if there was anything they could do, set up priority seating,etc. I did request rooms on the quiet pool/garden view. We were told when we came through the security gate to give our name and there would be someone from concierge waiting for us. As soon as we pulled up in front, the bellmen, welcomed us, calling us by our names, Mr and Mrs. We were greeted by someone from concierge, and taken directly to the concierge floor, where we checked in. One glich was that they, somehow had us down for one room, but when we corrected them by saying our reservations were for two rooms, they quickly amended the situation. We were explained when the lounge was open, which was pretty much all the time, and the food was delicious. The concierge staff was great. They knew we were running in the marathon, and the night before made sure we had something to eat before the race. Also, the Monday after the race was our sister in law's b'day. We told the staff and they had ballons, cake and drinks ready in the room. We thought we would be charged extra, but we were not. To make it really great, which we did not know until we checked in, but our rooms faced Epcot/World Showcase. We were able to sit on our balcony, or on the concierge lounge balcony with a glass of wine and watch Illunminations. All of the staff was friendly, showed us other rooms in the concierge level, also, since we had e-tickets for our flight back, with no boarding pass, the person at the concierge desk printed out our boarding passes, and we were able to check out late. We have been visiting WDW the last ten years and have stayed at several of the deluxe resorts, and we feel that the BoardWalk was by far the best. We will definetly stay there again and again.

HotelInfo.Name: Disney's Boardwalk Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 2101 Epcot Resorts Blvd, Orlando, FL 32830-1000
